loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Soumba est la dame qui a pris la brebis en main sur la photo.
Soumba est une malienne éleveuse de moutons âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 04 enfants dont 01 fréquente l’école, leurs âges est de 07 à 04 ans. Son mari est un éleveur aussi, elle a  plus de 12 ans  d’expériences dans ce travail, elle est  analphabète. Pour bien préparer l’avenir de ses enfants elle élève des moutons qu’elle vend. Elle fait recourt au RMCR pour prendre de l’argent afin d’acheter beaucoup de moutons à élever et  pour vendre après ; Cela la donne   une satisfaction dans le travail. Le profit qu’elle tire dans le commerce de moutons  la permet de prend certaines charges familiales tels que la scolarisation, les soins médicaux et la nourriture. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux et revend dans les mêmes lieux de la zone. Elle aime l’élevage car elle gagne de profits qui la permet de s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Soumba is the woman holding a sheep in the photo.  She is 32 years old, Malian, married and mother to four children.  They are aged between four and seven years old and one of her children currently attends school.  Soumba has more than twelve years' experience in her business and her husband also raises livestock.  She cannot read or write but she sells sheep to provide a good future for her children.

Soumba works with the field partner, RMCR, to have enough money to buy many sheep to raise and sell on.  She buys the sheep from local markets and resells them in the same markets.  Her profits are used to pay for schooling, medical care and food for her household.

Soumba is very satisfied with her work as it allows her to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up and selling on.

loans.name: Industrie Netoifine

texts.en:
Frederick has shown a fascination for plants from a young age. Yet, it was in 2006 when he was unemployed and following the dermatological problems of some friends, that he decided to produce a free medicated soap to relieve their suffering. Thus, testimonials, acknowledgments and suggestions from both sides have inspired him to start a business, "Industrie Netoifine".

Now he produces two varieties of medicated soap, one based on palm kernel oil and the other on green clay; an ointment for hair growth; also a variety of flour for babies, with rice, banana and cassava.

These products are sold in Cap-Haitian and Port-au-Prince in pharmacies, the markets, and in some clinics. Thanks to the printing of the new packaging, the products look more professional.

Now Frederick plans to explore new markets and increase his production. He turned to Zafèn for a loan so he can pay for the printing of 6,000 boxes. A part-time job will be created.

loans.use: to pay for printing of 6,000 boxes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing items, footwear, and other things for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 5 años también trabaja en oficios varios, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera e vida y su hijo, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been pixelated is 29 years old and lives in a high risk area.  He has been growing corn and beans for five years.  He also works at various trades.  He sells his products at the different markets that are close to his house.  With what he gets from his sales he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He lives in his own house with his life partner and his son.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.  He will also improve the land seen in the photo.  He will do this in order to continue with his work, which generates good earnings for him.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en: Leng is a mother of six children living in the Bovel district of Battambang province. Leng is 62 years old. Leng and her husband grow rice on one hectare, raising chickens. This business earns her about 25,200KHR per day. This is Leng's second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads the group of three to get a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to rent one hectare of field to grow rice and buy rice seed and chickens to support her business. She hopes that she will earn more money to improve her life.

loans.use: to lease one hectare of field to grow rice and to buy rice seed and chickens to support her business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. The family lives in a rented house and they have access to electricity but do not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family. For eight years, Monica has been selling used clothes at the market on a retail basis and earning additional income from tailoring. Working seven days a week, her major business challenge is seasonality. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Monica aspires to buy a better sewing machine in the future to diversify her income.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, 35, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kratie province. She is a mother of three children. She overcomes her family’s hardship through rice cropping and fishing to earn extra income. This is Mom's fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans and improved her living conditions at a gradual pace. She is the group leader of a group of three members. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her yield from last year.

loans.use: To buy rice seed to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a mother of one child. She loves her family. She operates a sari-sari store to help her husband provide for her family. It is a growing business. She earns a monthly income of 3,500 PHP from her sari-sari store. She decided to borrow another loan to buy additional goods for the sari-sari store.

Jocelyn wants to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for the sari-sari store.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo, por quien ella y su esposo se están esforzando para poder sacarlo adelante.
Esta señora es muy emprendedora, teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y ella misma se encarga de venderlos ya que  la mayoría de sus hermanos viven por la Argentina, ella lleva su producto a comercializarlo, viaja una vez al mes y le resulta muy rentable su producto, hace más de 3 años que se dedica a estas actividad, gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo hacer de una vivienda propia.  
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y bastidores para tejer hamacas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laura is 23 years old. She is married and has a son, for whom she and her husband are making an effort to be able to bring him out ahead.

This lady is very enterprising. She weaves handcrafted blankets and tablecloths, and she herself is responsible for selling them since the majority of her siblings live in Argentina. She carries her products to sell, traveling one time a month, and her products have resulted in being very profitable. She has made a living from this activity for more than 3 years. Thanks to her work and effort, she was able to build her own home.

She is requesting the loan to purchase thread and frames to weave hammocks, which her customers are requesting a lot this season.

loans.use: to purchase thread and frames to weave hammocks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de pollos desde hace 15 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive con su compañera de vida, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía para seguir con sus cultivos y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been pixelated is 29 years old and lives in a high risk area.  He has been growing corn and beans for five years.  He also works at various trades.  He sells his products at the different markets that are close to his house.  With what he gets from his sales he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He lives in his own house with his life partner and his son.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.  He will also improve the land seen in the photo.  He will do this in order to continue with his work, which generates good earnings for him.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet engages in making handicraft like native hats made of pandan leaves. Pandan leaves are super fragrant and used as a  flavor ingredient and as green food coloring in Filipino Cuisine. It may be weaved into useful items like sleeping mats, small bags, place mats, trays and hats. She is married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 13 and the youngest is 2.
 
She is asking for a loan to buy romblon (pandan leaves). With these, she will be able to produce and sold more hats to her respective customers. Her income will augment her ability to provide for her children's basic needs and provide nutritious diets essential in their growing years. 

Juliet hopes to expand her current business to become sustainable and improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy pandan leaves for weaving hats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her increase milk production to meet customer demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits such as mangoes and oranges to sell and get more income

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 37 year old lady from Kisumu. She is married and supports 3 people in her family. She is blessed with 3 children.

Dorothy has a Beauty Salon in her local town, which she has operated for the last 3 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Dorothy is taking her 1st loan VISIONFUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase a blow drier and cosmetics for her shop. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

Her dream is to grow her business and become a successful entrepreneur so as to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a blow drier and cosmetics for her shop

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a Married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cherry is 43 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Cherry has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cherry requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, flour, spices, meat, fish and other ingredients needed for her food production business.

Cherry has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, flour, spices, meat, fish and other ingredients needed for her food production business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 36 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like noodles, soft drinks, bread, and other groceries.

Cristina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from manicure services.

Cristina aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like noodles, soft drinks, bread, and other groceries

loans.name: Saven's Group

texts.en: A resident from Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Savin is 43 years old. She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She grows rice on ten hectare, grows oranges on two hectares, and raises pigs. This is her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She is the leader of this group of two members. She will spend her portion of the loan to buy pig feed. She hopes that she can earn more money and provide her family with enough healthy food.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina is 37 years old. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Evangelina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Evangelina has been raising pigs for 5 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Evangelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Wayna Ccapac Group

texts.es:
La socia Ruth pertenece al banco comunal WAYNA CCAPAC ,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 28 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los demás socios agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ruth belongs to the community bank WAYNA CCAPAC, the bank is located in the province of Urubamba which belongs to the Cusco department.
She is 28 years old, has two children and is single.  She alternates her daily activities while working on agriculture.  She has been working in this business for a while and does well because of the effort she puts daily into her business.  She wants to be able to continue working to support her family. She requests a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  The other members are grateful for the loan and commit to meet the repayments scheduled.
Some members in the photo asked for authorization to be late to the meeting due to work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ethyl

texts.en:
Ethyl lives at Piat with her family. She is 30 years old, married, and has two young children. To make a living, she manages a small bakery to gain income. 

She wanted to increase her earnings but had insufficient fund to maintain her business. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to invest in her bakery. She will buy flour, milk and other ingredients for bread making. 

This will help her to maintain the good flow of her business and continue offering delicious breads within her village.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk and other ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is formed by ten farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Mary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 48 years old, is married, and has two children. Mary has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very resourceful person.

Mary isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, Mary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Mary's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of eight acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 31 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, home care products, and other groceries.

Juvelyn has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, curls, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a rural farmer in Chuka, Kenya, an area known for producing the best bananas. She is blessed with two children. Shehas been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. On her farm, Susan grows maize, has a dairy cow, and keeps poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. When she is not farming, she engages in some personal business to help supplement the income she earns. Despite her low earnings, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" she says. Susan's biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. For a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Susan formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small rural farmers. She is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Susan is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator and oven for her house

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Valientes  está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Carmen, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado bastante sus condiciones de vida a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de su peluquería y venta de prendas varias que viene haciendo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
La Sra. Carmen pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias para la venta, como ser jeans, remeras, camisas y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando cada día por mejorar.
texts.en:
The group Brave Women is in the 1st cycle of the program from the women's committee.  They are part of the poverty elimination program to improve their life conditions and their families'.
One of the members is Carmen, in her last survey she showed a poverty level three, which mean she has improved quite a bit in her life conditions through effort and continuous hard work through her hair salon and clothing sales.  She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person.  
Carmen is requesting a loan to buy items for sale, such as jeans, t-shirts, shirts and others and continue to fight each day to improve.

loans.use: to buy items for sale such as jeans, t-shirts, shirts and others.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 43-year-old man from Kisumu. He supports four people in his family. He has four children of ages between 11 and 2 years old respectively.

He offers transport services via his bicycle, a business he has been doing for the last five years, generating a monthly income of KES 8,900.

He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase another hand cart for water distribution. He will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business and educate his children.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to increase his working capital

loans.name: Faris

texts.en:
Firas is a 31-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is the father of one son. Firas works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

In the last violence on Gaza, Firas' home was destroyed completely. He now lives with his family in a rental house. 

Firas took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to rebuild his home and pay all the construction expenses he has. Firas appears in the photo

loans.use: to rebuild his home and pay all the construction expenses he has.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his working capital to purchase more stock like sugar, salt, bar soap, and more chairs

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 46 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising goats in the Philippines. Dioscora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her goats.

Dioscora has been raising goats for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her goats.

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en:
Genevive is 31 years old and married with one child who is in school. Genevive works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like bread, home care products, and other groceries.

Genevive has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Genevive would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like bread, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 30 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Rodelyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Rodelyn aspires to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Chamroeun  is 35 years old, a married factory worker with seven children living in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. He has worked in the factory in a nearby province since 2011. Three of his children attend school. His wife is a 35-year-old factory worker. He and his wife can earn approximately $10 each day. 

Chamroeun’s present house is old and he would like to buy construction materials to renovate it and buy more soil to fill the yard around his house. He doesn’t have enough finances, so he needs a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have a proper house for his family for living. In the future, he wants to support his children to earn high education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate his house and buy more soil to fill the yard around his house

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea is a 44-year-old married factory worker with three children in her care. She lives in a community in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia.

Sothea has been working in the factory for over three years. Two of her children are in school. Her husband is 27 years old and he is a worker. The family can make approximately $13 a day.

Sothea is requesting a loan because she would like to buy construction materials to build a proper house. With this loan, she will be able to have a proper house and live in better conditions. For her three children, she is going to support them to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a proper house.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 31 years old. He is married with one child who is 2 years old. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 11 years, while his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell it. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell it.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a widowed woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 65 years old now.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Felicitas has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mwako's Group

texts.en:
Mwako is a 40-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Mwako has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Mwako described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Mwako’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marciana works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Marciana is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Marciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 58 years old. He is married with 4 children between 10 and 37 years old. They all go to school.

He is a farmer and he has been farming for the past 25 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees for his children and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Ntinjitinji Group

texts.en:
Falida is 33 years old and has three children; they all dropped out of school because of the problems their family was facing. Falida started selling plastic shoes and tomatoes in her community in order to find funds for supporting her family. 

She will use the loan to buy more items necessary for her business. She runs her business with her children but she plans to send them back to school when she gets enough capital. She has managed to build her own house from the profits that she made from the previous loans.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes

loans.name: Ti's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Battambang province, Ti is 60 years old and a mother of five dependent children. Nowadays, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn more income via grocery items selling. 

This is not her first time for Ti with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She leads a group of six members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay the  plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family condition to be better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay the  plowing fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow to enable him to meet the increasing demand for milk.

loans.name: Zhypar

texts.ru: Жыпар, 57 лет, вдова, мать 6 детей, с ней живут двое младших. У Жыпар среднее образование, она на пенсии. Также много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Жыпар на сегодняшний день имеется корова, 2 овцы. На участке мерою 0,96 Га она выращивает кукурузу, картофель и помидоры. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян картофеля и овец. Она является одной из трех участниц группы "Ынтымак". Доходы от кредита Жыпар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и постройку дома.
texts.en: Zhypar is 57 years old, a widow, and the mother of six. Her two youngest children live with her. Zhypar has secondary education; she is now receiving a state pension. For many years she has also been raising livestock and growing farm crops. Thanks to Zhypar's hard work, she now owns a cow and two sheep. She grows corn, potatoes and tomatoes on a land plot of 0.96 ha [2.4 acres]. Her monthly revenue is about 15,000 KGS. Zhypar has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy fertilizers and potato seeds as well as sheep. She is one of the three members of the Yuntymak group. Zhypar plans to invest her revenues from the loan in a further development in a business as well as the construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers in order to grow eco-friendly potatoes and also to buy sheep.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis tiene 42 años, su esposa  la señora Maura  de 36 años quien la ayuda en el negocio, el matrimonio tiene hijos menores en edad escolar, por quienes ambos se están esforzando para que ellos puedan tener un futuro sin privaciones ni necesidades.
Él es una persona muy emprendedora y quiere seguir creciendo y luchando. Pide este préstamo para la compra de enlatados y artículos de limpieza, verduras y frutas para poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando de esa forma y continuando con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old. His wife is Maura, age 36, who helps in the business.  The couple has three young school-age children, for whom both put forth a great effort so that they can have a future without hardships or needs.

He is a very enterprising person, and he wants to keep growing and fighting.  He is requesting this loan to purchase canned goods, cleaning items, vegetables, and fruits to be able to carry on with his sales.  In this way, he fights on and continues with sales.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cleaning items, vegetables, and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Syrley

texts.es:
La Señora Syrley está casada, tiene un  hijo,  y comenta que con la ayuda de su esposo  en las ventas  salen adelante y se ayudan los unos a los otros. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas varias, y comenta que se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 10 años. Cuentan con una importante  clientela  formada.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Syrley is married, has a son and with the help of her husband selling they keep getting ahead and help each other.  She sells different types of clothing and has done this for more than 10 years.  She has a well formed clientele.
She requests the loan to buy a variety of clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, pants and others and continue with her sales as she has been in the past.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants and others

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 30-year-old lady from Kisumu County which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Oscar who also supports their family by providing income and they have two children who are six and three years old respectively.

She has a retail shop where she sells electronics which has been operating for the last six years and generates a monthly income of KES 30,000. She has applied for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase electronic items to boost her stock. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to live a better life and support the needy.

loans.use: to purchase electronic items to boost her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase the milk supply for more income.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Alice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Alice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Alice's Group will be able to receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 52 years old and married with one child.

Ma. Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Elena has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Ma. Elena aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun, 30, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kratie province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school, while the other one is too young. 

She can earn income via growing cashews and rice. She has been involved in this business for 12 years, and it earns her about 33,900 KHR per day. 

For Sokun, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to purchase fertilizer to support her cashew farm. She hopes that she can get more income than before.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to support her cashew farm.

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kratie province, Eang is 37 years old. She is a mother of four dependent children, two of whom are in school, and two others are too young. For a living, she grows tobacco and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She can earn income of about 39,700 KHR per day. 

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle and support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farm.

loans.name: Bongiwe

texts.en:
At only 23, Bongiwe is a single parent of two children aged 5 and 2. She has been working as a part-time saleslady, but has identified an opportunity to start her own business as a bottle dealer.

She is requesting a loan to buy used bottles from her community, which she will then sell to an industrial recycling plant. The loan will also help secure transport, as she will be able to hire a pick-up truck for making the deliveries. Having a truck will increase her capacity and lead to increased revenue.

Bongiwe plans to eventually open her own local recycling plant within her community. She says this will provide income to people in her area; apart from employing people, she will buy the bottles from ordinary members of the community, thereby giving them a revenue stream. 

Through this business, Bongiwe hopes to train and teach members of her community the importance of recycling and managing waste so as to provide a cleaner environment.

loans.use: to buy used bottles

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and two of them go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from poultry farming. 

She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama LA ESPERANZA están en el 2do. ciclo con 17 integrantes, todas son mujeres de zonas rurales, que trabajan la tierra, crían animales y vende productos derivados de ellos, son de una zona eminentemente rural.
La Sra. Fatima, quien que además de criar animales,  también se desempeña como empleada doméstica, es una señora muy guapa y decidida a progresar cada día más y poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, con lo cual podrá seguir esforzándose para poder luchar y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The La Esperanza committee is in its second cycle with 17 members. All of the members are women from rural areas who work in farming, raising animals, and selling their byproducts. They are from a very rural area.

Fatima, who is employed as a domestic worker in addition to raising animals, is a beautiful woman dedicated to progressing more every day and being able to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying nutritious food for her animals. This will allow her to make an effort to fight and improve her life.

loans.use: to buy nutritious food for animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Humble and hardworking – that’s Eunice. She is a real fighter of a woman who has dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her children. Her primary sources of income are milk, vegetables and farming. Eunice hails from Kapsowar, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns that boost crop production in the area. 

Eunice, being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things, would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. Being a hardworking mother, Eunice has always ensured putting food on the table for her family. She also ensures she is able to take her children to school. 

Eunice detests living in conditions of poverty, and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking a loan of 63,100 KES in order to be able to purchase a dairy cow. This will help in producing milk and manure to be used on her farm. Milk from the cow will be sold to the local market, and this means improved cash flow. The improved cash flow means that profits will be higher, and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her kids to school. 

Through your loan, Eunice will be empowered economically and will be able to improve her standards of living and those of people living within the area. Eunice is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 40-year-old married woman with twelve children, 5 attend school.. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has had a fishing business for 6 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng, lives in Kampong Cham province  and is a 44-year-old woman with three children. She grows cassava as the main source of income and grows rubber to supplement her income. She can earn  about 40,300 KHR per day. 

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid  her previous loans completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay  labor costs. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay  labor costs.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 32 years old, married, and father of three children. He has operated a wholesale business for the four years and earns  6,000 KES per month.

Douglas has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow. He plans to use the generated profits to educate his children.

His future hopes are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 4 children who attend school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

She operates a grocery in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 12 years and works seven days a week. She earns additional income from roasting maize and sweet potatoes. 

She has requested 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, and flour.  Her major challenge include the changing seasons and transportation. 

Her goal  is to educate her children to the university level and buy a van to transport her merchandise. She lives in her own house and the family has access to running water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, and flour.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan  in 1993. In Tajikistan, girls are married when they are young. Munira is married and her husband is a taxi driver. She has farmed for 1 year and grows watermelons and melons. She wants to have a good harvest this season. She needs to buy fertilizer and seeds to make her land better for planting. 

She requests a loan from KIVA lenders to buy seeds and fertilizer. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 62-year-old married man.  He and his wife, Jane, and are blessed with five children between the ages of 28 and 18. He has been a farmer for the  30 years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Joseph has applied for his first loan (25,000 KES) with VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow.

He plans to use gained profits to educate his children and expand his agricultural sector through adding other cash crops such as tea and coffee.

His hopes to have financial stablility.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Naiky's Group

texts.en:
An older woman living in Kratie province, Naiky is 58 years old and a mother of six children. For her living, she can earn income via fishing and pig raising. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 37,800 KHR per day. 

This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fishing net. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's conditions to get better than last year.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Soemath

texts.en:
Soemath, 41, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province. She has two children, one attends school and other one is too young. 

She grows cassava and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for a long while and earns 43,300 KHR per day. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid  her previous loan. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farmland and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en:
Jenelie is a 34-year-old single woman who has run a general store for 1 year. She requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Jenelie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is a  54-year-old married woman 3 children  between the ages of 13 and 30. They all go to school. She is a farmer and  has  grown rice for 30 years. Her husband is a business man. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay workers.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Nhor is a 53-year old farmer with five children. She grows rice and works for others for a fee. She  earns about 9.8 USD per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to buy a decent motor to support her business. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a decent motor to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Seanlai's Group

texts.en:
Seanlai is a 38-year-old mother of two children, one attends school and other one is too young. 

She weaves silk skirt ( called Hol) and grows rice. She works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for a long while and earns her about 40,300 KHR per day. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous loan. She leads a 2-member group land will spend her  loan to buy more silk and pay plowing costs. She hopes that she can earn more income to provide an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more silk and pay  plowing costs.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 34-year-old married homemaker who lives in the Kandal province, Cambodia. She has a young t child who attends school. Her husband is a 35-year-old construction worker and he earns about $8 each day. 

Sokha  requests a loan to buy construction materials to build a ground-floor room. This loan will enable her to have more space for the family to live in. In the future, she hopes that her husband will become a construction foreman and support her child to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a ground-floor room.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and three go to school.

She has been selling charcoal in the market for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Saidat's challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. She joined MCDT because of the school fees, loan products and the relatively low interest charged on loans.

She resides in her own house with access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Chhunheng's Group

texts.en:
Chhunheng is 50 years old and lives with family members in the Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are still dependent on her. 

She overcomes her family’s hardship through growing rice and fishing. She has been involved in her business for 32 years and it earns her family about 37,800KHR per day. This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. Chhunheng leads the group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more money to update her lifestyle and to support her children to attend university.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seed to support her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more silk and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 49 years old and is married with eight children aged between 8 and 29 years old. Six of her children go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past 25 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Saveth's Group

texts.en:
A resident in the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Saveth is 61 years old. To support his family, he grows rice and cassava as their main source of his income. He has been involved in this business for ten years and it earns him about 23,300KHR per day. 

For Saveth, this is his second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loan. He leads the group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his loan portion to plow the field and buy fertilizer and seed to support his business. He hopes that he can expand his current business and get more money to improve his family's living conditions to be better than before.

loans.use: to plow the field and buy fertilizer and seed to support his business.

loans.name: Sultonbegim

texts.en: Sultonbegim is a hardworking, responsible and generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan, in a small village, in 1970. She is married and has three children. She has more than ten years of experience in trading kid’s clothes. Sultonbegim is planning to buy shoes and clothes for kids to enlarge her turnover. She requests a loan from KIVA lenders to buy new goods. She is hoping to be supported.

loans.use: to buy kid’s shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Elena pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de auto partes de automóviles, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra faros entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Todos Unidos” (Everyone Together). She continues to manage her business of selling auto parts. Rosa Elena is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments. She is a responsible and diligent individual. By working in this manner, she is able to help her family get ahead.

Rosa Elena is requesting a loan in order to buy headlights and other products.

loans.use: to buy headlights and other products.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old. She is married with three children. She runs a greengrocery business and has been in business for eight years. Her monthly income is 8,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase potatoes, cabbages, kale and tomatoes for sale. She plans to use the profits to educate her children. In the future she wants to transform her open-air business into a shop.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages, kale, tomatoes and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, which will increase his income from the supply of milk to his customers.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 37 years old and is a single mother of three children. She has had a hotel business for 14 years and it has been profitable. 

Charity will be using the loan to purchase rice, flour and cooking oil for use in the business, and she hopes this will enable her to serve many customers and make more income to help her pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour and cooking oil for use in her business.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 40 years old and is married. With one child in school, Marisa works very hard to provide for her family.

Marisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries. Marisa has been in her business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, curls and other groceries. 

In the future, Marisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en:
Beathe is aged 55 years. She is married with seven children aged between 10 and 26 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been growing rice for the past 37 years. Also, her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 50 years old and is widowed with five children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Thelma has been farming sugarcane for twenty years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Thelma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jesus  David

texts.es: Jesus de 18 años de edad es el propietario de un café internet donde ofrece los servicios de telecomunicaciones fotocopiajes e impresiones. Su experiencia emprendedora inició cuando tenía 14 años y su padre y inició este negocio, para que Jesus diera los primeros pasos de su mano. En la actualidad trabaja 12 horas diarias y está muy entusiasmado en modernizar constantemente su negocio haciendo remodelaciones de su equipamiento. Su meta es terminar estudios superiores y hacer crecer su negocio, pero su principal desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará computadores para ampliar su infraestructura física y tecnológica. Con esta inversión Jesus logra mejorar sus condiciones de negocio en cuanto a actualización se refiere, para ganar poco a poco muchos más consumidores de sus productos, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Jesus, who is 18 years old, is the owner of an internet cafe where he offers telecommunication, photocopy, and printing services. His entrepreneurial experience began when he was 14 years old and his father and him started this business, for which Jesus drove the first steps. Currently he works 12 hours a day and is very excited about constantly modernizing his business, making renovations on his equipment.  

His goal is to finish higher education and make his business grow, but his main challenge is having sufficient working capital to achieve it. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing he has done, through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which he will buy computers to expand his physical and technological infrastructure. With this investment, Jesus will achieve in improving his business conditions with regard to what he is referring to now, to little by little earn bring in more consumers of his products, that way making his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy computers to expand his physical and technological infrastructure

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 35 years old. She is married with two children between three and seven years old. They both go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past five years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for her rice. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María, necesita de otro crédito para invertir en elotes, papas, yuca, queso, aderezos, etc., para elaborar tostadas, papas fritas, elotes locos entre otros antojitos que vende en las ferias de su pueblo, espera aprovechar la próxima temporada de buenas ventas.
Con el crédito anterior ha tenido materia prima para que su negocio siga en el mercado y tenga más clientes satisfechos, su familia tiene una vida más digna y tiene un buen record créditicio.
texts.en:
María needs another loan so that she can invest in corn, potatoes, cassava, cheese, seasonings, and other supplies for making tostadas, potato chips, roasted corn on the cob, and other street foods that she sells at the fairs in her town. She hopes to take advantage of the upcoming season in order to generate good sales.

With her previous loan, María was able to acquire supplies for her business so that she could remain in the market and keep her customers satisfied. Her family has a more decent life and she has built up a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy corn, potatoes, cassava, cheese, seasonings, and other supplies for preparing the street food that she sells at the fairs.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado y es padre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes y viven aparte, en su casa solo vive con su esposa.

Esteban, trabaja en una finca de café desde hace 10 años.- Anteriormente, tenia un patrón que le apreciaba mucho y le vendió la finca a bajo costo, desde ese momento él se dedico por completo al cuidado de ella, cuando obtiene la cosecha la vende y le genera buenos ingresos, también en su tiempo libre se dedica a la agricultura.

Esteban, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para la temporada de siembra de granos básicos.

Esteban, sueña con mejorar su finca para tener mejores cosechas y mejores ingresos para darle a su familia mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esteban studied through the second grade. He is married and the father of three children who are independent and live on their own. Estaban and his wife live by themselves.

Esteban worked on a coffee farm for 10 years. The previous owner greatly appreciated him and sold the farm to him at a low cost. From that moment, Esteban decided to devote himself full-time to the care of the farm. He sells his harvested crops and is able to generate a good income. Esteban spends his free time farming as well.

He needs a loan in order to buy farming supplies since it is the season for planting basic staple crops. Esteban dreams of improving his farm so that he can achieve better harvests and generate more income in order for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for the planting season.

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
A single man living in Kampong Cham province, Kea is 24 years old. To support his living conditions, he grows cassava on one hectare of land. He has been involved this business for two years and it earns him about 22,800 KHR per day. 

For Kea, this is his second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully repaid his past loan, which he used wisely to improve his living conditions at a gradual pace. He now leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, Kea will spend his entire loan portion to pay for land fees. He hopes that he can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to pay for land fees.

loans.name: Theavy

texts.en:
A mother of four dependent children living in Kratie province, Theavy is 30 years old. Nowadays, she needs to support three children, two of whom are in school, and the other one is too young. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping and growing beans. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 27,000 KHR per day. 

For Theavy, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farm.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en: Rom, 27, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and one who is too young. She earns income to support her family via motor-repairing, and works for others for a fee to earn more income. For Rom, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more motor materials to support her business. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family better than before.

loans.use: To buy more motor materials to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Dy is 30 years old. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school; the other one is too young. For support her family’s living, she grows rice as their main source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 29,000 KHR per day. 

This is Dy's fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. Now in a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for harvesting fees. She hopes that she can get more income to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for harvesting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Phumla Patience

texts.en:
Phumla is 27 years old and lives in Soweto with her 8-year-old son, her mother and two siblings. She is the oldest, and so the responsibility of supporting the family rests on her shoulders.

Phumla, together with her sister have identified a business opportunity that will help improve their family’s lives. Phumla sources empty bottles from local pubs as well as neighbourhood shops, after which she cleans the bottles, packs them and sells them to a recycling firm where they are weighed and priced accordingly. 

She needs a loan to buy four large containers that can hold much more bottles compared to the sisal sacks that the business currently uses. In addition, part of the loan will also help secure transport as they will be able to hire a pick-up truck for delivering to the recycling plant. 

Phumla is passionate about her community. She is smart and ambitious and hopes to create channels for her community to benefit through this project.

loans.use: to buy four large containers for washing bottles for recycling.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Guadalupe  está en el 4º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el cual pueden conocer su situación de vida, para poder ir mejorándola.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estelina ella  es cliente de la Fundación,  se desempeña como directora general del grupo,  se dedica a la repostería y venta de bocaditos salados,  tiene varias operaciones canceladas, es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora, que quiere salir adelante para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, huevos, carne y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, como lo viene haciendo. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
The group “Virgen de Guadalupe” is in its fourth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are participating in the poverty elimination program so that they can become familiar with their living situations and be able to improve.

One of the members is Sra. Estelina. She is a client of Fundación Paraguaya and also serves as the general director of her group. Estelina makes desserts and also sells salty snacks. She has had various projects that she has completed. Estelina is a hardworking individual, but most importantly she is extremely enterprising. She wants to get ahead so that she can make something out of her lfie.

Estelina is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of flour, eggs, meat, and other supplies so that she can continue her sales just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can make something out of her life.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, meat, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
Sanavbar is a wise woman. She is from the northern part of Tajikistan and lives in a small village. She was born in 1958. She has been divorced since 2009. 

Sanavbar runs a business of trading products and women's traditional clothes (textile). She has many years of experience of communicating with customers and tries to be as gentle as possible. Sanavbar serves each client very well and attracts lots of satisfied clients. She needs to enlarge her business in order to have a profit from her business. It will be good for her to earn more because she has a bad standard of living. She is a hero woman, because to have a business in rural place in Tajikistan is the best progress that women do. She requested a loan to buy products and womens clothes and awaits KIVA lenders support.

loans.use: to buy products and women's clothes.

loans.name: Ziadah

texts.en:
Ziadah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

Ziadah sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years, and works six days a week. She has requested for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major challenge includes seasonality of used clothes. 

Her goal and aspiration is to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to get money to educate her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to satisfy her customers in milk supply.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 54 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Merlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, rice, home-care products, and other groceries.

Merlinda has been in this business for 27 years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, rice, home-care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en:
Godelive, 51, is married with 2 children ages 25 and 31. They both go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past 32 years. Her husband is a business man. 

With this loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers and to also pay her workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay workers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 43-year-old married woman with eight children, six of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sarah has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Sarah has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 36 years old. He is married with two children who are one and five years old and do not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 16 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer for his rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his rice.

loans.name: Silvena

texts.en:
Silvena is 42 years old and married with six children. With four of her children in school, Silvena works very hard to provide for them.

Silvena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Silvena has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Silvena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Sokken's Group

texts.en:
A resident from the Chhloung district of Kratie province, Sokken is 40 years old and a mother of two dependent children. One of her children is in school and the other one is too young to attend school. 

To support her family, Sokken grows rice and raises cows. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. For Sokken, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads the group of three members to get a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her rice farm to get more yields and earn more money than before.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Sophana

texts.en:
Residing in Kratie province, Sophana is 38 years old and a mother of six children. She grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for 20 years, and it earns her about 16,700 KHR per day. 

For Sophana, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her entire loan portion. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's conditions better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Reverie

texts.en:
Reverie is 33 years old and is married with one child, aged 3. Reverie is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past nine years; his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan form Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy cattle.
