The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Senghorn's Group

texts.en:
A resident in the Chhloung district of Kratie province, Senghorn is 43 years old and the mother of three dependent children. For her living, she grows cassava and rice as their main source of income. With her current business, she can earn approximately 37,600KHR per day. 

This is Senghorn's second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as she has fully repaid her past loan. As the group leader of two members, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to get more yields and earn more money than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

loans.name: Tinas' Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kratie province, Tinas is 47 years old and a mother of four children. To support her living conditions, she sells grocery items and grows cassava to earn more income. 

For Tinas, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is aged 49 years. She is married with five children aged between 7 and 25 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been growing rice for the past 19 years. Also, her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice and sell it. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow rice and sell it.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: A mother of two young children living in Kampong Cham province, Ly is 30 years old. To overcome her family’s hardships, she grows rice and cassava as the main source of income. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland so it is bigger than it was before.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel was born and brought up in Homa Bay County.  He is married with two kids. He is planning to put up a toilet near a school.

His intention is to improve sanitation around his residential area and the school as well. He learned about the Fresh Life toilet through a friend who is an operator. The area has high human traffic, hence it will bring in a lot of income to Samuel.

He is planning to expand in the future and also use the income from the Fresh Life toilet to improve his life and educate his kids.

loans.use: to pay for two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who started four years ago selling cosmetics, make-up, and lingerie from her house to help her husband cover the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Nadia is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying her best to develop her business. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partners Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and lingerie to satisfy her customers' needs.
 
Nadia hopes to expand her business in the future through opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and lingerie

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old married father of four children and a Palestinian refugee. 

Fifteen years ago, he started working in farming to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Ali is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business, thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy fertilizers and plants.

Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of satisfying his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plants.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 46-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for two sons and one daughter. Salah works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income, which is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. 

During the recent violence in Gaza, Salah's home has been completely destroyed. He now lives with his family in a rental house.Salah took a USD loan from FATEN which will help him to rebuild his home and pay all of the construction expenses.
 
Salah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his home and pay all of the construction expenses.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and is blessed with 4 children. She has been a dairy farmer for the past 24 years and earns a monthly income of  KES 8,000. 

Josephine has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya in order to buy a dairy cow.  This will enable her to make enough money to educate her children through to the higher levels of education.

She plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and expand her agricultural sector. In the future, she hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth engages in making boat outriggers made of bamboo. She is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, ages 10, 7 and 6 years old, respectively. In addition to that, she also engages in a poultry raising business. She grows and sells chicken. 

She is asking for a loan to buy poultry feeds and pay for maintenance. These will help Elizabeth raise and sell more chickens. Her income will be augmented and her sales improved. She could now prepare healthy diets for the whole family. She could now be able to invest in any possible business venture to improve the family's status of living.

She could now continue financing the education of all her children and provide them with basic needs, and she is determined to expand her current sources of income to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and pay for maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feed, animal licks and parasiticide

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a very hardworking person who, thanks to her daily effort, has achieved getting her children ahead, providing them a good quality education. 

Janet has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has engaged in another small personal business. 

The Chuka area is very populated, and demand for poultry products, including eggs, is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She says the most enjoyable part of poultry farming is, “The increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the high demand. 

She lacks the funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy poultry. It is very challenging for a woman to access funds but, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved to know that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. 

Through this loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and the local market, and this will translate into increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, Janet intends to accumulate more profits and broaden her poultry business to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. She will use the extra income to fully repay the loan, change her living conditions and secure the future of her family and siblings.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 61 years old. She is married with three children aged between 35 and 40 years. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past 30 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a woman eager to get ahead. She is a 51-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is blessed with a lovely family who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide them with a better future. 

Jane was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living. Jane has space on her farm to use for dairy farming, so she respectfully requests a loan to buy a dairy cow. 

Kapsowar is an area that has a large population and there is a high demand for milk. Jane, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business. Jane plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and to package milk. She wants to be economically empowered. She knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions. Jane patiently awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leider Luis

texts.es:
Leider es un productor agrícola de la zona de tierra alta, su actividad principal la centra en la cría de ganado porcino, en unas impecables cocheras que el mismo construyo adecuándolas para mitigar el riesgo de enfermedades o muertes por el clima.
Leider aprendió de su negocio gracias a su padre, la nacer en una familia de campo tuvo mucha cercanía con estas actividades y decidió hacer de la cría de cerdos la actividad con la que busca mantener a su familia que la conforma su pareja y su pequeña de 1.5 años de edad, su sueño es poder mantener su negocio en el tiempo, para poder ser el soporte que quiere ser para su familia.
Leider Solicita un préstamo el cual quiere invertir en la compra de salvado, porcinos y cuido.
texts.en:
Leider is a farmer who lives in the District of Tierra Alta. His main business activity is raising pigs in some of the most remarkable pens ever built. These structures protect the animals from the risk of illness or death as a result of the weather.

Leider learned this business from his father. He was born into a farming family and was able to see these activities up-close. Leider decided to raise pigs in order to support his family, which consists of his partner and his daughter who is 1½ years old. His dream is to maintain his business over time so that it will be the foundation for his family.

Leider is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of pigs and bran, but also pay for the care of the animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and bran, but also pay for the care of the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Jenelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jenelita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Jenelita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies for her fishing business.

Jenelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies for her fishing business.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 55-year-old married mother of seven children.

She has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years, with the help of her husband. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life, good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers.

loans.name: Shahista

texts.en:
Shahista is a 51-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. 

Shahista is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya is a 35-year-old married mother of five children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc.

loans.name: Sreypok's Group

texts.en:
Sreypok, a farmer living in Chhloung district of Kratie province, is 27 years old and the mother of two children. Both of them are dependent on her. She struggles for a living via growing rice and working for others for a fee. 

For Sreypok, this is her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. In this group of three members, she is the leader. She will use her loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can expand her current business and earn more money than before.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
En el grupo La Esperanza las 17 mujeres son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, ellas son muy entusiastas y trabajadoras, están en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, con el cual ellas están esperanzadas de poder mejorar.
Maria, una de las integrantes de este grupo, comenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas varias y frescas. Es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora que quiere poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Sueña con poder tener un puesto de venta para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras varias para la venta, como ser manzanas, bananas, naranjas, y otras frutas para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group “La Esperanza” (The Hope) includes 17 hardworking, determined, and enthusiastic women. They are participating in their first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program in hopes that they can improve.

Maria is one of the members of this group. She says that she sells various types of fresh fruits. Maria is a self-sacrificing and determined woman who wants to help her family and loved ones. She dreams of having a vending post so that she can continue helping her family.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of different fruits and vegetables that she can sell such as apples, bananas, oranges, and other produce. As a result, she can continue her sales just as before.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, oranges, and other produce.

loans.name: Acevedo

texts.es: ACEVEDO: Es originario de la comunidad de Ulwas, que en mayagna significa “Pura Agua”, se localiza a 5 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam Río Coco. Es maestro mayagna que trabaja en una escuela rural. Tiene 36 años de edad, casado con 4 hijos: El mayor de 6 años estudia su primer grado de primaria y 3 menores de edad. Desde  hace 30 años habitan en una casa construida de madera y de tambo, que actualmente necesita reparación.  Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para cambiar la madera de la pared y los postes de madera, y comprar también clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. El y su esposa sueñan con tener en un futuro una casa de concreto que tenga mejores condiciones para sus hijos y sobre todo mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Acevedo is originally from the community of Ulwas, which means “Pure Water” in the Mayangna language. The community is located five kilometers outside of the town of Waspam Río Coco.

Acevedo is of Mayangna descent and works as a teacher at a rural school. He is 36 years old, married, and has four children. The oldest child is six years old and in the first grade, while the three other children are younger. From the time he was 30, Acevedo has lived in a wooden stilt house that is currently in need of repair. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can replace the wood in the walls and the wooden posts. He will also buy nails and cover the cost of labor.

In the future, Acevedo and his wife dream of having a concrete house so that they can provide better conditions for their children, but most of all, greater security.

loans.use: to pay for lumber, wooden posts, nails, and labor in order to repair his home.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 44 years old, married, and has three children. 

Rosanna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Rosanna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 42-year-old married woman. 

Tahira has a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to pay for her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité OÑONDIVEPA, es un comité de mujeres muy trabajadoras con metas propuestas que alcanzar con esfuerzos propios, para poder llevar una vida digna y sana a lado de sus familiares y seres queridos. Ellas son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona eminentemente rural, donde cada una se esfuerza por poder ir mejorando cada día.
La Sra. Georgina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, y con ello lucha por tener los medios necesarios para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Georgina está esforzándose cada día por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Ella pude este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas para la venta, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones, y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank OÑONDIVEPA, is a communal bank of very hard-working women with proposed goals that they reach with their own efforts, to be able to live a dignified and healthy life with their relatives and loved ones. They are from the city of Santaní, a prominently rural zone, where each of them works to be able to continue improving every day. 

Georgina is one of the members of this group. She makes a living selling various clothing items, and that way she fights to have the necessary means to be able to give her loved ones all that she could not have. Georgina is working every day to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family. 

She asked for his loan to be able to invest it in buying clothing to sell, like shirts, jeans, blouses, pants, and other items, with which she will be able to continue her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, blouses, pants, and other items

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Alice. She is a 54-year-old woman who has been a farmer for 36 years. She is based in Kimulondo village, where she has a two-acre farm and a small house made out of earth, with two habitable rooms. On the farm, she grows vegetables that she uses for both consumption and sale. This business has enabled her to raise nine children. Alice's own upbringing was so difficult that she never had the privilege of attending school. 

Alice is seeking a loan to venture into commercial poultry farming. With the loan, she will acquire a brood of hens that will lay eggs for food, sale and hatching. This business is projected to significantly increase her income. The birds will also bring life into her home, as they will be free-range and scratch the earth for bugs. The money from the investment will enable Alice to afford basic needs and save up for the future. This loan will go a long way in empowering her to become a better entrepreneur and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sarah works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood. Sarah is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice for her business.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura, requiere de un nuevo financiamiento que en esta ocasión le ayudara a tener recursos para comparar dos cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, de esa manera los engordara y recuperara la inversión con mejores ganancias.
El préstamo anterior le dio la oportunidad de tener todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para cultivar granos básicos, los resultados no fueron favorables debido al mal clima, los ingresos no han cambiado mucho y su familia se mantiene saludable, con el objetivo de mejorar el negocio ha pensado practicar la comercialización de cerdos.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is requesting a new loan. On this occasion, the loan will give her the resources to buy two pigs and concentrated feed for their diet. This will allow the pigs to gain weight so that she can recoup her investment as a result of better earnings.

Her previous loan gave her the opportunity to acquire all of the farming supplies that she needed to cultivate basic staple crops. The results were not favorable due to bad weather. However, her income did not change much and her family remained healthy. She plans to sell pigs with the goal of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 31years old and is married with one child, aged 4. Jean Paul is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past 11 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his child.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Clery Yolanda

texts.es:
Clery es una mujer de campo y madre de 3 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido reiniciar su negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Clery is a rural woman who is the mother of three children. She has had to endure many hardships in life, but she has always found the strength to press forward and continue making progress with her family. For quite some time, she has wanted to restart her business of raising and selling chickens. Clery is seeking financial encouragement so that she can buy a few chickens to raise and materials for building a coop.

With this new business, she can generate income for her family. This means everything to her and she will be able to improve the quality of life for her husband and children. She will work every day in order to boost her business and turn it into a sustainable and profitable activity.

Support this hardworking woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a few chickens to raise and materials for building a coop.

loans.name: Al Saiid Group

texts.en:
Ramonda is the featured borrower for Al Saiid Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Ramonda is a 20-year-old single lady who has worked in a beauty salon for four years to cover her needs and expenses. Besides her work, she is also continuing her studies. Ramonda is an ambitious lady and a hard worker who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university tuition fees. This loan will help Ramonda build a better independent future.

Ramonda is the the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Amira is the second lady on the left, Jina is the second lady on the right, and Samira is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing and curtains for resale.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en:
Mastona is an honest, goal-oriented and hardworking woman. She was born in a rural area in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1991. She is married and has one child. Mastona grew up in an agrarian family and was taught to work with land and cattle. She has good conditions of keeping livestock. 

Mastona and her husband are busy with keeping livestock and working in agriculture. She has a plan to renovate her house and have good conditions for living. Mastona tried to save up money from the harvest and selling cattle, but unfortunately the season was too rainy and she could not gain a good harvest. That is why her plan to renovate her house was stopped. Her husband fled to Russia to earn some money. Her income from agriculture was spent on family expenditures only. She decided to find additional income through sewing traditional dresses for women. She hopes that the business will be prosperous and help her to keep her family. She is asking for financial support to buy construction supplies to renovate her house. Mastona is hoping to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate her house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and is married with four children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for 23 years. His monthly income is 15,000 KES.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. He plans to use the profits to improve his house and to educate his children. 

In the future, John hopes to become a dairy farmer and have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 51 years old and is married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from selling purified water. Lolita has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Lolita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 40 years old and is married with eight children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries. Violeta has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from fishing.

Violeta aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia’s husband (also shown in the photo) has successfully built his business of rickshaw driving with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. 

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, he was able to provide better services to his passengers and make a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Now Nazia is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied a loan of 55,000 PKR for her husband for repair and maintenance of his rickshaw. This will enable him to provide better services to his passengers and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: and her husband to pay for the repair and maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, aged 31, is running a food stall in her street with the support of her husband. She makes delicious ‘gol gappy’ which is a popular street food in Pakistan. It consists of a round, hollow puri (ball), fried crisp and filled with a mixture of flavored water ("pani"), tamarind chutney, chili, chaat masala, potato, onion and chickpeas. It is generally small enough to fit completely into one's mouth. She is expert in making it and has three years experience. She has worked hard to gain popularity and recognition within her town. 

With the increase in the price of vegetables and lentils, Shazia was barely able to produce enough to make a good sale. Therefore in order to increase her sales, she needs to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices etc. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices etc. for making gol gappy to sell.

loans.name: Yokutkhon

texts.ru: Ёкутхон 41 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она занимается полеводством и разведением скота, начав этот бизнес 21 год назад. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день, Ёкутхон имеет в хозяйстве корову и 0,20 Га земли, где установлена теплица, в которой растут картофель, огурцы, помидоры, капуста. Деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ёкутхон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и помидоров, минеральных удобрений, на часть средств она планирует приобрести коров. Ёкутхон является лидером группы "Канал", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита Ёкутхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее теплицы и накопить на ремонт своего дома.
texts.en:
Yokutkhon is 41, married, and is raising three children.  Her family's main source of income comes from growing crops and raising livestock.  She started this business 21 years ago.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has a cow and 0.20 hectares of land with a greenhouse for growing potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes and cabbage.  Her business activities bring in a monthly income of 15,000 som.

For the future development of her business, Yokutkhon has requested a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy potato and tomato seeds, as well as mineral fertilizers; she also plans on using some of the money to buy cows.  Yokutkhon is the leader of the Kanal group, which consists of two other people apart from herself.  There are three members in all.  Yokutkhon plans on putting her extra income due to the loan towards the future development of her greenhouse, and also wants to set aside money to renovate her home.

loans.use: buy potato and tomato seeds, fertilizers to grow organic vegetables in her greenhouse, and cows to bolster her herd

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.en:
Marcelline is aged 50 years. She is married with five children aged between 15 and 28 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 15 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers, to grow and sell rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, to grow and sell rice.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more stock of rice, sugar, salt, oil, beverages and flour etc. This will enable her to boost her earnings and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, sugar, salt, oil, beverages and flour etc. to boost her earnings.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée, Dovi vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants. Agée de 36 ans, Dovi est une commerçante de pagne qui circule dans tout son quartier et satisfait agréablement ses clients. Dovi trouve son revenu à travers ce commerce et  s’approvisionne deux fois au marché de Lomé. Pour commander des pièces de pagnes Dovi sollicite ce microcrédit pour réaliser son achat afin d’avoir le bénéfice qui pourrait soutenir son mari à favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dovi is a 36-year-old, married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her two children.  She sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) on foot throughout her neighbourhood.  Her customers are very satisfied with the clothing she sells.

Dovi earns her living through this trade and buys more supplies twice a month from the market in Lomé.  She has requested this loan to buy more supplies and improve her profit levels so she can help her husband to provide for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy 6 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing for resale.

loans.name: Taley

texts.fr: A 39 ans, Taley est une jeune femme célibataire et vit avec un enfant à Kanoukopé dans la ville de Lomé. Bien consciente de son état elle vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier afin de générer un bénéfice pouvant couvrir les charges quotidiennes. Taley  achète son stock auprès de fournisseurs une fois par mois et en tire assez de profits. Taley désire ce crédit pour commander des charbons de bois afin de trouver son bénéfice pour subvenir favorablement aux besoins quotidiens
texts.en:
Taley is 39 years old, single and lives with her child in Kanoukopé, in the town of Lomé.  She is well aware of the difficulty of her situation so works selling charcoal throughout her district to generate enough profit to provide for the day-to-day expenses of her household.

Taley buys her charcoal once a month from local suppliers.  She has requested this loan to order more charcoal to increase her profit levels and provide for her needs.

loans.use: to buy 48 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.ru:
El Comité San Luis está en su ciclo número 1, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 15 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema, por la cual están luchando para poder ir mejorándola.
Todas y cada una de ellas son mujeres sacrificadas y luchadoras, que quieren ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos, donde una de las integrantes que se destaca es la Sra. Neide, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, con lo cual está luchando para poder mejorar cada día. Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder  superar su situación de pobreza.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y ayudar con ello a su familia.
texts.en:
The San Luis communal bank is in its first loan cycle. The women are doing the questionnaire about elimination of poverty, in which 15 members are below the poverty line, in other words in extreme poverty, which they are fighting to improve. 

Each and every one of the women is self-sacrificing and a fighter, who wants to help her family and her loved ones. One of the members who stands out is señora Neide, who works selling various types of clothing, and with this activity fights each day to improve her situation. She is putting her all into overcoming her poverty.

She is requesting this loan to buy various items of clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers and others, with which she will be able to continue her work as she has been doing and use it to help her family.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers and other clothes

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia has successfully built her stitching business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of her Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business. Now she is taking her sixth loan and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, buttons, zips and laces etc. This will enable her to meet all her orders on time to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, buttons, zips and laces to increase her sales

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is a 52-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. Bashiran fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of seafood business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy shrimp, crab and other seafood to sell in her stall. 

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, crab and other seafood to sell in her stall

loans.name: Luz Milena

texts.es: Luz de 37 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de gafas de lujo y formuladas, además de ofrecer el servicio de telecomunicaciones mediante celulares, el cual se encuentra funcionando desde el año 2012, cuando por necesidad de obtener ingresos y motivada por la experiencia en este tipo de negocios, decidió desarrollar su propio generador de ingresos. Hoy vende diariamente a sus consumidores trabajando 8 horas diarias, entre vecinos y amigos referidos de sus clientes fijos. Su meta es lograr incrementar sus ingresos para aumentar el nivel de bienestar de su pequeño hijo de 8 años, quien es el principal motor de su día a día. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un enfriador con el cual incrementar sus ingresos vendiendo refrescos, bebidas y jugos naturales y de esta manera, superar  el desafío de tener un fondo de capital adicional para comprar un activo fijo productivo, que hará de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Luz is 37 years old and runs a business selling luxury and prescription glasses as well as offering a telecommunications service using cell phones. The business has been running since 2012, when due to the need to obtain income, and motivated by this kind of business, she decided to develop her own way to generate income. Today she works eight hours a day every day selling to her consumers, who are neighbours and friends referred by her regular customers. 

Her objective is to boost her income to improve the well-being of small eight-year-old son, who is the main driving force behind her day to day life.  She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy a cold-storage unit to boost her income by selling sodas, drinks and natural juices. By buying this productive fixed asset, she will be able to overcome the challenge of having extra stock and ensure that her investment in a Kiva loan is successful.

loans.use: to buy a cold-storage unit

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida, a 45-year-old married woman, has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent is 25 years old. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Mijra

texts.en: Mijra is 50 years old and married. The man shown in the photo is Mijra’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Mijra has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Mijra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander started his economic activity as a door-to-door sales person but turned to farming when he retired from the workforce. He has three cows with a tea plantation. He loves farming because it provides him with everything his family needs, i.e milk, crops and money. He says the most surprising thing about him, and what he is most proud of, is that he is actually quite an old man to be farming! But he works so hard that you wouldn't guess it apart from his gray hairs.

loans.use: To purchase a biogas system to have clean cooking fuel for his family

loans.name: Sayedan

texts.en: Sayedan is a 49-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should help her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Sayedan is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently, she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase good quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good quality cloth in different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling seafood.  Mercy is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to  buy fish nets and other materials to use in her fishing business.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José, de 73 años de edad, es mecánico, su nivel de estudio fue hasta tercer grado, por problemas económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios y empezó a trabajar para ayudarle a sus padres en los gastos de la casa, es viudo y tiene 4 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y trabajan para sus propios hogares, vive con uno de sus hijos, su nuera, su nieto y un bis nieto.

José, se dedicaba a trabajar en mecánica automotriz, pero ahora en día está jubilado, por lo tanto ya no trabaja.

El crédito que está solicitando en la institución es para comprar una novilla, la cual cuidara y posteriomente la vendera, para cubrir los gastos de la casa.

El sueño de José, es tener mucho ganado, para obtener provecho de la venta de ellos.
texts.en:
José is 73 years old. He is a mechanic. He has a third grade education. Due to financial problems, he was unable to continue his education and he started to work to help his parents with the household expenses. He is a widower and has 4 children. All of them are grown and work for their own households. he lives with one of his children, his daughter in law, his grandson and his great grandson.

José used to work as  a mechanic, but now he is retired and therefore doesn't work anymore.

The loan he is asking the institution for now is to buy a heifer. He will care for it and later sell it to pay for the household expenses. 

José's dream is to have a lot of cattle to profit from selling them.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Jose Eugenio

texts.es:
José, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado, es padre de 2 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes y viven aparte, en su casa solo vive con su esposa. 

José, se dedica a vender minutas desde hace 2 años, decidió dedicarse a este negocio, porque tiene un amigo que hacia lo mismo y le generaba buenos ingresos; también trabaja la agricultura, mientras que su esposa trabaja en un comedor en la ciudad, el cual está a 1 hora y media desde su casa y así como le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar tamarindo, hielo, melones, sandia, jaleas y leche condensada para la venta de minutas y así obtener mejores ganancias, también comprará insumos agrícolas para la siembra de granos básicos.

El sueño de Eugenio es seguir trabajando para en un futuro poder mejorar su casita y darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José has a third grade education. He is the father of 2 children who are grown and who live on their own. In his home he only lives with his wife. 

José has been selling slushies for 2 years. He decided to start this business because he has a friend who did the same thing and it generated good income for him. He also works in agriculture, while his wife works at a restaurant in the city, which is an hour and a half from their house and that is how she helps with the household expenses. 

José needs the loan to buy tamarind, ice, melons, watermelon, jellies and condensed milk to sell slushies and thus obtain better profits. He will also buy agricultural materials to grow basic grains. 

Eugenio's dream is to keep working so in the future he can improve his home and give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tamarind, melons, watermelon, jellies and condensed milk, to sell slushies.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 28 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y sus dos pequeños hijos en las edades de 3 y 8 años, en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad,  donde tiene una peluquería cuyos principales productos son el corte de cabello, tinturados, manicure pedicure etc. Así mismo vende  productos capilares y de belleza, que agregan valor a su servicio y que además le generan un ingreso adicional. Carmen inició hace 5 años, trabajando con su hermana quien le enseño técnicas de estética y belleza que ahora ella aplica en su propio negocio. Su meta es tener un salón con empleados y hacer mejoramiento a su vivienda pero tiene el gran desafío de incrementar sus ventas. Esta es la razón por la actual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  productos de belleza, tintes, shampoo etc. Con esta inversión obtendrá nuevas ganancias oxigenando un poco más su capital de trabajo y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en: Carmen is 28 years old. She lives with her spouse and their two small children, aged 3 and 8, in a metropolitan area of the city. She has a small hair salon whose main services are haircuts, dyes, manicure, pedicure, etc. She also sells hair and beauty products that add value to her service and also generate additional income. Carmen started 5 years ago, working with her sister who taught her the techniques of aesthetics and beauty that she is now applying to her own business. Her goal is to have a salon with employees and to do some home improvements, but she has the big challenge of increasing her sales.  That is the reason that she is now asking for a Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy beauty products, dyes, shampoo, etc. With this investment, she will obtain new earnings, oxygenating her working capital a little more, and that is just how her investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, tints, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Mujeres Trabajadoras cuenta con 17 integrantes y están en el sexto ciclo todas con actividades económicas.
La señora Virginia  tiene un comedor en su casa, ella pudo montar ese negocio con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que está esforzándose cada día por ir mejorando.  Ella quiere ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y su negocio es por ello que se esfuerza cada día.
Virginia pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder seguir con su comedor, como carne, fideos, arroz, verduras y otros, para poder seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee, Mujeres Trabajadoras (Hardworking Women) includes 17 members and they are all in the sixth cycle with economic activities. 

Mrs. Virginia has a dining room in her house, she was able to set up that business with a lot of sacrifice and effort, she is a very hardworking and determined person who is forcing herself each day to keep improving. She wants to keep improving her life conditions and her business, it is for that reason that she makes an effort each day.

Virginia is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies to be able to continue with her dining room, such as meat, noodles, rice, vegetables, and others to be able to continue making her food the way she has been doing so.

loans.use: to buy meat, noodles, rice, vegetables, and others

loans.name: 15 Corazones Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 15 corazones es un grupo nuevo, a quien se les esta aplicando la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para que cada una pueda conocer su situación de vida y con ello puedan ir mejorando poco a poco.
Todas las miembros están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo, pero quien se destaca entre ellas es la Sra. Blanca, una señora sacrificada que cada día empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano en su despensa que pudo montar con tanto esfuerzo y sacrificio, su sueño es poder ir mejorando poco a poco para que de esa forma pueda ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, carnes, hortalizas, enlatados y otros, y con ello poder seguir creciendo, ayudar a su familia y dar a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
The group called 15 Corazones is a new group, which is working with the poverty elimination questionnaire so that each one can know their life situation and with that can improve bit by bit. 

All of the members are putting in their best efforts but who stands out is Blanca, a self-sacrificing woman who each day begins to work from very early in the morning in her store that she was able to open with such effort and sacrifice. Her dream is to be able to continue improving little by little so that in this way she can help her family. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase vegetables, fruit, meat, canned goods and more and, with that, be able to continue growing, to help her family and to give her customers what they ask for.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruit, meat, canned goods and more.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Luchadoras se llama este formado en la ciudad de Caaguazú, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una está luchando por poder mejorar sus vidas y dar a sus seres queridos lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
María una de las integrantes, vende ropas para poder subsistir y tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella es una persona que lucha cada día y se esfuerza para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camperas, pantalones y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Luchadoras and is from the city of Caaguazú. They are part of the poverty elimination program, where they are all fighting to improve their lives and give their loved ones what they couldn't have.  

María, one of the members, sells clothing to subsist and have the means to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She is a person who struggles each day and works hard to be able to grow and be someone in her life.  

She asks for this loan to purchase t-shirts, jeans, cowboy boots, pants and more and with that be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. All of the members are grateful for the opportunity that they are getting to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, jeans, cowboy boots, pants and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria es de la ciudad de San Pedro, tiene una despensa y bodega es cliente recurrente de la Fundación y comenta que por medio de la ayuda de la fundación ha podido ir mejorando cada día por medio de su esfuerzo.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella quiere ir mejorando cada día para poder ayudar a su familia, y es por ello que se está esforzando mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas varias para poder surtir su negocio y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of San Pedro. She has a general store and is a returning client of the foundation and says that through the help of the foundation she has been able to improve each day through her efforts.

She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She wants to continue improving each day to be able to help her family and for this she is working very hard.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of drinks to be able to stock her business and with this be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of drinks for sale.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo tiene 19 integrantes, cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus familias. Cada una de ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el cual les permitirá poder conocer su situación de vida y conforme a ello poder esforzarse por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Petrona, quien través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas y cosméticos viene esforzándose por poder mejorar cada día, y tener los medios para que a su familia no le falte nada. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora, ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas varias para la venta, como ser jeans, camisas, pantalones, remeras y otros y con ello poder seguir luchando por crecer.
texts.en:
The group has 19 members, each one of them is putting forth their best efforts to be able to help their families. Each one of them is in the poverty elimination program, which allows them to be able to know their living condition and, according to that, be able to work hard to improve.

One of the members is Petrona who, through her efforts and continuous work and through the sale of clothing and cosmetics, continues working hard to be able to improve each day and have the means so that her family doesn't lack anything. She is a very enterprising person. She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of clothing for sale such as jeans, shirts, pants, t-shirts, and more and with that be able to continue struggling to grow.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, shirts, pants, t-shirts, and more.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hila es una persona que estudia para poder ser alguien en la vida y con ello poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, ella esta estudiando la carrera de administración, con ello quiere poder ser un profesional exitoso, y quiere poder ser útil a la sociedad. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su universidad lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide de nuevo este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera para poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Hilda is studying in order to become somebody in life and be able to help his beloved ones. She studies Administration. She wants to become a successful professional, and someone useful for society.  She says that the previous loan was very helpful for her, since she could pay the university fees.

She is requesting a new loan to pay the university fees and be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, se esta esforzando para poder ser una profesional exitosa que pueda ayudar a las demás personas. Ella comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder cubrir sus cuotas de la carrera lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
María is studying Business Administration. She works hard to become a successful professional and be able to help other people. She says that the previous loan was very helpful for her, since she could pay the university fees.

María is requesting a new loan to pay the university fees and be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase and sell shells.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es:
Marciano viene de una familia de cinco miembros, es el mayor de los hermanos. Desde muy joven se empeñó en salir adelante para ayudar a su familia y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el último año de la carrera de Contaduría Pública. Se desempeña como cajero en una entidad bancaria para poder costear sus estudios universitarios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Marciano comes from a family of 5; he is the oldest of the siblings. Since he was very young, he was determined to get ahead to help his family and offer them a better quality of life. Currently, he is in his last year of his public accounting program. He works as a cashier at a bank to be able to pay for his university studies.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay his fees and with that be able to continue studying as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus siete hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo del café. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su finca. Con esto Fernando espera mejorar el mantenimiento de su finca y obtener mayores rendimientos, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is 37 years old, in a common-law marriage, lives with his spouse and their seven children in Cañaris district, located in Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region, on the northern costs of Peru. Live in the district is peaceful. Its population primary works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 10 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The current loan will be to purchase manure and fertilizers to maintain his farm. With this, Fernando hopes to improve the maintenance of his farm and get better results, which will allow him to increase his level of income, to the end of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es de la ciudad de Pilar, vive con sus padres, está estudiando la carrera de técnico en rehabilitación física y fisioterapia, y con ello poder quiere poder ayudar a las personas.
Es una persona que se está esforzando cada vez más para poder ser alguien en la vida y luchar por sus metas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y que con ello sigan estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Raquel is from the city of Pilar. She lives with her parents and is studying for a technical degree in physical rehabilitation and physical therapy and with this, she wants to be able to help people.

She is a person who is always working hard to be able to be someone in life and to fight for her goals.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her program and so that she can continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending. Nenita is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Rosella

texts.en:
Rosella is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosella is 53 years old.

Rosella has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies for her business.

Rosella has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Rosella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Sakroni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Sakroni. Sakroni lives in East Serang, located about two hours from Jakarta, the capital city. Sakroni owns a stall that sells daily consumer products. Sakroni just joined Ruma at the end of last year. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business more in technology. 

Sakroni has become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product designed for lower income communities called "Mapan." Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children.  

As a Mapan agent, Sakroni is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Sakroni will submit the order via SMS and, within 5 to 10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Sakroni believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. 

As seen in the photo, Sakroni is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to increase the working capital deposit needed to help community members save up for big purchases through Mapan, Ruma's layaway product

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 54 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 18 and 29. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 30 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer and to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay workers.

loans.name: Momal

texts.en:
Momal is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing.

She has run a business of purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Hanin Group

texts.en:
Linda is the featured borrower for Hanin Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Linda is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who started a year ago working as a Brazilian gold saleswoman to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. 

Linda is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special Brazilian gold accessories to satisfy her customers' needs.

Linda is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Rouwaida is the first lady on the right, and Hanin is the lady standing in the middle.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with special Brazilian gold accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en el distrito de Cañaris, ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de maíz, con una experiencia de 10 años en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitaias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de sus parcelas del cultivo de maíz. Con esto Felix espera la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felix is 24 years old, in a common-law marriage, and lives with his spouse and son in Cañaris district, Ferreñafe province in Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. Life in the district is peaceful and the population primarily works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry. 

He works in agriculture and has corn crops, with 10 years of experience in the business and very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan that will be granted to him will be used in agricultural work, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor costs for weeding his corn crops. With this, Felix hopes for physiological, morphological and productive improvements to his crop, and also to have a good harvest with the end of having more production and a better-quality product, so he won't have any problems selling his products, which will generate more income and will permit him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: for agricultural work, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor costs for his corn crop.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Marissa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials for her business

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 35 years old. She is married with four children aged between 12 and 15 years. Two of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 26 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer for rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy cattle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Jorucyl

texts.en:
As a woman, Jorucyl works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling shrimp. Jorucyl is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies for her fishing business.

Jorucyl has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies for her fishing business

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is aged 51 years. She is married with three children aged between 14 and 20 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 17 years, while her husband is a businessman.
