With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer and to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay workers

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is aged 49 years. She is married with four children aged between 10 and 23 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 19 years, while her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer and to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay workers.

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
Noelia es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene como meta poder tener su titulo universitario y con ello poder ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de nutrición, y con ello quiere poder abrirse camino en el mundo laboral.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Noelia is from the city of Villarrica, she has a goal to be able to have a university degree and, with that, to be able to be a useful professional in society. 

She is studying for a nutrition degree and with that she wants to make her way into the working world.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her program and, with tha,t be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity she is getting to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en:
Rustamjon is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. He is married and has two children. He, with his family, lives in a rural area.

Where Rustamjon is living has good conditions to keep livestock and plant agricultural products. As he was growing up in a family of agrarians, he was taught to work hard. After graduation from high school, he got married and his wife helps and supports him to do a business. He is planting potatoes, carrots and other vegetables and sells in the domestic market. The lack of money forced him to fly to Russia and earn some money.

Now Rustamjon needs to keep his family and wants to buy cattle to have a prosperous business with a permanent monthly income. He is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy cattle. Additionally he rents land to enlarge his business and plant new vegetable seeds. He hopes to be supported because it is hard for rural citizens in Tajikistan to do a business as they have lots of competition.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado y está acompañado, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron estas actividades, actualmente vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos.

Luis, se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. para ordeñar las vacas, para luego ir a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen, mientras que sus hijos van a la escuela.

Luis, necesita el crédito para comprar veneno, semilla y abono para sembrar, él cuenta con la experiencia necesaria, para llegar a obtener una buena cosecha.

 Luis, suela en un futuro tener más ganado de ordeño en un corral, ya que actualmente alquila un terreno para tener sus vacas.
texts.en:
Luis is 36 years old and studied until the night grade. He is married and makes a living in agriculture and animal husbandry. He was raised by his parents, who taught him these activities. He currently lives with his wife and their two children.

Luis gets up at 5:30 a.m. to milk the cows. After he goes to the plots where he works during the morning. His wife is devoted to housework and caring for the cows that they own, while their children attend school.

Luis needs a loan to buy poison, seed and fertilizer to plant. He has the necessary experience to have a good harvest. Luis hopes to have more milking cows in the future in a pen, as they currently rent land to have their cows.

loans.use: para comprar veneno, semilla y abono para sembrar.

loans.name: Vilma Arcadia

texts.es:
Vilma, de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado y está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres.- Vilma, se levanta temprano para realizar sus actividades diarias en la agricultura y en el cuido del ganado.

Vilma, se dedica a trabajar en las parcelas que posee, este trabajo lo realiza durante la mañana junto a sus hijos, en el transcurso de la tarde, se dedican a ordeñar las vacas y a vender la leche a sus vecinos. 

Vilma, necesita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono y veneno para poder sembrar, ella espera obtener una buena cosecha, para que le ayude al sustento de su familia.

Vilma, planea ahorrar dinero de la venta de la leche y las ganancias de la siembra, para iniciar un nuevo negocio, de moler maíz, por tal razón desea comprar un molino a futuro.
texts.en:
Vilma is 61 years old and studied until sixth grade. She is married and has two children who are now adults. She makes a living in agriculture, a trade she learned from her parents. Vilma gets up early to do her daily activities in agriculture and take care of the livestock.

Vilma works in the land she owns. She does this works during the morning together with her children. In the course of the afternoon, she works to milk the cows and sell the milk to her neighbors.

Vilma needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and poison to be able to plant. She hopes to have a good harvest, so that she can help to support her family.

Vilma plans to save money from the sale of milk and the profits from planting, to start a new business of grinding corn. For this reason she wants to buy a mill in the future.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and poison for planting.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila y su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de albañil de construcción contando con herramientas propias de trabajo. Cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de mas tablas y herramientas para implementar su negocio, con esto Daniel podrá construir mas casas a los clientes y brindar un mejor servicio, el piensa mejorar calidad del servicio que brinda lo que le generará mayores ingresos que mejoraran su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel is 20 years old, single, and lives with his family in Oyotún district, located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Life in the district is peaceful and its population works primarily in agriculture, trade, and raising animals.

He works offering bricklayer services in construction, having his own work tools. He has more than 3 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The current loan will be to purchase more trowels and tools to supply his business. With this, Daniel will be able to build more houses for customers and offer a better service. He plans to improve the quality of the service that he offers, which will generate more income for him that will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more trowels and tools to supply his business.

loans.name: Marcelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado y está casada, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para realizar sus actividades diarias junto a su esposo.

Marcelina, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y contrata jornaleros, para que siembren en la parcela que ella alquila, en el transcurso de la tarde, se dedica a ordeñar las vacas y vender la leche a sus vecinos y en los alrededores.

Con el crédito Marcelina, podrá comprar una novilla, para producir más leche e incrementar sus ingresos.

Marcelina, con los ingresos que obtenga de venta de la leche y de las ganancias de la siembra, quiere comprar un terreno para pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 54 years old and studied until the sixth grade. She is married and makes a living in agriculture and animal husbandry. She learned this trade from her parents. She gets up at 4:30 am to do her daily activities with her husband.

Marcelina works in agriculture and hires day laborers to plant on the land that she rents in the course of the evening. She works to milk the cows and sell the milk to her neighbors in the area.

With the loan Marcelina will be able to buy a heifer to produce more milk and increase her income. With the income that she will obtain from selling milk and the earnings from planting, she wants to buy land to graze her animals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 49-year-old married father of four children who has worked as a garbage collector for five years to cover the increasing needs and expenses of his family.

Mostafa is a hard worker and a sacrificing father who is trying his best to improve his family's living conditions. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's university tuition fees. He hopes to remain capable of satisfying his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay his children's university tuition fees

loans.name: Abdulrakib

texts.en:
Abdulrakib is a 63-year-old happy, hardworking man who's committed to his family and covering their necessary needs. He owns a bakery in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He has five workers who help him in his business.

Abdulrakib is a very active man who is the first worker to arrive and the last one to leave. His sense of responsibility and sense of belonging is remarkable and he works as a baker in this establishment. He's a married man with two adult children, and his dreams are to have a stable business and create jobs. 

Abdulrakib wants to push his business forward through applying for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB and invest it in buying ingredients such as corn, flour, and cooking oil to expand his business.

For Abdulrakib, this support will be essential since he's the sole provider for his family whose only option is to work hard and make his bakery succeed to put food on his family's table.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn, flour, and cooking oil to expand his business

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
Nuriddin is a hardworking man. He is from the northern part of Tajikistan. He was born in 1990. He lives in a rural area with his family. He is married, and his wife helps him to do a business. He grew up in a little secured family. His parents taught him to work hard. He likes to work in agriculture. 

He started to buy cattle from a domestic market, feed them and sell them with an extra price. He also plants agricultural products in the land, harvests them and sells them in a domestic market. His gained monthly income is spent only for family expenditures. 

Nuriddin is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy cattle. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to strengthen her bookstore in order to keep her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to meet the demand of his clients for milk supply.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 37 years old. She has two children. She has had a retail shop for five years. She will be using the loan to purchase general goods for sale and hopes this will help her generate income. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 59 years old and married to Njuguna, a retired civil servant. She has had a farming business for 30 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has borrowed KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her first loan.  

She will be using the loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, pesticide and materials for making a concrete floor on her pig ranch. 

She hopes that the anticipated profit will help her to buy pigs, animal feeds and more seedlings for planting. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a thriving agricultural activity and to cater for her grandchildren's basic needs as well as their better education.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, pesticide and materials for making a concrete floor on her pig ranch

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to be involved in milk supply for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to start her own business as a tailor from her house

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en:
Hanifan is 29 years old, and a married woman. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been doing a business of animal sales and purchases for many years. Hanifan fully supports and assists her husband with his work. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to sell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all of her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to sell in the market.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has five years of experience as an office administrator and manager in Namibian businesses.  Elizabeth joined Elephant Energy in March 2012 and has been one of the best performing managers in Elephant Energy's organization, consistently meeting the goals she sets for herself.  In August 2014, Elizabeth was promoted to Senior Regional Sales Manager and she continues to support and mentor Regional Sales Mangers in other regions.  Elizabeth says that she loves working with Elephant Energy for both entrepreneurial opportunities she brings to her region and for the awareness she is able to spread regarding the dangers of and alternatives to kerosene and candle lighting.  She has proven to be as effective at educating rural populations about the benefits of renewable energy as she is at establishing strong business relationships.  This loan will help Elizabeth to secure more products for sale in her region by helping to address the need for cash on hand to place orders.  Additionally, the loan will enable larger volume product orders, enabling a reduction in per unit costs and ultimately allowing Elizabeth to pass lower costs on to those in need of small scale solar lighting products.

loans.use: To purchase lighting products for sale to local businesses and sales agents who will then sell the products retail.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 41-year-old married woman and she is a mother of 6 children.

She, along with her husband, has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales for many years. Khursheed fully supports and assists her husband in meeting their household expenses.

Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase lighting products for sale to local businesses and sales agents who will then sell the products retail.

loans.name: Dahshi

texts.en:
Dahshi is a 30-year-old married mother of three children who started five years ago selling Brazilian gold from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Dahshi is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new collection of Brazilian gold accessories to satisfy her customers' needs.

Dahshi hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of Brazilian gold accessories

loans.name: Zuhrillo

texts.en:
Zuhrillo is a goal-oriented, hardworking and honest man. He was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1971. He is living in a rural area and is married. He has two children. He has good conditions for keeping livestock and planting agricultural products. Zuhrillo has many years of practice keeping, feeding and selling cattle in the domestic market. He likes doing this business. There is no other work in the rural area like agriculture and he is hoping to be more compatible among agrarians. 

Zuhrillo has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy cattle and to have a better business to keep his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Fakhra

texts.en:
Fakhra, age 33, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

Fakhra needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is aged 49 years. She is married with three children aged between 17 and 23 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been growing rice for the past 30 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Tiempos Mejores Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario, es mixto está conformado por un hombre y 2 mujeres emprendedoras: Claudel, Rosa Cruz venden frito y Claudia tiene una pulperia, todos viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Es un grupo nuevo que se organizó recientemente con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. 

Claudia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, una señora luchadora de 45 años de edad. Está casada, tiene 6 hijos: El mayor de 22 años estudia su tercer año de carrera universitaria y 5 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Desde hace 7 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su casa de tambo y madera, de esta manera apoya con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando su primer préstamo para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This is a mixed communal bank made up of an enterprising man and two women. Claudel and Rosa Cruz sell fried food and Claudia has a small store. They live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. It is a new group recently organized with the goal of working together to access loans from Pana Pana and have the opportunity to improve their small businesses, increase their income and improve the quality of living for their families.

Claudia is the coordinator for the communal bank. She is a 45 year old fighter, who is married and has 6 children. The eldest is 22 years old and is studying in third year of university and five adolescence who study in secondary school. Seven years ago she established a small store in the corridor of her wood house built on stilts and in this way she helps with the household expenses and her children's studies. She is requesting the loan to buy basic grains and snack foods amongst others. She dreams of being a successful businessperson.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks amongst other foods.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El señor  Martin de 48  años  de edad es casado, tiene 01 hijo que depende de él, tiene  casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de san Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace 26  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería como ser: granos básicos, refrescos, carnes, verduras, embutidos, detergentes, aceites maíz, etc., también se dedica a la pesca artesanal cuenta con dos lanchas con sus respectivos aperos, el es un hombre trabajador con muchos deseos de sacar  adelante a su familia.
Don Martin esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de, refrescos, churros, huevos y productos que más  vende en su pulpería y para comprar materiales para mejorar su casa.  Con el apoyo del crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos, es un cliente sub siguiente  que desea trabajar con Prisma.
Su deseo es mejorar su casa y su negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2015.
texts.en:
Mr. Martin is 48 years old. He is married with a dependent child. He owns his house located in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley south of Honduras. For the past 26 years he has worked selling sundries such as basic grains, soda beverages, meats, vegetables, cold meats, detergents, oils, corn, etc. He also works in small scale fishing. He has two boats with their respective equipment. He is a hard working man with a great desire to help his family move ahead. Mr. Martin is asking for a loan to buy soda beverages, churros, eggs, and the most popular products he sells in his store, as well as to buy materials to improve his home. With this loan he is trying to improve his earnings, he is the next client that wants to work with Prisma. His wish is to improve his house and his business to improve his family's quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2015.

loans.use: To buy soda beverages, churros, eggs, and the most popular products he sells in his store.

loans.name: Hermelina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Hermelina es una bella mujer de 56 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres, desde siempre desarrollo una gran pasión y gusto por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.  

Inicio su etapa productiva realizando cursos y capacitaciones, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza en un local. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnices.
 
El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese de la mano de Interactuar y tenga muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Hermelina is a beautiful 56 year old woman. She is the mother of 4 well brought up children. She has always had a great passion and love for everything to do with beauty. She started her productive activity by taking courses and training until one day she took a chance and decided to find her own clientele opening a beauty salon in a commercial space.

She is requesting a loan to buy stock as she also wants to sell products to compliment her services such as hand cream, gel, hair products, hair dye and nail polish. The loan will be very important to her as it will complete the consolidation of her business with all the goods she needs to operate and offer any service her clients demand. Her dream is for her business to progress hand in hand with Interactuar and have many clients.

loans.use: to buy stock like hand cream, gel, hair products, hair dye, nail varnish.

loans.name: Munanda Jijenge Women Group

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Esther, a member of Munanda Jijenge Women’s Group in Nakuru. She is 31 years old, married, and a mother of eight. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in November 2013. Esther farms maize and beans as her main business. 

With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to commercialize her farming, and she is now able to get more profits. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more quality fertilizer and add more chickens for a poultry project she is starting. This will greatly boost her farm and poultry yields, thus increasing income, which will enable her to cater for her basic needs.  Esther is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizer and more chickens to improve her income.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en: Lela is a 46-year-old widow. She lives with her daughter, son-in-law, and an infant grandson in Rustavi district. Lela has worked for 10 years at a bakery and has now opened her own bakery. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 USD. She has already rented a space for the bakery. She will purchase an oven and will bake Georgian "Khachapuri" (cheese bread) to sell. This will increase her family income and enable her to provide better living conditions to her family. Lela plans to expand her bakery in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and open her own bakery

loans.name: Edita Emelda

texts.es:
Edita, de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a trabajar como ayudante en instalación de cielos falsos y aún no tienen hijos.

Edita, tiene venta de repollo envinagrado y sellado,  tiene un año y medio de haber iniciado el negocio, aprendió este negocio gracias a su pareja que fue quien le enseño.- Ella también trabaja como empleada doméstica para otras personas, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y su esposo se involucra en el reparto del producto, comienza la venta desde las 7:00 de la mañana, hasta que termina el producto.

Edita, necesita comprar especias, repollos, verduras y vinagre para hacer la preparación de su producto, el préstamo mejorará sus ingresos y la necesidad de tener más mercadería estará terminada. 

Sus sueños son, colocar una tienda con variedad de productos como frijol, arroz, aceite y todo lo relacionado a la canasta básica.
texts.en:
Edita is 56 years old and studied until sixth grade. She lives with her partner who works in the installation of suspended ceilings. They have no children.

Edita makes, cans, and sells pickled vegetables.  She has been doing this for 1.5 years. She learned how to do this from her partner who taught her. She also works as a maid for other people. She operates the business out of her home and her partner is involved in the distribution of the product. She starts selling at 7:00 in the morning until the product is all sold.

Edita needs to buy spices, cabbage, vegetables, and vinegar to make her product. This loan will improve her income and meet the increased need for merchandise.

Her dream is to open a shop with a variety of products like corn, rice, oil, and other basic food needs.

loans.use: to buy spices, cabbage, vegetables, and vinegar to make her product.

loans.name: Besnik

texts.en:
Besnik, 29 years old and single, lives with his family in a small village. His parents are retired, while two of his brothers live in western European countries and send the family money from time to time. Besnik sought employment several times without success, which ultimately led him to explore agriculture. 

Currently Besnik has one cow and a calf that he is raising to provide milk and dairy products for his family and to sell in the neighborhood. His stable is very old and in need of renovation, so he hopes that Kiva will be able to assist him. 

Besnik hopes that this loan will help him to continue his business and enable him to be successful. He would like to have a small farm in the near future and add more cows. He is also optimistic that he will be able to find a regular salaried job in the future. 

Besnik is very grateful for this loan opportunity and considers himself lucky.

loans.use: to renovate his stable

loans.name: Al- Nour Group

texts.en:
Zubeda is the leader of Al- Nour Group, which consists of three women from Sana'a, Yemen. The group applied for a loan of 280,000 YER from AMB.

Inside Zubeda’s house, there is a broken refrigerator, which doesn’t work well. She works as a housewife and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. His salary is not enough to change it with a new one. Zubeda has applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB, in order to purchase a new refrigerator for her house. Purchasing that refrigerator will help her keep some foods and drinks in cold condition, better than previous. The broken refrigerator takes a long time to freeze the drinks, fruits, vegetable, and other food. The freezing in the new one will take a very short time, and the consumption of the electricity will decrease. Zubeda has a lot of very old home appliances, and she hopes to change all of them to new.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for her house.

loans.name: Nodirahon

texts.ru: Нодирахон 49 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей, образование- среднее. Уже 29 лет она ведет свое хозяйство. Благодаря упорному труду Нодирахон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова, на участке мерою 0,40 Га она выращивает картофель, огурцы и помидоры. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нодирахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян картофеля и огурцов, чтобы выращивать экологически чистые овощи. Нодирахон является участником группы "Канал", всего в группе 3 человека. Доходы от бизнеса Нодирахон планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее деятельности и расширение сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Nodirahon is 49 years old, married and has two children. She has received secondary education. She has been doing farm work for 29 years already. Thanks to Nodirahon’s hard work, at present she owns a cow; on a land plot of 0.40 ha [1 acre] she grows potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes. Her monthly income is about 15,000 KGS. 

In order to develop her farm further, Nodirahon has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy fertilizers as well potato and cucumber seeds for growing environmentally clean vegetables. Nodirahon is a member of the Channel group, which has three members in total. Nodirahon plans to user her revenues for developing her business further and enlarging her cowshed.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers as well potato and cucumber seeds for growing organic vegetables.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 35 years old and is married with three school-going children.  He has requested his first loan, which he will use to increase his working capital by purchasing a tool box and other materials. He will use the anticipated income to educate his children and expand his farming business. His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: buy a tool box & materials

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel  is 39 years old. He is married with five children ages 1 to 13. He has been producing timber for three years to support his family. He will be using the loan to purchase power saws, a ladder, and tools. He hopes the income generated will help him open another business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for timber business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 46 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Diana is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Diana has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: buy fertilizers & farm supplies.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 28 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  In 2009, she established her mobile phones and accessories and plasma television business. Her husband gave her some amount of money to start her own business. Anita opened a phone charging center and the profits  were used to establish an electronic shop.  Working sis days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 8,534,000 SLL a month. 

Anita requested a loan for 5,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy pieces of plasma televisions, clocks, fans, mobile phones, cables, bulbs, etc.  In the future, she plans to reinvest and open another outlet and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of plasma televisions, clocks, fans, mobile phones, cables, bulb,s etc.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is 55 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eda has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.  In the future, Eda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mashaal

texts.en:
Mashaal lives in Irbid, Jordan. He is studying Management Information Systems and would like to complete his degree and find a good job where he can apply all the knowledge he learned at university. 

Now, in addition to his studies, Mashaal is working as a flowers coordinator to help cover his daily expenses.

Mashaal's father has been facing financial problems and is not able to help Mashaal with his tuition fees. Therefore, he has applied for an education loan to pay his tuition fees so he can continue studying for his degree.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees and allow him to continue studying for his degree.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer is a 36-year old single lady.  She lives with her family that consists from six members.  Ghadeer could not complete her education because of the financial difficulties of her family and she had to work to help her family with the household expenses, so she worked in a beauty salon.  After the death of her dad she decided to open her own business to help her family. 

Ghadeer opened a small business which is a beauty salon.  She wanted to help her brothers in their education and her mother in the household expenses. All the family depends on her because she is the eldest one of her siblings.  

Due to the high cost of living Ghadeer want to expand her work, therefore she decided to request a loan to help her buy more products to raise the quality of her work and develop her business to increase her income.

loans.use: buy beauty products

loans.name: Thayu Women Group

texts.en:
In 2012, Thayu Women’s Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to be trained on financial management, enterprise development, and savings mobilization to improve their livelihood. The members in this group are mostly involved in farming activities and businesses.

The person raising her hand on the photo is Faith. She is 32 years old, single, and living with her two children. She runs a salon business. She has applied for a loan to boost her salon business by buying more stock of weaves, shampoo and hair gel. She hopes to improve her customer base, thus gaining more income to cater for family needs. Faith is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy weaves, shampoo and hair gel to help boost salon business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a 65-year-old father of two adult sons who are pursuing their own lives. Pedro is a tailor, trained by his mother when he was very young, and practises his profession, mainly making suits and school uniforms, in his house, where he lives with his wife.

Pedro is requesting this loan to fix a room in his house that will serve as his new workshop. In the picture Pedro appears in the place where he will put that workshop

loans.use: to fix a room in his house to serve as his new workshop

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 46 years old and married. He has four children aged 18, 16, 14 and 12 years who he supports. He has had a retail shop for two years now.

He is taking his first loan to purchase stock like sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour and milk. 

He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his business and children is to open another business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase stock like sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour and milk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, desde muy pequeño se dedica a esta actividad, y ahora tiene 5 años de cultivar sus propias cosechas, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man, 26 years old, has his face pixelated because he lives in a high-risk area. 

He works growing basic grains, and has been dedicated to this activity since an early age. Now he has five years of experience cultivating his own crops, selling his products to the agents who buy and sell basic grains.  He is able to pay some of the household expenses with what he obtains. 

He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, etc., in order to continue his work and so have a better income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 27 years old. He is married and has 2 children. He has had a clothes selling business for 14 years and it has been profitable. He will be using this  loan to purchase more stock of clothes to sell to increase his income.  He hopes this will help him to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous clothes selling business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is single and has a business selling shellfish in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more shellfish to sell.  She has been in this business for ten years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

In the future, Milagros would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: buy shellfish

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Frederick. He is married and has a 5-year-old child. In 2010, Frederick established his Recording Center business. He began his business to both support his family and be self-reliant. Working 6 days a week, 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,898,400 SLL every month from this business. 

Frederick would like to take a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and he now requires a new loan in order to add to his business capital and buy more DVD plates and recording materials. 

Frederick hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits. In the future, he plans to build a house, to increase his business or expand to another location, and to educate his child. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase phone batteries, chargers, head phones, and DVD plates.

loans.name: Ma. Lucia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Lucia works hard to support her family.  She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. 

Lucia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to resell.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Alusine. He is married and has 3 children, aged 10, 6 and 4 years. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him because Alusine is helping him with his schooling.  

In 2007, Alusine established a shop selling building materials. He began his business to both be self-reliant and support his family. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 2,208,900 SLL every month from this business. 

Alusine would like to take a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 LLC. He has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans, and he now requires a new loan in order to add to his business capital and buy more building materials.  

Alusine hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits and business capital.

loans.use: to purchase PVC pipes, elbows, and cables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase auto spare parts

loans.name: Tulio Hernando

texts.es:
Tulio, con 58 años de edad, es casado y padre de 2 hijos. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, un visionario y buen negociante. 

Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo bebidas de todo tipo en el municipio de Medellín y, desde hace 3 años tiene su propio negocio.  

Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Tulio acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido e inventario de gaseosas y licor para la venta. 

Tulio es un hombre muy organizado aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la competencia comercial del sector.  

La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.
texts.en:
Tulio, age 58, is married and has two children.  He is known for being a very responsible, hard-working, and visionary man and for being a good businessman.

He has always worked in commerce selling all types of drinks in the Medellín municipality.  He has had his own business for three years.  He has known how to overcome difficult times in the business.  He dreams of buying his own house and having a business that lasts in time.

That is why Tulio is requesting a loan to buy stock and inventory of soft drinks and liquor to sell.

Tulio is a very proficient man even though he has had to face commercial competition in the area.

The sum of all of his efforts provides all of his family with an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock and inventory of soft drinks and liquor to sell.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 20 years old; she is single and has no children. She lives at El Alto with her parents. 

She helps her parents attend a grocery store.  She works every day; she has to move stock that is very heavy. 

Guadalupe needs a loan to buy soft drinks, bread, and other kind of products for her grocery store. 

She is responsible, and she is the only one that take care of her parents. She hopes you can help her again.

Guadalupe would like to hire a helper in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread and other kind of products for her grocery store

loans.name: Chutzoropence Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango is a large and colorful town located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala and is well-known for its large weekly markets, Mayan customs, and long-time traditions. Chutzorop is a small community, near Chichicastenango, where the principle language is the Mayan dialect of “Kiche”. Spanish is not spoken by many in the village. 

Catarina, a member of the Trust Bank, is a 41-year-old married mother of 10 children who range in age from 3 to 23 years. She is beginning her 3rd loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. Neither she nor her husband - who is a farm laborer - have ever had any formal education, and they both work hard to support their large family. They are very pleased that 5 of their children have completed their studies and graduated. 

Catarina has a textile business and sells in the local market held twice a week. She makes colorful and ornate traditional blouses called “huipiles”, belts or “fajas”, shawls or “chalines”, and cloths or “tsutes” that she also sells by the dozen at the wholesale level. Because of the success of her business, Catarina has two employees who help her keep plenty of inventory on hand. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase various colors and textures of high-quality thread as well as other supplies for her business.

Catarina and her friends in the “Chutzoropense” Trust Bank understand the value of education and know that their children need to be in school in order to enjoy a better and more prosperous future. Participating in the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge (small loans + non-formal education), the ladies learn about many useful and relevant subjects from a Loan Officer in their own native language at their monthly meetings. 

The ladies in the “Chutzoropence” Trust Bank are greatly aided by the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge. Kiva investors play a large role in funding these life-changing loans. We look forward to providing a follow-up report on Catarina and her friends in the Trust Bank in the rural area of Chutzorop, Guatemala. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase various colors and textures of high-quality thread as well as other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, dairy products and beans to be able to help her family more.

loans.name: Kisoga Group

texts.en:
Vumilia, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children, two in school.  She has been running two businesses, mama lishe (food vending) and selling women's clothes for one year now.  

This will be Vumilia's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase the mama lishe stock and to buy up-to-date women's clothes to meet her customers' demand.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase her mama lishe stock and to buy up-to-date women's clothing to meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of continuing and finish building her house.

Vumilia will share this loan with her loan group"Kisoga" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her mama lishe (food vending) stock and to buy up-to-date women's clothing to meet her customers' demand.-

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is a hardworking father from Oroquieta. He is 60 years old and a businessman who makes copra. He buys whole coconuts for this.

Domingo has signed up for his membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. He applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra.

Domingo hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
Fidelia, es casada, sus hijos tienen 32, 28 y 40 años de edad, ya se han independizado, su negocio es la venta de pupusas de 4:00 p.m. a 8:00 p.m., de esa forma ella puede obtener ingresos con los que hasta la fecha ha cubierto los gastos familiares y no representa dificultades en desempeñar dicha actividad.
Necesita comprar repollo, tomates, quesillo, harina, aceite, vinagre, etc., tendrá materia prima para elaborar la venta de pupusas, será de ayuda para ofrecer un mejor servicio, atraer nuevos clientes e incrementar las ventas.
Sus aspiraciones son seguir trabajando para cancelar su deuda y comprar un vehículo en el que trasladara la mercadería para su negocio y podrá compartir paseos con su familia.
texts.en:
Fidelia is married.  Her children are 32, 28, and 40 years old; and they are independent now.  Her business is selling ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas] from 4:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m.  By doing so she is able to get earnings that, to date, have covered the family expenses.  There are no difficulties for her in this business activity.

She needs to buy cabbage, tomatoes, soft cheese, flour, cooking oil, and vinegar, etc.  She will then have raw material to make and sell pupusas.  It will help her to offer better service, to attract new customers, and to increase her sales.

Her aspirations are to continue working in order to repay her debt and to buy a vehicle in which she can transport the merchandise for her business and to share outings with her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatoes, soft cheese, flour, cooking oil, and vinegar, etc. to make pupusas.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 46 years old. She is single and lives in Larena, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement.  

With a desire to earn more, Amy decided to raise pigs of her own as well. Through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative she obtained the capital to purchase both her first piglets and feed. 

Now, Amy is requesting a loan of 3,500 PHP in order to buy a piglet as well as additional feed. 

Amy really hopes and prays that her business might grow and benefit her. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep her pigs in more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy a piglet and additional bags of feed.

loans.name: Brayan Estil

texts.es:
Brayan, es un joven de 21 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2013, monto una tienda de accesorios para mascotas con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 

Trabaja solo durante 8 horas todos los días.
Brayan se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como accesorios para mascotas, comederos, collares, placas, entre otros, con el fin de darle un mejor impulso al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Brayan, age 21, has devoted himself to diverse work activities for some time.  However, he has always had the wish in his mind to become involved in commerce.  That is how, in the beginning of the year 2013, he established a pet accessories store.  The store has been well-received during the years that it has been operational.

He works alone for eight hours every day.

Brayan is known for being an enterprising, kind, and visionary man with a great desire to get ahead.  That is the reason he is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like pet accessories, feeders, collars, and ID tags, among others.  He will do this in order to give his business better impetus.  This will manage to attract more customers, and he will offer them a variety of products to meet the needs and preferences of all who visit his business.

This way he will manage to get income to continue supporting his household, and he will save in order to set up various branches of his business.  This way he will have a more prosperous future where he will be able to notably improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like pet accessories, feeders, collars, and ID tags, among others.

loans.name: Blanca Nury

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir. Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como mango y frutas picadas. 
Con esta actividad intenta día a día salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su hijo de 4 años quien es el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente. 

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar. 

Blanca solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de surtido de fruta. Con tu ayuda Blanca Podrá pagar la educación de su hijo que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Blanca is a very enterprising and tenacious woman with big dreams that she has been cultivating and trying to make come true.  She has a small business preparing and selling food such as mangos and chopped fruit.

With this job, everyday she tries to get ahead and improve her family’s living conditions.  Her family is made up of her 4-year-old son, around whom her life revolves and who is her daily motivation to struggle on.

Her biggest difficulty is the competition in her area, but with her great capacity for hard work, she is capable of keeping up and making progress.

Blanca is asking for a loan to stock up on fruit.  With your help, Blanca will be able to pay for her son’s education, which is one of her biggest dreams!

loans.use: to buy fruit for her business

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa lives in Santa Cruz, Tihualtán, a very small community in Veracruz. She is one of the 25 members of the isolated community, which has been relegated for years. She labors in the field where she grows oranges and tangerines that she sells at the closest market. 

Santa lives with her daughter and grandchildren in a house without electricity and uses candles and a homemade oil lamp at night. 

She wants to buy a 65W solar home system to light the house at night because she believes they will be safer after the sun sets, and wants her grandchildren to be able to study and do their homeworks after school. 

Her daughter will be able to do income-generating activities at night and contribute to the household economy.

loans.use: to purchase a 65W solar home system to replace candles and a homemade oil lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system and replace the use of candles.

loans.name: Pamba Group

texts.en:
Zulfa, who is in her late 30s, is single with two children who are still at school.  She has been a food vendor for two years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zulfa's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase her mama lishe stock to meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of buying her own car.

Zulfa will share this loan with her loan group "Pamba" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her mama lishe (food vending) stock to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, who is in her late 50s, is married with six children, three in school and three grown up.  She has been running a retail shop for 10 years now.  She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m.daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Lucy's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the shop inventory and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and household expenses  She will use this loan to buy the fast-moving items like sugar, beans, flours,cooking oil, sweets and biscuits.  She dreams of extending her shop to be extraordinarily big.

Lucy will make sure she pays back the loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy fast-moving items like sugar, beans, flours, cooking oil, sweets and biscuits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a toilet and remodel the bathroom, allowing her family to enjoy better hygiene.

loans.name: Donald Adelso

texts.es: Donald de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, desde hace 10 años y comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, pesticidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Donald, age 38, lives in his own home with his wife and two children.  For the past ten years, he has worked growing corn and beans.  He sells his produce in the different markets found near his home.  

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest control, herbicides, pesticides, etc., in order to be able to continue with his plants and, in this way, to be able to have a better financial income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest control, herbicides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Maripet

texts.en:
Maripet is 26 years old , married, and has one child aged 1 year. Maripet has been a farmer for 4 years now and has been growing maize and wheat to sell. 

Maripet is taking his first loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and crop chemicals for use on his farm. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and make more income. He intends to use the anticipated profit to provide for the needs of his family.  His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business, make more income and be able to educated his child.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & farm chemicals

loans.name: Abadahemukirana Group

texts.en:
ABADAHEMUKIRANA is a group led by Judith, who is 40 years old. The group name means “Respectfully” in English. 

Judith is married and has three children aged between 2 and 14 years. She sells fruits and has been doing this business for the past 7 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With this loan, Judith would like to buy more oranges, mangoes and apples to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and make savings.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 36 years old and married with four children.  With her four children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Gina has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Gina would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and repair her family's home.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 60 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 
A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 3 años de trayectoria en esta actividad.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas sola.
Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de sus ventas.

Luz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio con la ayuda de Interactuar y en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten. 

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Luz, at the age of 60, is a charismatic and helpful woman who works in her own business, a grocery store that she began due to the need to generate income to support her family. In spite of all the obstacles she had the strength and the determination to pick herself up and keep on going, and thanks to this she's been doing this job for 3 years. She works every day for 8 hours by herself.

Her purpose in life is to continue progressing and that's why she wants to strengthen her business by purchasing a variety of products like groceries, grain, fried foods, soft drinks, and common household goods in general. This way she'll be able to offer her customers better quality and service, and substantially increase her sales and the income she receives from those sales.

Luz states that her biggest desire is to keep growing her business with the help of Interactuar and in the future turn it into a supermarket, where her customers would be able to find all of the products they need.

By supporting this loan you'll be contributing to the entrepreneurism of Colombian women!

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products like groceries, grain, fried foods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
When everything seems to be working against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind. This thought has helped motivate Yousef along his journey.

Yousef is a 42-year-old father of five children. He is doing his best to provide a good and comfortable life for his children.  He opened his own business 10 years ago, which is a snacks restaurant business.  He likes what he is doing and wants to do more and more for his family, therefore he applied for a loan to increase his customers to raise his incomes so he will be able to improve his family life and give his children the best education.  His purpose for the loan is to buy new tools and new products to help him raise the quality of his work and expand his business.

loans.use: buy cooking tools

loans.name: Runglawan

texts.en:
Runglawan helps lead the Thai Tribal Crafts artisan cooperative that specializes in hand-woven handbags and other textiles. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials.

Runglawan's Thai Tribal Crafts have been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is their story:

Thailand's tribal people once supported themselves through slash and burn agriculture, moving their villages every few years to new and fertile fields. This lifestyle is no longer feasible and hill tribes are exploring new options. Their handicrafts have helped them revive traditions that might otherwise have been lost forever. Thanks to Thai Tribal Crafts, hundreds of families now earn a supplemental income, improve nutrition, education and medical care, and depend less on agriculture.

"This microcredit will really help us to purchase the raw materials we need. The suppliers we purchase from do not extend us credit, so it is difficult to build up our inventory and increase our sales."

Use the link below to view Runglawan's hand-woven handbags and other textiles on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1791

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Ruzihon

texts.ru: Рузихон 45 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У Рузихон - среднее образование, на протяжении 25 лет, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Рузихон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется скот - 2 коровы. Также есть 0,32 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает картофель, помидоры и хлопок. Всю экологически чистую продукцию Рузихон реализует. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 15,000 сом (KGS). Рузихон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян для выращивания картофеля, на часть средств приобретет корову. Рузихон является одним из трех участников группы "Канал". Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку дома.
texts.en: Ruzihon is 45, widowed, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education and has earned the main income for her family for 25 years through farming. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows. She also owns a 0.32 hectare plot of land where she plants potatoes, tomatoes, and cotton. All of her crops are organic and she earns an average of 15,000 som (KGS) per month. Ruzihon applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers, seed potatoes, and a cow. Ruzihon is one of three members of the "Kanal" group. She plans to use her profits to invest in developing her business and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seed potatoes in order to grow organic vegetables, along with a cow to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Marcilio

texts.en:
Marcilio is an artisan from Brazil who specializes in leather masks. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather.

Marcilio has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I am a sculptor, art director and teacher specializing in masks. The basis of my formation was architecture, a course where I discovered myself as an artist and from where launched my search as a self-taught creator. My work with masks has its beginning with puppet theaters. I applied the concepts of architecture – that is, the organization of space – to the microcosm of the face. Brazil is a country of racial mixtures with an enormous diversity of human types and archetypes. It is as if all of the masks of the world have passed through here. As an artist, I insist on affirming myself as black, because in Brazil something terrible exists – that is the social invisibility of the African descendant."

"The support that we artisans receive through your generous and humanitarian microcredit is very important. Thank you."

Use the link below to view Marcilio's leather masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4368

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María de 47 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que utiliza todos los recursos que están a su alcance para salir adelante, junto a su familia, por lo que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalias y bisutería. Ella es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 19 y 18 años de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo. María desea invertir en su negocio ya que ha comprobado que entre más productos tiene mejores son sus ventas, por lo que solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa de temporada, bisutería y sandalias y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 47, is an enterprising woman who utilizes all of the resources available to her so that she can get ahead with her family. For the past five years she has been selling clothes, sandals, and trinkets. She is a single mother and lives in her own home along with her two children, age 19 and 18. María has been able to move forward as a result of her hard work.

She wants to invest in her business because it has been proven that having more products will result in an improvement in sales. For this reason, María is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in seasonal clothing, trinkets, and sandals. This will help her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing, trinkets, and sandals.

loans.name: Rene Wildon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, él socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de auto partes y adornos de autos, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a  su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “Todos Unidos” (Everyone Together). He continues to manage his business of selling auto parts and accessories. The borrower has been in business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort he puts forth each day into his work. He is a responsible and diligent individual. By working in this manner, he is able to help his family get ahead.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy windshields and other products.

loans.use: to buy windshields and other products.

loans.name: Leody

texts.en:
Leody has mastered his hog raising business in Talairon, Oroquieta. This is how he makes a living and is able to support his family.

He didn't have enough capital for his business. When he joined PMPC, he was truly grateful to avail himself of credit to fully support his business. Just as how he takes care of his hog raising business, so it is with his membership with PMPC. He wants to maintain his membership in good standing so he can always run for any financing needs.

Now, the loan of PHP 7,000 will help him purchase additional bags of finishing feed pellets for his hogs.

In the future, Leody hopes to build concrete pig cages that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: purchase additional bags of finishing feed pellets for his hogs

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina has a coconut farm in Talairon, Oroquieta, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops.

Magdalina makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan to pay for clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings, so she borrowed from Paglaum MPC.

Magdalina wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay for clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for five years and earns a monthly net income of 4,000 PHP. Leonora is married and has three children. She is from Talairon, Oroquieta.

Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC.

Recently, Leonora requested a loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventory for her store to increase stock.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store to increase stock.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old, married to a carpenter, and blessed with two school-age children. 

She busies herself with selling health products and food supplements. She is able to support her family with their daily needs and the education of her two children. Rosalie is into the dealership of health products and food supplements and wants to expand her business to purchase more inventories of health supplements for retail. 

She has reached out to Paglaum MPC for the funding needs and applied for a loan of PHP 14,500. She is happy to earn an income of PHP 6,000 per month. She hopes to open a store outlet in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of health supplements for retail

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.es:
La Señora Guillerma tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, se dedica al comercio como ser la venta de ropas, remeras de marca, jeans para damas y caballeros, calzados deportivos, entre otros. Comenta que hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este trabajo.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas, calzados deportivos, y otros para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillerma is a 39-year-old single mother who sells clothes, brand-name shirts, women’s and men’s jeans, athletic shoes, and other products. She says that she has been doing this work for more than 13 years.

Guillerma is a hardworking and determined woman who wants to get ahead. She is requesting this loan in order to buy clothes, athletic shoes, and other products so that she can continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes, athletic shoes, and other products.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities such as noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, soap, and condiments. She has been engaged in that kind of business for four years now. She is from Talibon, Bohol and is a 62-year-old married woman with three grown children.

She has requested a loan to buy feed, a sack of rice, and canned goods. These will help Leonida fill her store and improve its variety. Her earnings will augment her income and help her to be able to manage her finances. With these, she would be able to set aside some savings for emergency purposes.

In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy feed, a sack of rice, and canned goods.

loans.name: Eder Alfonso

texts.es:
Eder es un padre muy responsable de 1 hija, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 
Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 
Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo. Actualmente sus dificultades no son muchas, pues siempre trata de enfrentarlas con trabajo duro y perseverancia.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 
Eder también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerles a su hija un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Eder is a very responsible father of one daughter. He has gone through many adversities in his life, but has always had the strength to continue onward and continue progressing with his family. 

A while ago, he undertook his egg sales, for which he has a number of chickens that let him have a certain number of sales.

He dreams of seeing his business grow and knows that with the help of Corporación Interactuar and the people who support his work, he will be able to do it. Currently he doesn't have many difficulties because he always tries to face them with hard work and perseverance. 

For this reason, he is looking for a loan that will permit him to purchase more chickens to be able to increase his production capacity of eggs and in this way respond to his customers' demand for eggs. 

In this way, his sales will increase considerably, in addition his business will make a comeback, and he will be able to continue onward.

Eder also wants to have a big business where he can use all the capacity that he can to get it ahead and in this way offer his daughter a stable economic future.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens to increase his production capacity.

loans.name: Demerce

texts.en:
Demerce wants to fulfill her dreams by completing a degree. She religiously pays attention to making a good mark for every semester she entered. For another school year, Demerce is in need of an amount to pay for her school fees.

Demerce has big dreams to help her family and for her siblings as well. This is the reason why she works hard for her education to become a teacher.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a persevering mother of one child.  Her husband is a farmer, while Luzminda is engaged in retailing rice in her small store located in the market.
