Luzminda sells bags of rice in four different varieties, and because of the quality of the rice she has sold there is an increase of demand.  

Luzminda applied for a loan in her 3rd cycle of Paglaum amounting to 20,000 PHP to buy additional bags of rice to meet the demand of her customers.

Luzminda is very happy because she can now save for the education of her school-age daughter.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice for retail

loans.name: Yanira Lisseth

texts.es: Yanira de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, posee 7 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, almacena sus cosechas en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, los comercializa de diciembre a febrero en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, pesticidas, etc. y así poder continuar con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos.
texts.en: Yanira is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children. She works growing corn and beans and has been working in agriculture for 7 years. She stores her harvest in the granaries that are shown in the photograph. She sells it from December to February in the different markets that are near her house. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc. and in this way be able to continue with her crops since this is her only source of work and income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
To earn a living, Monina is engaged in vegetable farming for a business. She supplies vegetables in the market for her community. This business is one of the sources of their needs, and it really helps her family in their living.

She decided again to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the vegetable farm to make it more productive and have a good harvest.

Monina wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking mother residing in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 57-year-old woman and a mother of five children. Her 12-year-old is her youngest child and is still attending school.

Lolita is a dealer of personal collection products and sells items such as soap powder, toothpaste, body spray, and lotion. She has been engaged in that kind of business for four years.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of personal collection products. These will help improve her income and help her to be able to handle her finances. With these, she could sell a variety of stock and cater to her customers’ needs. She could now be able to continue to send her child to school and provide basic needs as well.

In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of personal collection products.

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn works hard to support her family. Lorlyn is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.
Lorlyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.
Lorlyn has been in this business for one year now.
She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Selvia

texts.en:
Ma. Selvia works hard to support her family. She is widowed with four children and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Selvia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business, like meat, fish, flour, cooking oil, and spices.

Ma. Selvia has been in this business for two years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business, like meat, fish, flour, cooking oil, and spices.

loans.name: Savin

texts.en: Savin is a 58-year-old married rice farmer with one adult child in his care, and he lives in a village in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. For more than 15 years, he has cultivated rice. His wife is a 69-year-old rice farmer and his child is working in a factory. Together, they can earn approximately $7 a day. Savin is requesting a loan because he wants to buy a motorcycle for his child to commute to work. This loan will help him have enough finances to buy a motorcycle, so his child will be able to have better traveling conditions. In the future, Savin hopes to have enough money to build a proper house with fences around it.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his child to commute to work

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita manages a crab production business in their village, and her husband does fishing to make a living. With her generated income from the business, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying more seafood.

To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy additional seafood for sale.

She wants to save money from her business income to sustain her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy additional seafood for sale

loans.name: Yoeung

texts.en:
Yoeung is a 49-year-old, married rice farmer with four children in her care. She lives in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. 

She has been a farmer since 2000. One of her children is a driver, one is a factory worker. Her husband is 44 years old and he is a house builder. Together, they can earn around USD 19 a day. 

Yoeung would like to improve the family’s finances, so she has decided to request a loan to buy cows to breed, so she can sell the calves. 

In the future, she wants to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house and support one of her unemployed children in learning to repair motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed, so she can sell the calves.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 42 years old and married with eight children. With two children still in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.
Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, coffee, soft drinks, milk, bread, juice, and personal care products.
Evangeline has been in this business for four years. 
She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, coffee, soft drinks, milk, bread, juice, and personal care products.

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
Genevie is 25 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Genevie works very hard to provide for them.
Genevie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, coffee, soft drinks, milk, bread, juice, and personal care products.
Genevie has been in this business for two years.
She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, coffee, soft drinks, milk, bread, juice, and personal care products.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analy is 25 years old and has one child still in school.
Analy has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Analy requested an PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more frozen food products like pork, sausage, hot dogs, and a tray of eggs.
Analy has been in this business for one year. She would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen food products like pork, sausage, hot dogs, and a tray of eggs.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris, 25, is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Maricris has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, cooking oil and other materials needed for her food production business.

Maricris has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, cooking oil and other materials needed for her food production business

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. She is married and has a foot spa service business in the Philippines.

Annabelle requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Annabelle has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Shodigul'

texts.ru: Шадигуль 40 лет. Она жительница района Чиликул. Шадигуль проживает вместе семьей. У нее четверых детей. Дети ходят в школу. Ее муж занимается выращиванием скота и растениеводством.  Шадигуль трудолюбивая женщина. Сама Шадигуль занимается животноводством и помогает мужу в  земельном деле. Семь лет своей жизни Шадигуль занимается этой видом деятельности. Шадигуль хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить животноводство. Поэтому она обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Шадигуль верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Shodigul' is 40 years old. She lives in the Jilikul region. Shodigul' lives with her family. She has four children, who all go to school. Her husband farms and raises animals. Shodigul' is a hardworking woman. She herself raises livestock and helps her husband with the farming. She has spent seven years of her life doing this. Shodigul' wants to increase her head of livestock and expand her animal husbandry work. To do this she is asking you for a loan. She trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand her animal husbandry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, green pepper, and a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Jhon Jaime

texts.es:
Jhon es un campesino de 35 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 
Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de flores, cultivos que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado y distribuidoras del municipio de El Carmen de Viboral, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante. Enfrenta múltiples dificultades en su negocio como la sequia, las fuertes lluvias y el alto costo de los insumos.

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y así mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Jhon, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Jhon is a 35 year old farmer, hardworking and humble, who learned how to do field work when he was a child, thanks to the teachings of his parents.

This has allowed him to get ahead and today he owns flower crops, crops that he cares for every day and he sells the harvest in the marketplace and distributes them in the municipality of Carmen de Viboral. He also works as a field hand on different farms in the region, and this complements the income with which he oversees the welfare of his parents since they both struggled to bring him up. He faces multiple difficulties in his business such as drought, heavy rains and the high cost of supplies.

He will use the requested loan from Corporación Interactuar to buy agricultural supplies at wholesale such as compost, pesticides, fertilizers, and more, and with this continue caring for his crops and will have a better crop, more productive and thus earn more when he sells his products.

Jhon with his entrepreneurial spirit, his strength, and toughness wants to go on fighting to reach his dream of having his own farm where he can grow a greater variety of products and thus improve his business profits, ensuring economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale prices such as compost, pesticides, fertilizers, and more.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 52 years old and married with three children.
Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, spices, and soft drinks.
Norma has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from selling vegetable.
Norma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, spices, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Luzmaria

texts.en:
Luzmaria works hard to support her family. Luzmaria is single and has an internet cafe business in the Philippines.
Luzmaria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional computers, spare parts, and do maintenance at her internet cafe.
Luzmaria has been in this business for three years now, and she also earns additional income from a general store.
She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional computers, spare parts, and do maintenance at her internet cafe

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Ma. Luz has a flower shop business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more flowers to sell.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more flowers to sell.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lelita is 42 years old and her two children are still in school.

Lelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lelita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Lelita has been in this business for 17 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. Aida is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Aida requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish nets and bamboo and pay for maintenance of her boat.

Aida has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets and bamboo and pay for maintenance of her boat

loans.name: Lucy Paola

texts.es: Paola es una joven de nacionalidad Colombiana, tiene 24 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijas, la una de 1 año y la otra de 3  años, Paola  se dedica a la comercialización de leche, el esposo de Paola trabaja de obrero en una empresa de leche, donde elaboran productos lácteos, Paola necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar leche y luego comercializarla obteniendo algo de ganancia, a Paola le gusta mecho tener su negocio ya  que a la vez que trabaja en su negocio tiene la oportunidad de ver crecer  y cuidar a sus hijas, Paola aspira que  en su negocio le siga yendo bien para quedarse en Ecuador ya que en este país si se puede vivir tranquilamente sin conflictos y esto mejora la calidad de vida de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Paola is a young person of Columbian nationality. She is 24 years old, married, and has 2 daughters: a 1 year old and 3 year old. Paola is engaged in selling milk. Her husband works as a laborer in a milk company where they produce dairy products.

Paola needs the money from the loan to buy milk and later market it to earn profits. Paola very much likes her business because while working she has the opportunity to see to the care and growth of her daughters. Paola aspires that in her business she will continue doing well to stay in Ecuador because in this country you live peacefully without conflicts and this improves the quality of life for her daughters.

loans.use: to purchase milk.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado  lechero desde hace 4 años el cual inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde le reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera y una novilla y asi seguir con la crianza que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The youth whose face is obscured in the photo is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. He has raised milk cows for the last four years. He began the business with his own capital, and he sells his cattle in the area surrounding the zone where he lives. With what he obtains from his sales,he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

The youth lives in his own house with his life's companion. He is soliciting a loan to purchase a milk cow and a heifer, in order to continue raising cattle and generating good earnings.

loans.use: buy a milk cow and a heifer.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Lorena de 42  años  de edad vive con su esposo y  tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 03  años al negocio de  venta de abarrotería como ser: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, frescos, pollo, carnes, embutidos, y  ganchos para pelo, diademas, adornos, aretes, ella tiene su negocio en su casa, ella es una mujer trabajadora que lucha junto con su esposo para sacar adelante a sus hijos que están estudiando.
Doña Lorena necesita el préstamo para surtir de mercadería su negocio con arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, frescos, pollo, carnes, embutidos, y  ganchos para pelo. Es su primer  crédito que solicita a prisma con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar su negocio y por ende sus utilidades.
Su sueño es ampliar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2015.
texts.en:
Lorena, 42 years old, lives with her husband and has 2 children who depend on her. She has her own home and for the past 3 years, she has made her living selling groceries such as: rice, beans, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, chicken, meats, cold cuts, hairpins, headbands, decorations, and earrings.

She has her business in her house. She is a hardworking woman who, together with her husband, struggles to get her children, who are in school, ahead.

Lorena needs the loan to stock her business with merchandise like rice, beans, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, chicken, meats, cold cuts, and hairpins. This is the first loan she is applying for with Prisma, and with the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her business, and therefore her profits.

Her dream is to expand her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2015

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, chicken, meats, cold cuts, and hairpins for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can further improve her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional grocery items and other products which she sells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Norma wants to expand her business soon. She also dreams to have her own laundry shop for an additional source of income. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda de 36 años de edad,  es la propietario de una tienda ubicada en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vende ranchos, víveres, y artículos de la canasta familiar en general.  Su negocio inició hace 10 años, siguiendo la tradición de sus padres y  de casi toda su familia, quienes también son comerciantes. Cuando Yolanda creció y percibió las bondades de tener una tienda, como la posibilidad de atender a su familia y las obligación domésticas, además de genera ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su hogar conformado por su esposo y sus pequeños hijos de 1 y 2 años,  no dudó en emprender este negocio. Hoy sus principales clientes son las madres de familia, a quienes les vende de contado, trabajando todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza en el mercado público, lugar donde encuentra precios competitivos. Su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograr el crecimiento y la expansión esperada; esta es la razón por la cual acude aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, ranchos, bebidas, lácteos, cárnicos y todo aquello que conforma la canasta familiar de quienes  habitan como sus vecinos y son su clientela fiel.
texts.en:
Yolanda, age 36, is the owner of a store located in the city of Barranquilla. She sells snack foods, provisions, and general household goods. Yolanda started her business 10 years ago, following the tradition of her parents and almost everyone else in her family who work as merchants. As she was growing up, Yolanda saw the benefits of having a store, such as being able to attend to her family and meeting her household obligations. In addition, she could generate an income to support her family, which consists of her husband and her two young children (ages 1 and 2). She had no doubts about starting this business. Today her main customers are women with families who purchase with cash. Yolanda works every day from 7:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. She buys her goods at the public market where the prices are competitive. Her greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to grow and expand like she had hoped.

For this reason, Yolanda is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy provisions, snacks, beverages, dairy products, meats, and everything else that her neighbors need since they are her loyal customers.

loans.use: to buy provisions, snacks, beverages, dairy products, meats, and other products.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with three children. She is 37 years old and three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosalie has a direct selling business, selling Avon, Natasha and Personal Collection products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal care products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 51 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming vegetables for 20 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ailet

texts.en:
Ailet is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 27 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Ailet has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ailet has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 53-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines and has a fishing business.

She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a fishing net and bamboo poles and to pay for maintenance for her boat.

Zenaida has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and bamboo poles and to pay for maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a married woman, 49 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Amalia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Amalia requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and bamboo and pay for maintenance of her boat.

Amalia has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and bamboo and pay for maintenance of her boat

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with three children. She is 48 years old and two of her children are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Myrna has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more meat, chicken meat and eggs to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat, chicken meat and eggs to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Maria de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee un molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia,  con lo que obtiene en su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero como no tiene suficiente capital, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra y asi ella y su esposo puedan vivir más seguros.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has a boiled corn mill located in her home. With what she earns from her work and help form her husband, they have succeeded in moving forward with the household expenses. 

She wants to improve her house by building a perimeter wall in the place shown in the photograph. However, she doesn’t have enough capital. She is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron and to pay workers. With this, she and her husband will be able to live more safely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron and to pay workers.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elena  se dedica al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Elena works as a primary school teacher. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. Maria Elena wants to get ahead in her job. Her dream is to also have a clothing store. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a television for her house.

Maria Elena is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has established her business. She was able to increase her funds used for her variety store business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go towards additional groceries for her store. She will also buy more raw ingredients and supplies she needs to make more viands and food she sells so she can increase her profit from her business. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Margarita aims to give her children a good life in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional groceries she needs in her store and buy ingredients and supplies to continue operating her canteen.

loans.name: Nilcy Clereth

texts.es:
La joven Nilcy de 21 años de edad vive con su conyugue, tiene un  hijo  que depende de él,  radica en la comunidad del Jícaro Galán Nacaome, Valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años  al negocio de la elaboración y venta de rosquillas y quesadillas, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que ella visita casi a diario para ofrecer sus productos, esta joven es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Nilcy esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz y leña que son la materia prima para hacer las rosquillas, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar su calidad de vida porque tendrá más ganancias porque a si tendrá capital para comprar la materia prima es un cliente nuevo.
Nilcy su sueño es salir adelante luchando por su familia.
 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2015.
texts.en:
Nilcy is a young woman who is 21 years of age. She lives with her husband and they have a son who is dependent on them. They moved to the community of Jícaro Galán Nacaome, Valle al Sur, Honduras, where they have a home of their own. Nilcy has been preparing and selling “rosquillas” (cornmeal donuts) and pound cakes for five years. Her customers include friends and people who visit her just about every day in order to buy the products she offers. This hardworking young woman has dreams of moving forward.

Nilcy is requesting a loan in order to buy corn and firewood, which are the main supplies that she needs for making donuts. With the help of this loan, she intends to improve her quality of life because having more income means that she will have the capital for buying supplies.

Nilcy is a new client. Her dream is to get ahead along with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – February 2015

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for making donuts.

loans.name: Sunarianto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Sunarianto. Sunarianto lives in North Bogor, a suburban area located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his three sons. Sunarianto owns a stall that sells mobile phone accessories and mobile airtime credits. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to expand his business using technology.

As the business grows, Sunarianto needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are. Sunarianto’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan.

As seen in the photo, Sunarianto is the one who is standing in his own stall, together with his wife. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Manuel Dario

texts.es:
Manuel con 24 años de edad, vive en una finca con algunos familiares. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Hace 3, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comercialización de cerdos, pues los compra, los cría, engorda y posteriormente los vende según el peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus padres. 
El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito con la Corporación Interactuar, para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos, lechones y concentrado, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos. 

De esta manera, Manuel espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño principal, que es formalizar su negocio y montar un expendio de carne, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y lograr una estabilidad económica.
Mejora la vida de este colombiano con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Manuel, aged 24, lives in a farm with some relatives. 

Throughout his productive life, he has been following several occupations independently, with which he has generated income to support his family.

Three years ago, he began selling pigs. He buys them, raises them, fattens them and then sells them according to their weight. This occupation allows him to obtain the means to keep on providing his parents with care and support.

He is a hard-working and energetic man, who strives every day to get ahead motivated by his family. This is what led him to apply for a loan with the Interactuar Corporation. He will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs, piglets, and feed. In this way, he will be able to have a sufficient supply to fulfill his orders and improve his profit margin and income.

This is how Manuel hopes to move a step closer towards fulfilling his main dream, which is to formalize his business and set up a meat shop that is profitable and lasting so as to achieve financial stability.

Improve the life of a Colombian with a loan!

loans.use: to buy pigs, piglets, and feed.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Estrella is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Estrella has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Estrella has been in this business for one year. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Wardaja

texts.en:
Wardaja is a 32-year-old, active borrower of Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband is a guardian of her entire family and he is responsible for fulfilling all their needs. Wardaja has been providing the services of bookbinding for the past six years. Both husband and wife contribute their income to manage the household. 

Wardaja needs bookbinding materials (e.g., glue, tape, paper, and blades) for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy all these things for her business use. 

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Wardaja can purchase all the relevant items for her business, to provide better services of bookbinding and earn maximum profit, to make savings to fulfill the needs of her family.

Wardaja is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bookbinding business.

loans.name: Risin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Risin. Risin lives in West Bogor, a suburban area located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Risin works as an employee in a private company. He joined Ruma last year, and he decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to start up a business using technology. Risin is a really hardworking man and his community sees him as a friendly and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Risin needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credit to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are . Risin’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Risin is the one who is sitting. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Bismona Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario es integrado tres mujeres luchadoras: Elsa Juana vende prendas de plata, Andrea Isaura vende mariscos y Maribel que vende productos de belleza por catálogo. Todas viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace 6 meses, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana para poder tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Bismona es una comunidad miskita de la Región Autónoma de la Costa Caribe Norte (RACCN).

Andrea Isaura: Es integrante del grupo solidario es una mujer optimista de 30 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia Miskita. Esta casada, tiene un hijo pequeño de 3 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como conductor de un taxi. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingreso y apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería, en el corredor de su casa de tambo de Madera. Está solicitando su tercer financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías entre otros productos. Con el crédito anterior otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado a través de KIVA, le permitieron diversificar sus productos, actualmente también vende frijoles cocidos, verduras y bastimentos. Ella sueña con tener una tienda de ropa usada y ampliar su pequeña pulpería.

Igualmente, con el crédito otorgado anteriormente por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, le permitió a Elsa Juana, coordinadora del Grupo Solidario BISMONA, construir poco a poco 6 cuartos de madera que alquila y con apoyo económico de su esposo. También, continúa dedicándose a la venta ambulante de los productos de belleza y ha diversificado sus productos al ofertar prendas de oro laminado y acero. De esta manera, ha tenido la oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar poco a poco su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is composed of three spirited women: Elsa Juana sells silver articles, Andrea Isaura sells seafood and Maribel sells beauty products by catalog. They all live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. They organized six months ago with the purpose of working in solidarity to access loans in Pana Pana to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses, improve their incomes and improve the quality of life for their families. Bismona is a Miskito community of the Autonomous Region of the North Caribbean Coast ( RACCN ).

Andrea Isaura is a member of the solidarity group. She is an optimistic 30-year-old of Miskito ethnicity. She is married and has a 3-year-old son. Her husband works informally as a taxi driver. She established a small grocery store 3 years ago in the hallway of her wooden, tambo-style home with the goal of having her own source of income and to help with household expenses. She is requesting her third financing to buy basic grains and Chiverías dairy products, among other products. With the previous loan granted by Pana Pana and funded through KIVA, she was able to diversify her products and now also sells baked beans, vegetables and provisions. She dreams of owning a used clothing store and expanding her small store.

Similarly, the loan previously granted by Pana Pana and funded by KIVA, along with financial support from her husband, allowed Elsa Juana, coordinator of the solidarity Group Bismona, to slowly build 6 rooms of wood to rent. She is still engaged in peddling beauty products and has diversified her products to offer articles covered in gold and steel. Thus, she has had the opportunity to increase her income and gradually improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy basic grains, Chiveria dairy products, and more.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a  23-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband owns a printing shop, and her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. 

Ayesha has been running her own beauty salon for past six years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household. She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purposes. 

Therefore Ayesha has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Ayesha is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible to provide for the needs of his family. Suriya also provides sewing services to earn income to contribute to the management of the household. 
 
She needs different kinds of goods for her business, such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. Due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items and help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, cloth, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing traditional dishes.

loans.name: Belisario

texts.es: Belisario de 64 años de edad, vende calzado, bisutería ropa y mucho de lo que su clientela le solicita y está en sus manos resolverle su pedido. Hace 10 años, buscando obtener nuevos ingresos sus amigas lo impulsaron a que comercializara mercancía y hoy es un gran comerciante que utiliza un canal directo de ventas, mediante el sistema de contado y a crédito, trabajando en una frecuencia diaria que in icia desde las 8 de la mañana hasta a las 4 de la tarde, comprando en almacenes de la ciudad que le ofrecen precios competitivos. Su meta es ampliar las ventas  de su negocio y en un futuro comprar su casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará jeans, suéteres, sudaderas, aretes y diversos detalles que adornan a las mujeres, pues ellas son su principal mercado de clientes.Con esta inversión tendra un nuevo capital que le permitirá ensanchar sus compras y vender mucho mas que es su meta principal.
texts.en:
Belisario is 64 years old. He sells shoes, trinkets, clothes, and many other items. Whatever his customers ask for, his hand are able to fulfill their requests. Ten years ago, Belisario was looking for ways to earn additional income. His friends suggested that he sell merchandise and now he is a successful trader who utilizes direct sales channels. By using a cash and credit system, he works every day starting at 8:00 A.M. and ends at 4:00 P.M. He buys his goods at stores in the city that offer competitive prices. His goals are to increase his business sales and purchase a house in the future.

Belisario is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy jeans, sweaters, sweatshirts, earrings, and various women’s accessories since women are his main customers. This investment will provide new capital that will allow him to broaden his purchases so that he can sell more, which is his main goal.

loans.use: to buy jeans, sweaters, sweatshirts, earrings, and various women’s accessories.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 55 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, etc.

Jesusa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as the ones listed above. She would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 57 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Philippines and is in the agricultural business of pig fattening. Alicia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alicia has been in the pig fattening business for 15 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 29 times in the past to sustain her enterprise. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: William Sigfredo

texts.es:
William, comparte una vivienda familiar con su padre, hermanos, su esposa y un hijo de 2 años de edad, es propietario de una carpintería, la cual atiende de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., su padre le enseño el oficio y le colabora en su negocio, él trabaja con mucha dedicación para tener a sus clientes satisfechos y generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
Invertirá únicamente madera con la que elaborara los muebles para vender y por encargo que ofrece a sus clientes, fortalecerá su negocio, podrá continuar trabajando para salir adelante con su familia y poder cancelar la deuda adquirida, el riesgo es que no administre bien el crédito y tenga que vender los muebles a un bajo precio.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio en el mercado para dar a su familia una mejor alimentación, educación y vestuario.
texts.en:
William shares his family home with his father, siblings, wife, and a 2-year-old son. He is the owner of a carpentry shop, which he takes care of from 8:00am to 5:00pm. His father taught him the work, and he collaborates with his father in his business. He works with a lot of dedication to ensure his clients are satisfied and to generate income to cover his family’s needs. 

He will invest only in wood, with which he makes furniture to sell and for orders that he offers to his clients. He will strengthen his business, and he will be able to continue working to move forward with his family and to be able to repay his debts. The risk is that he doesn’t manage the loan well and then has to sell his furniture at a low price. 

His dreams are to sustain his business in the market to give his family better food, education, and clothing.

loans.use: to invest only in wood, with which he makes furniture to sell and for orders that he offers to his clients.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible to provide for the needs of the family. Rehana also provides sewing services to earn income to contribute to the management of their household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods for her business, such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. Due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items and will help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, cloth, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Catalina

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 30 años de edad, que desde hace 2 años comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que un familiar le cedió para que la trabajara y generara ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.
Este negocio lo atiende todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para subsistir. 

El crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor como mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros, realizar mejoras locativas y ampliaciones, esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.

Claudia, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Claudia is 30 years old. She began to work at different jobs beginning at the age of 2. She currently has a grocery store a relative gave her so she could work to generate income to pay for household expenses. The business is open daily from 7am to 8pm and has performed well despite the competition in the sector, generating enough income to survive.

The loan she is seeking through Kiva partner Interact Corporation is intended to buy a wholesale assortment of "mecato" (snacks, potato chips, pork rinds, pastries and other packaged potato and plantain products), milk, biscuits, cereal, etc., as well as to implement location and expansion improvements. This will allow her to offer a better variety of products to meet the immediate needs of her customers, increasing sales and revenue received for her work.

Claudia's spirit of perseverance and desire to succeed for her family drives her to keep fighting and move forward to fulfill the dream of purchasing a home, where she can enjoy a better quality of life with her family and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: buy wholesale assortment of "mecato" (snacks, potato chips, pork rinds, pastries and other packaged potato and plantain products), milk, biscuits, cereal, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 50 years old and has eight children. Francisca is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Francisca is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Francisca has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is 32 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son and two daughters. Her children are students. Her husband has been running his own garment business for 9 years. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Sumaira's husband needs to purchase different types of garments and accessories in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these items. Therefore Sumaira is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will be able to assist her husband in purchasing these items in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits with the help of this loan amount.

Sumaira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy garments and accessories for her husband's garment business.

loans.name: Luz Amanda

texts.es:
La cría de gallinas es la actividad de la señora Luz Amanda, una mujer cabeza de familia, que adecuo en el patio de su hogar dicho negocio, con la intención de tener su familia cerca, tiene tres hijas de 13,14 y 19 años de edad, todas estudiando y capacitándose para ser unas futuras universitarias, pero mientras ellas estudian, Luz Amanda está trabajando fuertemente con sus gallinas, recogiendo huevos, engordando pollos para sacar la utilidad con la que mantiene su hogar.

El sueño de Luz Amanda es poder comprar una vivienda propia, quiere dejarles herencia, un negocio y algo con la que puedan vivir por si algún motivo ella les llegase a faltar.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de gallinas, pollos y construir un corral ya que el que tiene esta muy poblado.

Es importante Apoyar a esta empresaria porque es el claro ejemplo de una madre pujante que persigue un sueño para beneficiar a sus hijas, trabajando con humildad y honestidad.
texts.en:
Luz Amanda is the head of her family and is in the business of raising chickens. She reconfigured the patio of her home so that she could establish this business with the intention of having her family nearby. Luz Amanda has three daughters (ages 13, 14, and 19), all of whom are studying and training so that they can attend the university in the future. While her children are in school, Luz Amanda works hard looking after the chickens. She collects the eggs and fattens the birds so that she can earn a profit and sustain her household.

Luz Amanda dreams of buying a house of her own so that she can leave behind an inheritance, a business, and something that can live on after she is gone. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in hens and chickens, as well as build a coop since the existing one is overcrowded.

It is important to support this entrepreneur because she is a prime example of a thriving mother who pursues her dream of providing for her daughters and working with humility and honesty.

loans.use: to buy hens and chickens and to build a coop.

loans.name: Sovannaseth

texts.en:
Sovannaseth is a 20-year-old unmarried freshman who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree in management. He lives in Phnom Penh in Cambodia. He has worked as a cashier since 2014 and makes 4 USD a day.

Sovannaseth is applying for a 350 USD loan through KREDIT because he hasn’t enough money to pay for his second-semester tuition fees. With this loan he will be able to fully finance his first year at the university.

After graduation Sovannaseth is going to find a better job with a decent salary.

loans.use: to pay his second-semester tuition fees

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru:
Рузигул 53 летняя жительница района Чиликул. Она замужем мать двоих сыновей. Старший сын женат,  и он находится за границей, чтобы зарабатывать и помочь родителям обеспечить семью. Младший сын школьник. Он дома помогает маме в работе. 
Рузигул 35 лет своей жизни занимается сельскохозяйственной культуры. Она занимается животноводством. Кроме животноводства, она выращивает морковь. Рузигул уже собрала богатый урожай и занята продажей овощи. Рузигул хочет обработать земли с минеральными удобрениями и начать посев нового урожая. У Рузигул недостаточно денежных средств, чтобы купить минеральные удобрение для обработки земли, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Это кредит поможет ей приобрести минеральные удобрения и начать новый посев урожай.
texts.en:
Ruzigul is a 53-year-old resident of the Jilikul district. She is married and a mother of two sons. Her oldest son is married and is currently abroad in order to earn money and help his parents to provide for the family. The youngest son is a school student. He helps his mother with work at home.

Ruzigul has been involved in agriculture for 35 years. She is involved in animal husbandry and also grows carrots. Ruzigul already gathered a rich harvest and is currently involved in selling vegetables. Ruzigul wants to treat the soil with mineral fertilizers and start planting the new crop. Ruzigul does not have enough money to buy mineral fertilizers for treating the land and requested a loan for this reason. This loan will help her to buy mineral fertilizers and start to plant the new crop.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and start to plant the new crop

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Это женщина Фируза. Ей 32 лет. Она жительница района Чиликул. Фируза в районе проживает вместе мужем и детьми. У нее трое детей. Ее муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью . Сама Фируза тоже занимается этой видом бизнесом.  Она выращивает огурцы и помидоры. Фируза сейчас готовила земли для посева нового урожая. У нее нет денег для приобретения семян овощи, по этой причине Фируза обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести семян овощи и быстрее начать сев урожай. Она нуждается в Вашей поддержке.
texts.en: This is Firuza. She is 32 years old. She lives in the Jilinkul region with her husband and three children. Her husband is a farmer. Firuza also does farm work. She grows cucumbers and tomatoes. Firuza has been preparing her soil for the new planting season. She lacks the money to buy vegetable seeds, which is why she has applied for a loan to buy seeds and start planting sooner. She needs your support.

loans.use: to buy cucumber and watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna works hard to support her family. Elna is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Elna requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her business.

Elna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pig fattening business.

loans.name: Lucelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lucelda works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and a general store business. Lucelda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Lucelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 39 years old and married with six children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Susan has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Susan aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, a married 41-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are currently in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been operating a food vending business in the Philippines for 19 years.

Zenaida is requesting a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. Elena is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Elena requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia, 48, is married and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her son and two daughters. For the past eight years her husband has sold clothing to support the family. He is the only breadwinner in his household. He needs to increase his stock of clothing to sell but has too little money to do so.

Therefore, Asia is applying for a 20,000 PKR loan through BRAC Pakistan to finance the purchase of clothes in bulk for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan he can build up his business and earn a greater income.

Asia wishes to thank Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to finance the purchase of clothes in bulk for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Rozi

texts.en:
Rozi is 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three sons and one daughter. Her children are doing studies. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for six years. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Rozi is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 
Rozi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Angelee

texts.en:
Angelee is 25 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Angelee has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines. Angelee requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell to her customers.

Angelee has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Angelee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Phally makes a living, cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 32 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carina has a business selling imported products in the Philippines. Carina requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more imported products like toothpaste, soap, etc., to sell.

Carina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Carina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more imported products like toothpaste, soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine works hard to support her family. Catherine is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.

Catherine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Catherine has been in this business for six years now.

Catherine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Eloglan

texts.en: Eloglan is 44 years old. He is married, with three children, and lives with his family in the Fuzuli region. The family has been IDP (Internally Displacted Persons) from Füzuli city. This is Eloglan's second business. He is a taxi driver and has been at this business for four years. He has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,100 AZN to repair his car. With this loan Eloglan wants to buy a wheel and also will paint his car. And after repair his car his monthly income will increase. It should be noted that it’s his fourth loan. Previously he took a loan from Kiva organization and those loans to promote the development of his business. He thankful to Komak and Kiva for help. In the future he wants to change his car and help his children with education.

loans.use: to repair his car to increase business and allow him to buy a new car in the future

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.ru: Это Зулхумор. Ей 46 лет. Она жительница района Чиликул. Зулхумор замужем и мать одного ребенка. У нее 8 месячный ребенок. Ее муж занимается ремонтом домов. Зулхумор занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она ухаживает за ребенком, ведет домашнее хозяйство и  одновременно занимается выращиванием скота.  Зулхумор на все успевает. Ей в работе помогает муж. Зулхумор уже более 30 лет продвигает свой бизнес. Сейчас она хочет купить скота, чтобы развиваться дальше и не потерять  источник дохода. Доход от животноводства обеспечить ее семью. Из-за нехватки денег Зулхумор обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: This is Zulhumor. She is 46 years old. She is a resident of the Jilikul district. Zulhumor is married and a mother of one child, who is 8 months old. Her husband is involved in repairing houses. Zulhumor is involved in agriculture. She takes care of her child, runs the household and is concurrently involved in fattening up livestock. Zulhumor has time for all of it. Her husband helps her with the work. Zulhumor has been running her business for over 30 years. Now she wants to buy livestock to continue developing her business and retain her income source. The earnings from the animal husbandry business provide for her family. Zulhumor requested this loan due to a monetary shortage.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to retain her business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena’s primary source of income comes from her general store. She has been running her business for six years. Her husband is a tricycle driver as well as a cell phone dealer within their locality. She and her husband have been working hard in order to sustain their daily necessities and educate her youngest child. 

Magdalena plans to increase the grocery items she offers, but due to shortage of income she decided to ask for financial assistance from lenders in the amount of PHP 40,000. This loan amount will be used to buy grocery items such as boxes of canned goods, cooking oil, and five sacks of rice to sell. She knows that this loan will enable her to achieve her goal little by little.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as boxes of canned goods, cooking oil, and five sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz was born in 1996 and lives in a village in the western part of Tajikistan. He is freshman student. He had a dream to be a doctor from his childhood, and now he happily is studying at a medical college. Parviz is well known among students and friends. Teachers are all satisfied with his activity and capability. Unfortunately, his family does not earn enough money to pay the tuition fee of the university. His father is a teacher at a secondary school, and his mother is a house keeper.  Parviz is asking for financial support from Kiva to pay his tuition fee. He hopes to be a doctor and be helpful to society.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.en:
Gulandom is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1971. She is from the southern part of the country. She is living in a village. She is married. She has three children. She is an experienced and challenged person, and knows her duty well. 

She has been selling shoes and bags for almost 20 years. Her husband is an emigrant. She wants to enlarge her business. 

Gulandom is asking for financial support to buy shoes and bags to widen her business. 

She hopes that KIVA members will be merciful.

loans.use: to buy shoes and bags

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es: Ana de 27 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijas la mayor de 9 años de edad y la más pequeña de 6 meses de edad a las que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. Ella siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a sus hijas apoyada en su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas actividad que lleva realizando 3 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este negocio. Ana desea invertir más en su negocio ya que cada día son más los clientes que solicitan de sus productos, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en maíz por mayor y de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan seguir dando lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ana, age 27, is an enterprising woman who lives in her own home along with her two daughters. The older child is nine years old and the younger one is six months old. Ana has been able to get ahead as a single mother. She is always looking for ways to support her daughters through her business of making and selling tortillas, which has been in operation for three years. Ana is pleased to have this business.

Ana wants to invest more into her business because each day she has more customers who request her products. Therefore, she decided to request a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in corn in bulk amounts. This will help her generate more income, which will allow her to continue providing the best for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk amounts for making tortillas.

loans.name: Sorbon

texts.en:
Sorbon is an active man. He was born in 1994. He is from the southern part of the country. He is living in a remote district. He is single, and he is a student. 

Sorbon is well known among students and friends. He is a third year student. His parent’s salary is not enough to cover education costs for his studies. He is asking for financial support from a KIVA project to pay the tuition of the university. 

He awaits your assistance.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married and has five kids. Her husband is a fisherman who never gets tired of supporting their big family.

In 2013, she applied for membership in Paglaum MPC. Having heard of all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one. She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always repay her loans in a timely manner.

Recently, she has asked for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital for fishing. Marites hopes to buy new floaters and fish nets. Through this project, she believes she can raise more income and be of help for the expansion of their business.

Marites has found comfort in meeting their financial needs through Paglaum MPC, for which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase new nets and fishing accessories

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from five years to twelve years. He describes himself as faithful. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are of all types. 

John will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Howard

texts.en:
Howard is a married man. He has two children. He operates a welding business where he offers welding services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place, and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of welding items. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big garage. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of welding items

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a motorcycle transport business. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive place, and her primary customers are of all types. 

Jerusha describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to service and maintain her motorcycle. Her business goal is to own a motor vehicle within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service and maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest.

Nancy operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. Her business goal is to own a big charcoal store within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Her name is Riza, 25, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Rommel, she has one child who is still in the preparatory level in school. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs, and to send her child to school. 

Riza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 600 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting an Php 9,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as noodles, canned goods, beverages and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense and to send her child to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Riza hopes to maintain and grow her business so she could have a better life. She desires to always lead a peaceful and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries

loans.name: Litan

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Litan is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Litan works as a tailor, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. He uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines. as well as handstitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Litan is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Litan is asking for your assistance to help him circumvent loan sharks. He has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from his paycheck. He is seeking a 10,000 PHP loan to pay for his children’s educational expenses.

Litan wants for his children to complete their schooling and have a better future. He looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equip them with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness, and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Litan before starting their daily work routine.
