Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for the educational expenses of his two children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, maize, peas

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest.

Lucy operates a retail business where she sells spare parts and electrical supplies. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of spare parts and electrical supplies. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big shop. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of spare parts and electrical supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be honest.

John operates a retail business where he sells spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of spare parts. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big spare parts shop. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare parts

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest.

Kelvin operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil and other items. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will open a supermarket. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas has four children and operates a small general store where he sells such things as sugar, bread, flour and cooking oil. His shop is located in a good area and he sells to individuals frequenting his store. His biggest challenge is insufficient working capital.

Thomas has taken out and successfully repaid a previous loan through SMEP Microfinance Bank. He is now applying for a 20,000 KES loan to buy more sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil and other merchandise to sell. He is determined to be successful.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a live-in partner with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 48 years old, and her two children are in school.

Josephine has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like shells, nylon threads, wire, and other items necessary for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like shells, nylon threads, and wire for her business

loans.name: Papia

texts.en:
Papia is 70 years old and has six children. She is married.

Papia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Papia has been farming for 20 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Papia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leah is 37 years old and has one child in school.

Leah has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leah requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Leah has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Eula Mae is 19 years old and is the third of six children in the family. Her mother Alicia supports the family through her upholstery business in the Philippines.

Eula Mae is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education, majoring in English, and is currently in her second year of this four-year course.

Alicia is borrowing PHP 14,500 for her daughter tuition fee payment for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Eula Mae plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's student tuition fee.

loans.name: Yong's Group

texts.en:
Yong, 38, lives with family members in a rural village located in Kampong Cham province. She struggles to make a living via rice cropping. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 32,000 KHR per day.

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed. She hopes that she can make her living better than she could before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Tsiuri

texts.en:
Tsiuri is a 67-year-old single woman from village Akhalsopeli district. She lives alone and earns a living with agricultural activities. 

Tsiuri requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her trading business startup but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. The only source of income for the family is a small-scale family agricultural business. She is engaged in cattle breeding and in cultivating family-owned land, where Tsiuri harvests maize and nuts. 

Her monthly income is 250-300 GEL. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tsiuri requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. 

With the received credit, Tsiuri will purchase stock of clothing and will start local trading. She will sell products with a price mark-up and will be able to generate additional income. 

The loan will greatly assist this hardworking woman, and she will be very grateful for the help.

loans.use: to start trading in clothing and get additional income

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Chi Kreng district, Ly is aged 31 years and married with three children, two of whom are in school while another one is too young for school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, fishing and raising pigs. Having been in this business for several years, she manages to earn about 29,000 KHR per day.

ly has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and fish for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs and fish so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and fish to raise.

location.town: Siem Reap province, Chi Kreng district

loans.name: Maen

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Presh Vihea province’s Ro Veang district, Maen is 30 years old and married. She has three dependent children. She is a farmer who grows cassava for a living. She has been in this business for 12 years, earning about 19,000 KHR per day for her family’s needs. 

Maen has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles and she wisely and successfully used the past two loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,200,000 KHR. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to grow her cassava healthily and fruitfully and also hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Vanthy

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kos Krolo district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Vanthy, 32, is married with two children. She and her husband grow rice and plant corn as the main business for the family’s income. Having been in the business for several years, they can earn about 33,000KHR per day to respond to the family’s needs. 

Vanthy has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past two loans to improve her family’s livelihood. 

To better support her current business, she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000KHR to buy fertilizer and sesame seeds for her farmland; she will also use a portion of it to spend for labor. 

She hopes to increase crop yields to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and sesame seeds for her farmland

loans.name: J E L C Shg-B Group

texts.en:
J E L C Shg-B Group is an exemplary group. They all are engaged in different activities to earn their livelihoods. One of them is Darshni who is engaged in agricultural activities, Santimani is running a grocery shop, and Prisakila sells vegetables. 

One person who deserves to be highlighted is Darshni, a 44-year-old married woman with two sons, who is engaged in cultivating vegetables and selling them in the market. In the picture, the lady standing first from left is Darshni. 

Through her job, she works to support her family, to improve her business and to continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. She is seeking part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other vegetables and fruits to continue to increase her sales. The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Francisca to improve her business. She has a business where many people come to buy. She will buy such materials as webbing and fabric. She has involved herself in business activities since 2013. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Francisca independent, because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy webbing and fabric.

loans.name: Jamshad Bibi

texts.en:
Jamshad Bibi, age 55, is a mother of seven children. She has owned a knitting business for the past five years, which is the only source of income for her family. Jamshad Bibi needs to purchase new varieties of knitting material to resell. However, due to a lack of money she finds it difficult. This will help her offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. therefore jamshad bibi is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her family.
Jamshad bibi will purchase knitting tools and new variety of knitting materials. Jamshad bibi is feeling happy that she will be able to help her family with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her knitting business

loans.name: J E L C Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Tilottama is a 33-year-old lady. She is living in Odisha with her parents, husband and her two children who are schooling. Her husband is a farmer. For the past two years, Tilottama has been engaged in the activity of selling cow’s milk in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity. Tilottama is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the secretary of the group, J E L C Self-Help Group-D. 

There are three members in the group, and all are women. The members of the group are involved in different kinds of activities like agriculture or grocery shops. 

Along with her group, she has requested a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. Tilottama has a dream to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and repair her cow shed.

loans.name: Los Manzaneros De Chuabaj Group

texts.es:
Manuela (es la señora que se ubica en medio de la fotografía) es una mujer de 32 años de edad, es casada tiene dos hijos de los cuales ya trabajan, ella vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuela desde hace ocho años se dedica  a la elaboración de ropa típica de su región, esta labor lo realiza ella con el único fin de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia.
Manuela una mujer luchadora y responsable que no se limite ante nada, es por eso que ahora se ha propuesto a mejorar la calidad de sus tejidos, pero como ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar esta inversión, ha organizado a un grupo de mujeres que también tienen la misma actividad para solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá comprando más hilos de tipo seda, alemán, lustrina, lana.
Manuela sueña con poder tener algún día un local donde pueda ella vender su propio producto.
texts.en:
Manuela (the woman in the middle of the photo) is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are already working. She lives in the community of Sololá.

Manuela has been producing the traditional clothes of her region for the past eight years. This work is her only means of generating income in order to sustain her family.

Manuela is a determined and responsible woman who is not limited by anything. For this reason, she has decided to improve the quality of her woven goods. However, she does not have sufficient funds to make this investment. Therefore, she organized a group of women who are in the same line of work. They are requesting a loan so that they can invest in the purchase of thread made from silk, cotton, wool, and synthetic material.

Manuela dreams of having a shop one day where she can sell her own products.

loans.use: to buy thread made from silk, cotton, wool, and synthetic material.

loans.name: J E L C Shg-E Group

texts.en:
J E L C Self Help Group-E has 2 members who are both from the same neighborhood. The lady standing first from left is Sanamati. 

Sanamati is a 47-year-old married woman from a small village of Odisha, India. The couple has two children who are schooling. Sanamati lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. For past five years she has been involved in the activity of growing and selling vegetables. Her husband and her parents help her in this activity. 

In order to strengthen the business and respond to customer demand, Sanamati and Purni have requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Their goal is to expand their business activity. Purni is engaged in the same activity as Sanamati.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating vegetables.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita, forty, is married and living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three daughters. For the past seven years her husband has been running a dishware shop. He is the sole breadwinner in the family. He wants to buy different types of dishware, such as jugs, glasses and dinner sets, to better serve his customers, but he is unable to do so due to financial constraints.

Sunita has applied for a 30,000 PKR loan through BRAC Pakistan to help her husband stock his shop. The loan will help him increase his daily sales and so earn greater profits to better run his business and cover his family's needs.

Sunita is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to help her husband stock his dishware shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home solution for longer productive hours.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home solution to illuminate her workspace for clients

loans.name: Minea

texts.en: Minea is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 20 years old. She lives in a one floor house, made of wood and cement with her aunt's family. They are 6 altogether. Her aunt's family owns 4 hectares of rice field and 5 hectares of cassava field. Before weaving, she was helping in the fields and helping her aunt with the family business. Since she is a weaver, she is much more independant in her life. Indeed, in 2012, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,  a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Minea makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses.  Thanks to the loan,  she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home solution to have more productive hours.

loans.name: Juan Agustin

texts.es: Juan de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, y lo la comercializa en los mesas de diciembre a febrero en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old and lives with his wife and their son in a house that they own.  Juan works growing corn, which he has done for 10 years.  When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries that are pictured, and sells it in December through February throughout the neighboring towns.  With his earnings, he is able to get ahead.  

Juan is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, manure, herbicides, etc., in order to continue with his crops and improve his earnings.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, pesticides, manure, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, iron, wire, and sand.

loans.name: Perry

texts.en:
Perry  is 54 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. He is from the village of Gata Daku in Clarin municipality, a part of Misamis Occidental province in the Mindano islands. Perry plants and harvests coconuts to sell. He has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Perry joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services.  He decided again to take a loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to finance labor costs for his farm’s maintenance and to purchase fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to finance labor costs for his farm’s maintenance and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Grides Yesenia

texts.es:
La Señora Grides Vive con sus dos hijos en la colonia bella vista de santa cruz de yojoa, tiene un negocio de comedor en el proyecto la vegona de la hidroeléctrica en el que atiende a los trabajadores de dicha represa, ella solicita el crédito para poder invertir en su negocio en Carnes, Aceite, Frijoles, Arroz, Azucar, Leche, Condimientos y otros productos para hacer sus comidas y obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su clientela una buena atención, ella espera que con este crédito va poder mantener y mejorar sus ventas y dar una buena atención.
El sueño de Grides es mantener el negocio y luchar por sus hijos para que tengan lo necesario para una buena educación.  






Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras –Febrero-2015
texts.en:
Sra. Grides lives with her two children in the beautiful neighbourhood of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. She runs a cafe in La Vegona hydroelectric project where the dam workers go to eat.

She is seeking a loan to buy meat, oil, beans, rice, sugar, milk, spices etc. for the dishes she makes and to improve her income. Her customers would benefit also from the better service she would provide. With this loan Grides expects to increase sales and provide better service. Her dream is to continue with her business and work hard so that her children have all they need to get a good education.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras – February 2015

loans.use: meat, oil, beans, rice, sugar, milk, spices etc. for the dishes she makes

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married nother of two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more cereals. Her business goal is to have improved business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standard..

loans.use: to buy more cereals

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a single man who repairs shoes for a living. He also is a farmer. For the past five years he has pursued his trade in a busy neighborhood where his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

Hillary has taken out and successfully repaid a prior loan through SMEP Microfinance Bank. He is now applying for a 20,000 KES loan to buy shoe repair materials and farm inputs. He is focused on being a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoe repair materials and farm inputs.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with two children. He describes himself as experienced. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, cooking oil, soap, salt, and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years.

His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are locals. He notes that insufficient working capital is his biggest business challenge. 

This is George's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Having successfully repaid his previous loan, he will use this KES 100,000 loan to buy more flour, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and other items to sell. His business goal is to have a successful business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, soap, cooking oil. and other items to sell

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is a married mother of two children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a beauty salon. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of salon materials. Serah will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have a big salon within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Mlicrofinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items needed in her general store. Her store earnings helped send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. Aside from her small store, she also has a small salon and sells Personal Collection brand of personal products for additional income.

Melba would now like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy hair dyes, shampoo, hot oil, conditioner, and hair scissors needed for her salon and as well as Personal Collection brand of personal products to sell. Her salon is quite well known in her area for the good service. She also has regular customers for her personal products. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her for a good return on her investment for it will surely fund her everyday personal and household needs.    

Melba dreams of having a bigger salon to attract more customers. She prays for long life and good health for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beauty supplies and hair products such as hair dye, shampoo, conditioner, towels, and scissors for her salon and some personal products to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This entrepreneur's name is Susan. She is 46 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, a driver/bodyguard, and has three children. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to pay for their daily household needs and the schooling of her children.

Susan has been running a direct selling business for 11 years already. She sells beauty products, generic medicines, and dish-washing soaps. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family, and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan, which she will use to pay for goods to sell at her retail store, including personal beauty items such as lotion, face and body powder, and whitening soaps, as well as generic medicines and dish-washing soaps. Filipinos prefer to buy branded personal goods for their good quality, while they are given to buying generic medicines instead of the branded ones for economic reasons. Susan is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given to her, for it will surely help cover their daily needs and her children's education.   

Susan aims to grow her business and send her children to the best schools. Her dream is to see her children become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for personal beauty products, generic medicines, and dish-washing soaps to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 46 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For 10 years, Evelyn has operated a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 17,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is married with one child and works hard to support her family. She has a livestock business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her sari sari, or general store.

Emelita has successfully borrowed and repaid two prior loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She is now borrowing 9000 PHP through NWTF to buy more livestock to add to her business. Her goal is to use her increase in profits to repair and renovate her family’s home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to add to her business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marcelina is 44 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Marcelina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Marcelina has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rolando works hard to support his family.

He has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a general store. Rolando is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more items like footwear and other home products to resell.

Rolando has been sustaining his business activities through his past 25 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of saving money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more items like footwear and other home products to resell.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 45 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a cafeteria in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional coffee, milk, sugar, etc., for her cafeteria business.

Lucresia has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the cafeteria for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coffee, milk, sugar, etc., for her coffee shop

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 39 years old and married with three children currently in school. Lucy works very hard to provide for her family.

Lucy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like shampoo, candies, detergent soap, noodles, soft drinks, cooking oil, and eggs to sell.

Lucy has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Lucy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like shampoo, candies, detergent soap, noodles, soft drinks, cooking oil, and eggs to sell

loans.name: Dukangurane Group

texts.fr:
Léonidas fait partie du groupe  Dukangurane et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 34 ans et est marié à Spès, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants dont  1 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce du  riz, du haricot, de la farine de manioc,... dans sa boutique depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, et de haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Léonidas is part of the group Dukangurane and he lives in Gitega. He is 34 years old and is married to Spès, a farmer. Together they have 3 children, of which 1 studies. They have conducted business in rice, beans, cassava flour, etc. in their shop for 5 years. He is on his first loan at Turame. With the Kiva loan that he obtains, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell in order to earn more.

loans.use: to increase his capital and to buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell to earn more.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa, 54, is married and has eight children, one of whom is still in school. For the past twelve years she has had a shell craft business in the Philippines.

Leonisa has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more shells and other materials for her business. She is continually working hard to build her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells and other materials for her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, tiene una hermosa familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre once y diecisiete años.
Elena madre de familia trabajadora y dedicada, ella para que a su familia no le haga falta nada tomo la iniciativa de tener una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotería, en su propia casa esta tiendita lo tienen ella desde hace 9 años desde ese entonces es su fuente de ingresos.
Elena es una mujer optimista y luchadora que ahora ha tomado la iniciativa de hacer de su negocio algo más grande pero para poder hacer esto ella necesita de un buen capital, pero una de las limitaciones que Elena tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para poder realizar esta inversión, por tal  motivo ella solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 que lo invertirá comprando arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, recitos, gaseosas.
Elena sueña con tener un negocio más grande y mejorar sus ingresos para poder comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Elena is a 35-year-old woman who lives in the community of Sololá. She has a beautiful family that includes four children between the ages of 11 and 16.

Elena is a hardworking and dedicated mother. Wanting to see that her family lacks nothing, she took the initiative to set up a store in her home where she could buy and sell groceries. She has been in business for nine years and the store serves as her source of income.

Elena is an optimistic and determined woman. She now wants to make her business larger, but she needs capital to do this. One of her limitations is that she does not have sufficient funds for making this investment. For this reason, Elena is requesting a loan of 5,000 GTQ so that she can invest in the purchase of rice, oil, sugar, beans, snack foods, and sodas.

Elena’s dream is to have a larger business and better earnings so that she can buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, snack foods, and sodas for her store.

loans.name: Maria Deicy

texts.es:
Maria es soltera y vive con sus padres. Aparte de su estudio, desea dedicarse a la agricultura impulsada por sus padres para que salga adelante.

Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. 

Ella y su familia viven en zona rural de Argelia en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que ofrece la Corporación Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas de frijol, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus futuros cultivos.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Maria sueña terminar con salir adelante y ser profesional.
 ¡Impacte la vida de Maria y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Maria is single and lives with her parents. In addition to her studies, with the support of her parents, she also wants to work in agriculture in order to get ahead. She learned how to farm empirically, through a lot of practice and observing others.  She lives with her family in a rural region of Argella, where it is difficult to access financial services such as those offered by the Corporación Interactuar.

She plans on using her loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as bean seeds, pesticides and fertilizers to care for and sustain her future crops.  With this loan, her family's financial situation and quality of life will improve thanks to the increase in income.  Maria dream of getting ahead and becoming a professional.  

Impact the lives of Maria and her family with this loan!

loans.use: purchase farming supplies such as bean seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.en: Ricardena is 30 years and married with one child. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She applied for her first loan which helped her business and now is applying for her second loan of $1.000.(USD). Ricardena will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as slippers, water, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs, soap, body lotion and books. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy slippers,water,noodles,cigarettes,sugar,coffee,salt,eggs,soap,body lotion and books

loans.name: Famille Masikita Group

texts.fr: Après constat que la culture du café évoluait positivement, Donatien a enfin décidé de s'y lancer assisté de son épouse Pélagie (voir photo). Ensemble, ils ont actuellement pu prendre en charge les besoins familiaux. Le manque de produits phytosanitaires, l'absence de moulin à café et les outils appropriés pour différents travaux du café constituent un obstacle mais Donatien n'a pas perdu tout espoir car il projette équiper sa maison et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: After noting that coffee farming was evolving positively, Donatien finally decided to take it up, aided by his wife Pélagie (see the photo). Together, they have currently been able to take charge of the family needs. The lack of control of plant diseases and the absence of a coffee mill and the appropriate tools for different work with coffee, constitute an obstacle. But, Donatien has not lost all hope because he plans to equip his house and school his children.

loans.use: to hire labor for hoeing

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
This is Zamira, an Egyptian Albanian divorced mother of a grownup son who lives with her; she is 46 years old and seeking your financial help to buy used shoes so that her son can resell them. She has been doing this type of activity for a living for the past fifteen years. 

Buying/selling old staff has been a booming activity among the Roma/Egyptian community since the collapse of the regime. Zamira also receives a disability income of about $170/month and very recently she started looking after an elderly couple; thus, she passed on the shoe-selling activity to her son "I do what I can to survive; I never say no to any type of work,” said Zamira.

loans.use: to stock up on used shoes so that her son can resell them.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda (pictured) is 37 years old, She lives at Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has two sons. They are attending school.

Chenda is a farmer with 21 years of experiences; her husband is a farmer, too. 

Chenda is applying for loan to do farming, like planting vegetables such as cabbages and watermelons.. She wants to increase her profits and support her family.

loans.use: To do farming, like planting vegetables such as cabbages and watermelons.

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Inviolata, who is in her mid 50s is a divorcee with three grown-up kids.  She has been selling soft drinks for five years now.  She works from 08 am to 06 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Inviolata's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to keep increasing the soft drinks stock.  She has repaid her loan.  She used the profit to take care of herself, make loan repayments and cover household expenses.  Inviolata will use this loan to buy more soft drinks to meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of building her own house.

Inviolata will share this loan with her loan group "Lindi," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 44 years old. She is blessed with 5 children who are currently in school. She has been a farmer for the last 14 years. 

She has asked for a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to pay school fees.

Her hopes and dream for the future is to be a great farmer, supplying food to the community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Twenty-eight year old Leah engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. She has been engaged in rice farming for 8 years. She is married woman with a nine year old child from Talibon, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, nipa and bamboo. These will help improve the yield of her farm. In the coming months, she will be able to sell more rice and start to augment her income. She could then continue to finance the schooling of her child.

In the future, Leah hopes that she will be able to provide her child with quality education .

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, nipa and bamboo

loans.name: Nyasho Group

texts.en:
Juliana, who is in her early forties, is single with six children, three boys and three girls. All of her children are still in school.  She has been running a retail shop for twenty years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly report.  

This will be Juliana's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, coconuts, flour, cooking oil, and other items for her shop inventory. She dreams of opening another shop in a different area.

Juliana will share this loan with her loan group Nyasho, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, coconuts, flour, cooking oil and other items for her shop inventory.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a farming business for 13 years. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for planting.  

This is his loan with VisionFund Kenya and with the anticipated profits, he will be able to increase his production  pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Desterio

texts.en:
Desterio is a 32-year-old man from the Kakamega region, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He is a married man with two children who are 2 and 4 years old.

He has been in the motorcycle business for the last 10 years and gets a monthly income of KES 12,000. He has applied for his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy spare parts and repair his motorbike. He will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business.

Desterio has a dream of developing his business so as to become more strong to help him support his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Marie Fhe

texts.en:
Marie Fhe is 37 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marie Fhe has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Marie Fhe requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business.

Marie Fhe has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marie Fhe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes

loans.name: Babet

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Babet works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a farming sugarcane, general store and raising goats businesses.  

Babet is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell to customers. Babet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bread, chicken, dressings, tomatoes, etc., as well as a new cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and sand to start on her modern residential house.

loans.name: Unguke Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne   fait partie du groupe  Unguke I et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 30 ans et est mariée  à Jérôme, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  dont  4 étudient.

Elle   fait le commerce de la bière industrielle et de la bière de banane depuis 5 ans. 

Elle est à son  huitième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière industrielle et de bière locale  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member of the Unguke I' Group and lives in Gitega.  She is 30 years old and married to Jérôme, a farmer.  Together they have six children, of whom four attend school.

Jeanne has been selling commercial beer and local beer for five years.  This will be her eighth loan with the field partner, Turame.  She intends to use it to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of commercial beer and local beer for resale.  This will increase her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of commercial beer and local beer for resale.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace needs a loan to buy cows for fattening to sell during the peak season of Easter. Her business is cattle sales and milk production where she gets income to support her family. She desires to give her family good permanent house. She is challenged by inadequate capital and the prolonged dry season where animals die due to lack of water and pastures. She requests a loan to buy cows to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Twiyunge I Group

texts.fr:
Médiatrice  fait partie du groupe  Twiyunge I et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 31 ans et est mariée  à Innocente, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  qui   3 étudient.

Elle   fait le commerce du riz, du haricot, de la limonade depuis 5 ans. 

Elle est à son  quatrième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de haricot, et beaucoup de caisse de limonade  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Médiatrice is a member of the 'Twiyunge I' Group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 31 years old and married to Innocente, a farmer.  Together they have three children who all attend school.

Médiatrice has been selling rice, beans and lemonade for five years.  This will be her fourth loan with the field partner, Turame.  She intends to use it to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans and crates of lemonade for resale.  This will increase her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans and crates of lemonade for resale.

loans.name: Ruben Argenis

texts.es:
Rubén es un hombre muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 1 año se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Rubén y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde muy joven sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para su hogar

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Rubén is an enterprising man who has the drive to push forward and make progress. For the past year, he has been selling products through catalogs such as clothes, accessories, beauty products, and household goods. He sells these products mostly to friends, neighbors, and relatives who know him and want to see him succeed in his business.

At a very young age, Rubén felt a great affinity for the retail trade and making sales. Today he has shown great ability in this line of work thanks to his charm and excellent service.

Rubén is requesting a loan so that he can stock up on beauty products and clothes in order to increase his inventory and improve his sales. As a result, he can generate a good household income. He is hopeful of being able to move forward thanks to the assistance from good-hearted people who support these projects that are sponsored by Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and clothes in order to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Felipe Antonio

texts.es: Antonio es un joven alegre, esta cruzando por sus 26 años de edad, tiene su esposa y un hijo de 2 años y una hija de 3 años, Antonio trabaja en una fábrica de lácteos  haciendo productos lácteos  manualmente, Antonio necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar pollos y tenerlos en un corral y comenta que es su esposa quien le da el cuidado a sus  animalitos, ya que ella es quien pasa mas tiempo en la casa, Antonio tiene la aspiración de readecuar sus galpones y comprar mas pollos y asi que su negocio sea mas productivo y con este negocio ayudarse en los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en: Antonio is a happy young man.  He is 26 years old, married, and has a two year old son and a three year old daughter.  Antonio works in a dairy plan making dairy products by hand.  Antonio is in need of money to purchase chickens and raise them.  His wife is the one who takes care of the chickens since she spends more time at home.  Antonio hopes to fix up his barns and purchase more chickens so that he can make his business more productive and pay for his household expenses.

loans.use: purchase chickens.

loans.name: Manuel Gregorio

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Manuel desea iniciar un negocio de cría y levante de pollos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Momil.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar en que vive con su familia.

Se caracteriza por ser un joven alegre y muy colaborador, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda.
Con este préstamo podrá dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de pollos pequeños y en materiales para construcción de un galpon.
texts.en:
Through a lot of drive and perseverance, Manuel hopes to start a business raising chickens in his home, located in the city of Momil.  This idea was born from a need to earn a better income to contribute to his family's household finances.  He is a happy and sociable man, which has enabled him to gain the respect and love of his neighbors.

With this loan, he will be able to start his business.  The money will be used to purchase young chickens and materials to build a barn.

loans.use: purchase small chickens and materials to build a barn.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгуль 43 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование. В качестве источника дохода для семьи Назгуль уже 20 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Начатый со стартовой суммы в 8,000 сом (KGS) бизнес на сегодня приносит хорошую прибыль. В хозяйстве есть 4 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 50 овец. На 4,30 Га земли она выращивает фасоль и ячмень для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупкусемян клевера, удобрений и топлива для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Назгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на поступление дочери в университет.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 43 and married with four children. She has a specialist high school education and has been working in agriculture for 20 years as a source of income for her family. She started her business with 8,000 KGS and currently brings in a good income. She has four dairy cows, two calves and 50 sheep on her farm as well as 4.3 hectares of land where she grows beans and barley for sale.

With the goal of further developing her business, Nazgul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 55,000 KGS to purchase clover seed, fertilizer and fuel to work the soil. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business so that she can save toward sending her daughter to university.

loans.use: to purchase clover seed, fuel and fertilizers to work the soil and grow organic crops

loans.name: Erica Paola

texts.es:
La señora Erica es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerá hija a la cual desea ofrecerle lo mejor. Aprendió del negocio a través de una tía quien le enseño todo lo necesario.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de cosméticos y accesorios para comenzar con la venta.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una madre llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Mrs. Erica is an enterprising and creative woman who for a long time had been wanted to be independent and have her own business selling cosmetics. Currently, she can realize her dreams thanks to her great work capacity, the support she receives from the Interact Corporation, and the people who wish her to succeed with the business. 

Her daughter, to whom she wants to offer the best, will depend on this business. She learned the business through an aunt who taught her everything she needed. 

She is seeking financial support to purchase an assortment of cosmetics and accessories to begin selling. 

With a loan you'll be able to support a mother full of life and give her family a little push!

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of cosmetics and accessories to sell them

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana es una joven de 26 años de edad que desea iniciar un negocio como comerciante, puntos a favor es que ella es una persona muy responsable, tiene buen trato con las personas, tiene una necesidad económica en su hogar, tiene el instinto de protección con sus padres, explico este último, ellos son personas algo enfermas y quiere salir a trabajar para buscar el medio de ser suficiente para mantenerlos y que ellos no deban trabajar más.

Su mayor punto en contra es la falta de experiencia pero espera que este no sea un gran impedimento en su afán por proteger a sus padres.

Solicita un préstamo para Iniciar un negocio de venta de calzado para dama, pues tiene muchas amigas y conocidas a quienes puede ofrecerles, de igual manera esperar comprar surtido en cantidad para ofrecer planes de pago por cuotas  y espera une bendición y ayuda para que su deseo y sueño se haga realidad.
texts.en:
Diana is a 26 year old young woman who wants to start her own business. The advantage is that she is very responsible, has excellent customer service skills, she needs the money for her house, and she wants to support her parents, who are sick. She wants to work to support them and avoid them to have to work more.

The disadvantage could be that she lacks experience, but she hopes this won't stop her from taking care of her parents.

She is requesting the loan to start her business selling footwear for women. She has many female friends and acquaintances to offer them the products. She also wants to buy a big selection so she can offer a payment plan in installments.

She hopes to get the help to make her dream become real.

loans.use: to buy a big selection of footwear.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda is aged 32 years and is a mother of four children. She and her husband make a living through planting corn and sesame, which they have been doing for five years. The current business earns them about 30,000KHR per day.  

This is the third loan for Chenda with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000KHR with VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more crops and sell them for a good price to make her family’s living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Bianca

texts.en:
Bianca is 33 years old. She has a five-year-old daughter. She has been operating her Zoona mobile money business since 2012. This will be Bianca’s third loan. 

Bianca’s business has come a long way since 2012. Back then, she was struggling to serve customers because of a lack of working capital. She was not making enough money to care for her daughter. Then Bianca received her first Kiva loan. This solved her working capital problem, and she was able to serve more customers and earn more income. This allowed her to take her daughter to nursery school, which made her very happy. Bianca then accessed a second loan which she used to finance a trading booth at a new location. She has successfully repaid both loans.

Bianca’s business has grown and become more successful. She has set up two additional outlets and employs three people to help with her business. It makes her very happy to have a positive impact in her community by providing a good service as well as jobs. 

Bianca’s third loan will help her to continue to scale her business. She will be able to operate her outlets more efficiently with the additional capital to service customers. She explains how the growth in her business has translated into more people in the community visiting her shops for money transfers. This increased demand is good but requires her to have more capital to service the need. 

Bianca’s biggest dream is to go back to school and lead as a good example for her daughter. She is hopeful this dream will become reality through her growing business.

loans.use: To fund her existing mobile money shops and serve customers in need of financial services more efficiently

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está soltera y tiene 3 hijos, dos viven con ella y 1 está en Estados Unidos.

Paula, trabaja como encargada de limpieza en una casa, tiene 5 años trabajando en el mismo lugar, antes ella solo atendía su casa, pero la necesidad hizo que ella comenzará a trabajar fuera de ella, el lugar de trabajo está a 10 minutos de su casa y viaja en bus.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar lámina, madera y clavos para hacerle mejoras a su casa, la necesidad de tener terminada su casa será satisfecha.

Sus sueños son, que sus hijos tengan una vivienda digna y que sus hijos en un futuro vivan ahí.
texts.en:
65-year old Paula has a grade 5 education, is single, and has three children, two of whom live with her and another daughter is in the USA. She is responsible for the cleaning of a house, a job she’s had for five years in the same place. Before she only looked after her own house, but then necessity drove her to find work elsewhere. The house where she works is 10 minutes by bus from her own home.

Paula needs a loan to buy roof sheeting, wood, and nails to make repairs to her house. Then she will be able to complete her house.

Her dreams are for her children to have a nice home where they can live in the future.

loans.use: buy roof sheeting, wood, and nails to make repairs to her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
A $ 1,000 loan is offered to Rita to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, water, slippers, candles, milk and fish. She is generating a good income from sales.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in this business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, water, slippers, candles, milk and fish for her general store.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for us to introduce you to one of Ruma’s new agents, Yusuf. Yusuf lives in Indramayu, a city located about four hour’s drive from Jakarta. Yusuf is happily married and together with his wife they have a 3 year-old son. As the main source of income, Yusuf owns and manages a small stall that sell mobile phone sim cards, mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payments service to his community. Yusuf just joined Ruma last month because he wanted to improve his business and he was excited to learn more about mobile technology from the Ruma mobile application. 

Now, Yusuf has become an agent for Ruma’s e-commerce for lower economic communities, called 'Mapan'. By serving Mapan to his customers, Yusuf will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Yusuf will simply send an SMS message in a format to an SMS center; the customer will pay him and a Ruma agent will come to his stall to collect the money. Within 3-5 days the product will be delivered right to customer's door. With Mapan, Yusuf believes that his community will be able to have access to high quality products with better prices and of course, his stall will do more business. 

As seen in the photo, Yusuf is the one who is holding a small notebook, showing Mapan’s home page. He will be thankful for your kind and full support.

loans.use: to provide enhanced mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Famille Songa Group

texts.fr: "Dès notre bas âge, nous sommes convaincu que la culture du café reste la principale source des revenus de Munyidjwi (habitant ou originaire d'Idjwi)car elle aide les familles à couvrir les besoins." dit Bisimwa. Malgré les maladies de plantes et le marché incertain, Bisimwa compte élargir son champ en remplaçant les vieux plants par de plus jeunes dont la production pourra certes jouer positivement sur l'amélioration de la production et ainsi dit de conditions de vie. Il accompagné par son épouse sur la photo.
texts.en: “From our infancy, we were convinced that coffee farming remains the principal source of income of Munyidjwi (a resident or native of Idwi) because it helps the families to meet requirements”, says Bisimwa. Despite the sicknesses of plants and the uncertain market, Bisimwa intends to enlarge his field by replacing old plants with younger ones whose production will certainly be able to play a positive role in improving production and thereby living conditions. He is accompanied by his wife in the picture.

loans.use: to maintain the field

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
La dame qui a le mouton en main sur la photo est Matènè.  Une jeune dame de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, 3 garçons et 2 filles, âgés de 12 à 1 ans, 02 de ses enfants sont scolarisés ; son conjoint est paysan, elle vit en milieu rural au Mali avec sa famille.
Pour soutenir sa famille, elle décide de s’investir dans l’embouche des petits ruminants.
Matènè rêve de la scolarisation de ses enfants et de leur avenir tous les jours ; elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Elle lutte pour le bien-être de sa famille. Elle fait recourt au RMCR pour bénéficier de l’argent pour acheter des moutons. Elle fait l’embouche des petits ruminants, cette activité consiste à acheter les animaux matures, mais maigres,  elle les traite, les engraisse et les revend. Elle s’approvisionne  dans sa localité à travers les commerçants de bétail et revend  au marché communal.
Elle souhaite mettre plus de béliers à l’embouche d’ici la fête de tabaski ou la demande de béliers bien engraissés est à la hausse. C’est la période favorite des emboucheurs, des éleveurs et commerçants de bétails.
Matènè pourrait faire  un bénéfice de 25000fcfa par mois dans son activité.
L’intérêt qu’elle gagne la permet d’épauler son mari dans la prise des dépenses familiales.
Elle exerce l’embouche depuis 10 ans ;  elle constate qu’avec l’aide du service vétérinaire les maladies qui menaçaient son activité sont maitrisées.
texts.en:
The lady holding the sheep in the photo is Matènè, a 35 year old married lady with five children - three boys and two girls.  They are aged between 12 and 1 and two of them attend school.  She lives in the middle of the countryside in Mali with her family; her husband is a farmer.  In order to support her family she decided to invest in fattening small ruminant animals.  Matènè dreams of her children being educated and of their futures every day as she herself did not have the chance to go to school.  She fights for the well-being of her family.  

She has come to RMCR to receive money to buy sheep.  She fattens the small ruminants, which involves buying mature yet weak animals which she treats and resells when they have grown fatter.  She gets her stock from livestock traders in the locality and resells them in the communal market.  

Matènè wishes to provide more fattened rams for the Tabaski festival where the demand for well-fattened rams is at its peak.  it is the favourite time of year for the shepherds and the fatteners and traders of the livestock.  She could make a profit of 25,000 fcfa per month from this activity.  The profit that she will earn would allow her to help her husband with the family expenses.  She has being fattening animals for ten years and notes that with the help of veterinary services she understands the diseases which threaten this activity.

loans.use: to buy sheep and resell them afterwards.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: Charlotte est une femme mariée et âgée de 25 ans. Charlotte vit à Adidogomé avec son enfant. Dans son quotidien, elle vend des plats et des verres cassables dans son quartier. Charlotte trouve son bénéfice pour aider son enfant à s’épanouir mais nécessite encore plus de moyens. Charlotte achète son stock une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des plats et des verres, Charlotte demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et faire plus de revenus
texts.en: Charlotte is married and 25 years old. Charlotte lives in Adidogomé with her child. In her daily life, she sells plates and breakable glasses in her neighbourhood. Charlotte's profits go towards her child's development but she needs more resources. Charlotte buys her stock from the market once a month. Charlotte is requesting this loan in order to buy more plates and glasses and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen plates and 2 dozen breakable glasses.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Babé  est l’homme qui a le bélier en main sur la photo, il est le seul homme dans la photo.
Babé est un  Malien,  marié âgée de 33 ans alphabétisé, qui vie dans un milieu rural avec  sa femme ménagère et ses 06 enfants dont  1 scolarisé. Ses enfants sont  âgés de 1 an à 11 ans. Il est emboucheur ovin. L’activité de Babé consiste à acheter les béliers maigres, les engraisser et les revendre. Babé exerce cette activité depuis  8 ans. II est  ambitieux, motivé et rêve pour le développement de son activité d’embouche et l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille surtout le bien-être des enfants. Pour bien mener son activité il s’approvisionne au marché local, et fait ses ventes  au même marché et environnent, dans cette activité Babé préfère la race Tchadienne qui est facile à entretenir et très sollicité sur le marché. Le fonds qu’il reçoit de RMCR est investi dans l’achat de béliers pour l’embouche. Il peut souvent gagne comme bénéfice 20 000FCFA par tête. Il n’a rencontré aucun problème dans l’ exercice de cette activité.   
NB:Les 07 personnes supplémentaires sont tous membres du groupe, mais n'ont pas pris le prêt cette fois ci .
texts.en:
Babé, the only man in the photograph, is the one holding the ram. He is 33 years old, Malian, literate, and married. He lives in a rural area with his wife, a housekeeper, and his six children, aged 1 to 11. One of his children goes to school.

Babé fattens sheep. He buys meager sheep, fattens them, and then resell them. He's been running this business for the past eight years.

He is very ambitious and motivated, and wishes to develop his business and improve the standard of living of his family, and especially the well-being of his children.

He get the supplies he needs for his business from the local market, and sells at the same market and in the surroundings. Babé prefers to fatten Chadian breed, that is easier to take care of and very much in demand on the market.

The fundings he gets from RMCR will be used to buy rams to fatten. He often turns a profit of XOF 20'000 per animal. So far he didn't experience any problem running this business.

The additional seven people are all members of the group, but they are not part of the current loan.

loans.use: to buy rams to fatten and resell

loans.name: Sedi

texts.en: Sedi is a taxi driver. His family is from Fuzuli city and now live in Fuzuli region, and for 22 years they have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons). Sedi has a lovely family and to provide for his family he works hard. This is Sedi third loan, he closed his loans in time. Now for support his business, therefore he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the tires on his taxi. Sedi says great thanks for the loan and for the help of the Kiva organization. In the future, he wants to replace his car and help his children in their education.

loans.use: to repair the tires on his taxi, increase business. In the future, he wants to replace the car and help his children in their education.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Catalina está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 5 de las 18 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una situación de pobreza extrema, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora.
Ella en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostro un nivel de pobreza extrema, por lo que ella viene luchando y esforzándose cada día por mejorar. Ella tiene un copetín en el que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde en la noche, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas, comestibles, golosinas y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas luchando por ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Santa Catalina” group is conducting a survey for the elimination of poverty, where 5 of the 18 ladies are presently below the poverty line, meaning in a situation of extreme poverty. One of the members is Mrs. Lidia, a very hard working and enterprising woman. In the last poverty survey, she was found to be at an extreme poverty level, which is why she strives and makes the effort to improve every day.

She has a fast food counter where she works every day from very early in the morning, until very late at night, working hard to be able to improve her life condition and that of her family. She is requesting this loan to purchase beverages, groceries, candy and other items, to continue her sales and efforts to assist her family.

loans.use: purchase beverages, groceries, candy and other items

loans.name: Oyrajab

texts.ru: Ойрачаб проживает на районе Сарбанд. Ей 43 года. У нее трое детей. Муж Ойрачаб как и многие мужчины Республики уехали на заработки. Но к сожалению муж Ойрачаб уехал и остался там. Он редко выходит на связь со своей семьей. Ойрачаб старается воспитать своих детей и обеспечить их едой, здравоохранением и учебниками. Поэтому она много работает. Ойрачаб возле дома имеет не большую лавку, где занимается продажей продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров. Также дома она занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день у нее имеется 6 голов мелко рогатых скотов. Она покупает мелких скотин, откармливает их и перепродает на рынке. Ойрачаб много работает  и старается все для детей. И верит, что в будущем финансовое положение семьи улучшится и Ойрачаб поставить детей на ноги и сможет дать им высшее образование.
texts.en:
Oyrajab lives in the Sarband region. She is 43 years old and has three children. Oyrajab's husband, like many other Tajik men, is a migrant worker abroad. Unfortunately Oyrajab's husband went away and stayed there. He is seldom in contact with his family. Oyrajab strives to educate her children and support them with food, healthcare and school books. Therefore she works a lot.

Oyrajab has a small store next to her house. There she sells food products and household goods. She also works with livestock breeding at home. Currently she has six sheep and goats. She purchases them, breeds them and resells them at the market. 

Oyrajab works a lot and tries to give her children everything. She believes that in the future the financial situation of the family will improve and that she will be able to put her children on their feet and give them higher education.

loans.use: to increase her livestock herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piece of land that she's being offered. This property will benefit her family by consolidating their property assets and increasing their living space in the future.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos desde hace 15 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante con su familia, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero como no tiene de suficiente capital por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, ladrillos, laminas, polines, hierro, puertas y pago de mano de obra y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir en un lugar mas cómodo.
texts.en:
Evangelina is 53-years-old and lives in her own home with her family. For 15 years, she has made a living selling snacks; with the money from the sales she has accomplished to move forward with her family.

She wants to improve her home by building a room in the place shown in the photograph, but because she doesn't have sufficient capital she has requested a loan from "INTEGRAL" to purchase the necessary materials like cement, sand, bricks, boards, poles, iron gates and paid labor, so she and her family can live in a more comfortable place.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, boards, poles, iron gates and paid labor

loans.name: Umoja Musoma Musoma Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her early forties, is single and has twelve children who are still at school. She has been selling fish for fourteen years now. She works from 7am to 5pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the fish stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her fish stocks and serve more customers. She dreams of owing a wholesale shop.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group "UMOJA MUSOMA MUSOMA" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her fish stock and serve more customers.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 13 décembre 2011 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants : 01 garçon et 03filles. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des parfums et de l’encense. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter divers parfums d’un montant de 35000f et 02 sceaux encenses à 25000f le sceaux pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la  scolarisation des enfants et participer à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
Created on December 13, 2011 at the inauguration of a “banc villageois”, this group is composed of women who are experienced in the “bancs villageois” program. They share strong bonds of solidarity and mutual assistance. They have, as a principal activity, small businesses. 

Mrs. Mariama (seated at the far right with a raised hand) is the star borrower. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children: 1 boy and 3 girls. Her business consists of buying and reselling perfumes and incense. 

With his new loan, she intends to buy various perfumes for the sum of 35,000f and 2 incense buckets at 25,000f, the buckets to resell in retail in her neighborhood.

With the profits, she intends to support her husband with the schooling of the children and participate in managing the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy various perfumes for the sum of 35,000f and 2 incense buckets at 25,000f, the buckets to resell in retail in her neighborhood

loans.name: Los Puntualitos De Oyara Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PUNTUALITOS DE OYARA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marisol, la socia continua con su  negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para todos sus cliente que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, arroz entre otros.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por  motivos de trabajo.
  Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
