The members belong to the group  “LOS PUNTUALITOS DE OYARA”.  This group is located in the district of Vilcabamba, in the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

The member Marisol will continue her business of a grocery store and she also sells trout.  She thanks those who form part of this dream through this program, and promises to make her repayments in the established timeline.  She will continue selling necessary products like rice, sugar, milk, and others that her clients request, as it is in this way that she helps her family move ahead.  

The member requests this loan to buy milk, rice and other things.  

The members who are in the attached photos had permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work responsibilities.  The other members make a living in agricultural sales, fruit sales, grocery stores and food sales.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, and others.

loans.name: Nozimjon

texts.en:
Nozimjon is a bright student. He was born in 1995 to a family of workers. His family is big and his father tries to educate his children. In order to educate his children, he flies to the Russian Federation to get a job and earn money. They had a hard period of living. 

Norimjon successfully graduated from high school. His older brother studies abroad and all saved up money was spent on him. Somehow, Nozimjon entered university. His dream has now become true as he is studying at university. The family does not have money to pay his university tuition fees. He decided to request a loan from Kiva to pay for his studies.

loans.use: to pay his school fees.

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA 2008” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Rosa sigue dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua preparando diferentes tipos de comida como arroz con pollo, saltados entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tejidos, comida, lubricantes de carros, ropa y otros brindan servicios profesionales.
La socia que sale adjunta a  la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Fuerza 2008”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

One of the members is Rosa. She continues to manage a restaurant business. Rosa appreciates those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her loan payments according to the established terms. She continues to prepare different types of dishes such as chicken and rice, stir-fries, and other foods that all of her customers request. Rosa wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, oil, meats, and other supplies.

The other group members have businesses that involve selling woven goods, preparing food, selling automobile lubricants, selling clothes, and providing professional services.

The member who appears in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meats, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas among other things

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 47 years old; she is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and three children. She is a farmer who plants vegetables and root crops.

Florida wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in their home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie, 42, is married to a farmer and blessed with six children. For the past four years she has grown and sold vegetables and earns a net income of PHP 100 a day.
Menchie is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP through ASKI to buy seedlings of eggplants, string beans, red peppers, and squash to grow and sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to be ever more profitable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings of eggplants, string beans, red peppers, and squash to grow and sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a sari-sari store owner from Leyte, Philippines. She is a widow and has five children. Rosita operates her sari-sari, or retail store, business by selling various goods and foodstuffs to the people in her place. Rosita has been in the business for more than 20 years now. 

Rosita is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments and other items. A loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

n the future, Rosita has hopes of making her business a success and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments and other items

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old, male, and married. He supports one child, aged 4 years.

John has been running a retail shop as well as electronic appliances shop for eight years now. He is taking his second loan with VisionFund Kenya to purchase retail stock like sugar, salt, cooking oil and maize flour inorder to sell to his customers.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to expand his current business.John's hopes and dreams for the future are to grow into large scale farming and have sustainable income.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil and maize flour

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 40 years old. She is married with three children. She has had a green grocer business for five years. She makes a monthly income of Kes 8,000. 

Susan has applied for a loan of KES 15,000 which she will be using to purchase vegetables and fruits and hopes this will help her to open a multi-grocery.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children and open a multi-grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 48-year-old mother from Kakamega, Kenya. She supports three people in her family and is blessed with four children, who are 5, 18, 19 and 20 years old.

Nancy has a hardware shop where she sells general goods for construction, a business she has had for the last 5 years.

She has applied for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to add more stock of timber and rolling mills. She will plow the anticipated profit back into the business.

Her dream is to prosper and give her children the best education.

loans.use: to add more stock of timber and rolling mills.

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en:
Stephene is 50 years old and married. He has four children aged 16, 13, 10 and 1 month old respectively, whom he supports. 

Stephene has been keeping livestock for 10 years now. This has enabled him to supply milk to his customers as well as selling to other livestock traders. He is taking his first loan to purchase animal feeds and goats for sell. 

He intends to use anticipated profits to educate his children and provide for the needs of his family. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business, make more income and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds and goats and hopes this will enable him to sell more milk and livestock to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kelvins

texts.en:
Kelvin is a 22 year old man from Kisumu region which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is a married man and supports two people in his family, he has two children who are 3 years and a month old respectively.

He operates a motorcycle transport, a business which he has been doing for the last four years, and gets a monthly income of KES 25,000.

He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to service his motorbike and replace old spares. He will use the anticipated income to expand his business.

His dream is to own more than three motorbikes.

loans.use: to service his motorbike and replace old spares

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Washington is a 26-year-old man from Kisumu region, which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is a married man and supports two people in his family. He has one kid who is 3 years old.

He operates a motorcycle transport business, a business he has been doing for the last 12 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 4,000. 

He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to service his motorbike. He will use the anticipated income to expand his business.

His dream is to be the most preferred biker.

loans.use: to service his motorbike

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 27-year-old man from Kisumu. He is married and supports three people in his family.

He operates a butchery, a business he has been doing for the last five years. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to add stock of meat. 

He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to add stock of meat

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 28 years old, female and married. She has two children who are four and two years old.

Rebecca has been running a salon business for three years now, making good profits. 

She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya to purchase beauty cosmetics for her customers. 

With the anticipated profits, Rebecca will be able to expand her current business. Her hopes and dream is to have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase beauty cosmetics for her customers

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 26-year-old man from Kisumu. He is married and supports two people in his family.

Geoffrey is an electrician who is self employed, a business he has been doing for the last three years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 35,000, 

Geoffrey has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase electronic appliances. He will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase electronic appliances

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a 38-year-old lady from Katito, Kenya. She is married and supports seven people in her family. She currently has no child.
 
Marlene has a salon, a business she has operated for the last four years, generating a monthly income of KES 18,000.

She has applied for her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase additional beauty products like hair extensions, hair oils and shampoo.She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business.

Her dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help with the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. It is important that her tricycle is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service and steady income. Part of the loan she will use to add more groceries to sell at her store. She is thanking God and you in advance for continually supporting her business for it surely helps fund their everyday needs and the school requirements of her children.

Alicia dreams of being more successful in all her businesses, which includes her store and billiard pool business. She aims to send her children to good schools to ensure them a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit and to bolster her other businesses.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 49 years old and blessed with six children. He has been in a barber shop business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

Mathew has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow. This will enable him get more income from the milk sales and thus add more barber cutting machines so as to expand his business and meet his clients' demands. 

Mathew plans to use the generated profits to repay his loan and start a retail shop. 

His future hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Novel

texts.en:
Novel is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan previously which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Her store earnings helped meet their daily living needs. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods, which she will then sell retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source which sustains her family's personal and household needs. Aside from her store, she also operates a tricycle. 

Novel dreams of having a bigger general store and of owning a jeepney as another vehicle for transport services. She would like to save enough money for her old age. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
This is Liberty, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines.  Her husband is Marcelino, a cook, and she is a mother of five. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Liberty operates a barbecue stall. She regularly buys pork, meats and chicken entrails that she prepares to cook and sell in the afternoon in her barbecue stand near her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, pork, and other products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Liberty dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional raw ingredients like meats, pork, and other products that she needs to operate her barbecue stall.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 43 years old with three children. With two children still in school, Nenita works very hard to provide for her family.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, soft drinks, coffee and sugar to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 4 years. 

She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, soft drinks, coffee and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, who works hard to support her family, has had a food vending business in the Philippines for 21 years now. She repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new one for PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her enterprise.

Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 45 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 6 and 23 years. They all go to school. She sells goats and she has been in this business for the past 2 years. Her husband is a motorcyclist. 

Since she enjoys the goat business,With the loan she would like to buy more goats for sell.And with the profits from the business she would like to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy goats for sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 31-year-old farmer who wants to start commercial poultry farming in Kaisagat, a village in the Kitale area of Kenya. The father of one has been in the farming business for over five years, keeping poultry and cattle and growing maize and other crops. Robert enjoys farming. The few poultry he currently keeps are enough to supply his family with eggs all year. The few times they ended up with more than they wanted, they sold door-to-door or at the farm's gate.

Robert is seeking a loan to venture into commercial poultry farming. He is planning to use the chickens for eggs and meat, and he will raise his own chicks. The male chicks will be raised for meat, while the female will be kept for egg production, to be sold at the market. The income Robert makes from this investment will not only go toward the loan repayment but also business and personal expenses. He strives to provide the best for his family in order to improve their quality of life. Help him out!

loans.use: To buy poultry for his farming business.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is 44 years old.She is married with six children aged 2 and 19,  and five of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 20 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for rice.With the profits from the business she would like to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 38-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom go to school. Residing in Kasese, Uganda, she has been selling matooke (bananas), fish and palm oil for 14 years to generate income for her family.

Racheal is requesting this loan to buy more matooke to sell. Hardworking but hampered by insufficient capital, she dreams of expanding her business and buying land for her family.

loans.use: to buy more matooke for selling.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is 33 years old. She is married with five children aged between 5 and 15 years; all of them go to school. 

She owns a hardware shop and she has been in this business for the past 15 years, while her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more spare parts for sell in order to expand her business. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sell

loans.name: Mónica María

texts.es:
Monica es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.
Todo comenzó hace unos meses cuando trabajaba como operaria en un taller de confección; hoy en día, a sus 43 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 1 empleo directo; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de camisas; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina fileteadora e hilos, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Monica sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Monica is a small businesswoman who is dedicated and hard working. Her field of work is dressmaking; she offers the service to third parties.

All of this began some months ago when she was working as an operator in a dressmaking workshop. Today, at 43 years of age, she has her own workshop that generates one direct job. She works every day, and her strength is making shirts. In this way, she generates enough resources to support her husband with the household finances.

The loan she requests will be invested in buying an overlock sewing machine and thread. Thus, she will be able to meet her clients’ needs and deliver the orders in a timely manner, with the goal of increasing her production and acquiring new contracts, which will allow her to provide continuity to her small business. 

Monica dreams of continuing to strengthen her workshop and of having more production everyday to generate new job opportunities and improve the quality of her and her family’s life, like that of the people who influence her work daily.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and thread for her workshop.

loans.name: Umusingi Group

texts.en:
Claudine is a group leader.  She is aged 26 and single. 

Her group is called Umusingi, which means “Foundation” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She sells food stuffs and has been doing in a business for the past 13 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, beans, and potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a new house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María de 45 años de edad, residente de santa Catarina Ixtahuacan Sololá, está profundamente agradecida por el primer préstamo que en ADICLA se le otorgo, pues gracias a este crédito ella logro ampliar su negocio de venta de ropa típicas, con esta ampliación mejoro sus ingresos pero también mejoro las condiciones de vida de su familia y así logro pagar su préstamo, pero maría con el afán de seguir superando con su negocio, ella ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo que lo invertirá comprando una variedad de ropas típicas para su exclusiva venta. María tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el préstamo, para que su negocio siga incrementando.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and a resident of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan Sololá. She is deeply grateful for the first loan she received from ADICLA. Thanks to this loan, she was able to expand her business of selling traditional clothing. As a result, her income and her family’s living conditions improved. She was able to repay the loan.

In an effort to keep ahead with her business, María is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in the purchase of a variety of traditional clothes that she will sell exclusively. She has hopes of securing this new loan so that her business can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yostina

texts.en:
A loan of $800 is offered to Yostina to improve her business. She has a guest house where many people come to her guest house every night. 

She will buy sand and cement to repair her house. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Yostina independent, because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sand and cement

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen  is a 43-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 6 children. She is running a business of making woolen items. She weaves caps, sweaters and bed sheets at home, to sell in the market. Currently, she has requested for a loan amount of 45000 PKR. She wants to use this amount  to purchase wool yarns in different colors to earn more income in the future for covering her household expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase wool yarns in different colors to earn more income in the future for covering her household expenses efficiently.

loans.name: Gaby Jose

texts.es:
Gaby es un joven de 21 años de edad, le gusta el emprendimiento, tener sus recursos, ser independiente rebuscarse su propio sustento y antes de recibir algo de sus padres ayudarles con algún capital en forma de agradecimiento por todos los años de cuidado y las enseñanzas que le han inculcado.

Él trabaja en un terreno de los previos de su padre el negocio de la cría de cerdos y cuando puede le ayuda a su padre con el trabajo duro, es muy proactivo y con ganas de hacer bien las cosas.

Gaby quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 12 lechones y cuido para alimentarlos, su idea es tener un negocio fijo y demostrarse a sí mismo que no necesita de la herencia que le puede dejar su padre, que puede montar su propio imperio agrícola, buscando recursos para irse a vivir junto con su pareja con la que quiere tener muchos hijos y una vida tranquila, rodeado de los suyos y del campo.
texts.en:
Gaby is a 21-year old young man.  He likes business ventures, having his own resources, being independent and searching out his own livelihood.  Rather than receiving anything from his parents, he wants to help them with some capital as a form a thanks for all the years they took care of him and for the lessons they instilled in him. 

Gaby works land that was in his father's family.  His business is raising pigs, and when he can, he helps his father with his harder labors.  Gaby is very proactive and wants to do things well. 

Gaby wants to request a loan to purchase twelve pigs and animal feed for them.  His plan is to have a solid business and to prove to himself that he doesn't need the inheritance that his father could leave him.  Gaby wants to start his own agricultural empire.  He will find the resources he needs to go and live with his partner, with whom he wants to have a lot of children and a tranquil life surrounded by his loved ones and the countryside.

loans.use: to purchase 12 piglets and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is applying for a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin).She is married and she has one child. She is 21 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, body loosen, biscuits, soap and shampoo.She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 

Maria is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy slippers, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, body loosen, biscuits, soap and shampoo

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group-D

texts.en: Mukta, the lady standing on the left in the photo, is a 32-year-old who lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and two children in a village in the Koraput district of Odisha, India. Her children go to a government school near her house. She is engaged in a tailoring business from which she is earning 4,000 INR per month. She has applied for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, and cloth so that she can give tailoring training to others and can make some extra money. She hopes to educate her children and wants to give them a better standard of living. Suday is a 28-year-old woman who has two children and is also engaged in the same (tailoring) activity.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, and cloth.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel paid hist first loan on time and is now asking for a second loan to buy some materials for his bakery and part to refurbished his bakery.

He continues to work in his bakery and has shown to be creditworthy, by paying his first loan on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake bread and to refurbished his bakery.

loans.name: Odilio

texts.en: Odilio lives in a community of the department of Atlantida Honduras. He owns a grocery store (Pulperia) since 40 years ago, He has been engaged at service of his community, age 58 years; He is single. Odilio is requesting a loan to buy a solar-powered highest efficiency refrigeration systems from Soluz Honduras that will allow  him to have a better lifestyle, and a significant growth in the business. He is often providing new options for food in a community that would otherwise have no refrigeration to offer foods such as milk and cheese.

loans.use: To buy a solar-powered highest efficiency refrigeration systems

loans.name: Famille Lulibulira Group

texts.fr: A 14 ans, Jean a été instruit à la culture du café tenant compte de circonstances politiques du moment encourageant d'apprendre aux enfants cette activité. Le café permet un accès facile à un prêt auprès de privés. Grâce à l'action de PAIDEK et à celle de la coopérative des caféiculteurs de la place, ils pourront vendre leurs produits à un prix raisonnable sans beaucoup trop de précipitation allant à leur défaveur. Il est sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en: At 14 years old, Jean was educated about coffee culture, aware of political circumstances at the time encouraging teaching young people this business. The coffee business provides easy access to a loan with private organizations. Thanks to the help of PAIDEK and the local coffee growers' collective, they will be able to sell their products for a reasonable price without too many consequences playing against their business. Jean is with his wife in the picture.

loans.use: for hoeing three fields.

loans.name: Dimonti Group

texts.fr: Il y a 8 ans que Samuel s'est lancé dans l'agriculture après constat que les caféiculteurs évoluent positivement tenant compte du rendement qu'ils perçoivent. C'est une culture continuelle dont les plantes vieillissent  après plusieurs années d'exploitation. Il trouve que les travaux qu'exigent le café sont répétififs au cours d'une même saison mais il tient bon dans le but de préparer un futur meilleur pour lui et sa famille. Il pose sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en: Samuel started working in agriculture 8 years ago after a report that coffee growers are positively evolving, taking into account the perceived yield. It is a continuous sort of farming, in which the plants mature after several years of cultivation. Samuel finds the work that the coffee demands repetitive during the same season, but he holds up well with the goal of preparing for a better future for him and his family. He is standing with his wife in the picture.

loans.use: To pay workers for hoeing and harvesting.

loans.name: Tulaga Muruaki Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand is Francis. He is 60 years old, married, and living with the wife and his seven children who are in school. 

Francis is a mixed farmer who farms potatoes and cabbages. He has applied for a Kiva loan to purchase manure to boost the productivity of his farm and hence have more stock and income, which will help him pay for his children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase manure to boost the productivity of his farm and hence have more stock and income

loans.name: Mrs. Dum’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Dum was selected to be group leader for a loan that is requested from Maxima. In the group there are three members and they are in a village in Ponhea Leou district, Kandal Province, Cambodia.

1-Dum (pictured) is 65 years old. She lives at Ponhea Leou district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has one son. He is a monk. Dum has been a farmer for fifteen years in her experience.  Dum is applying for a loan of $250 to repair her house.

2- Chenda (shown in photo) is 23 years old. She lives at Ponhea Leou district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 2013. She has no child yet.   Chenda is a sewer of fabric for herself with one year in her experience, while her husband is in the same her work with one year too in his experience.  She is applying for a loan of $250 to purchase more fabric to support her business.


Photo: Dum is on the right hand of the group members.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as tiles, mortar, and dividers, so she can change the floor of her home

loans.name: Sytha

texts.en:
Sytha is a 57-year-old married homemaker with an only dependent child. She lives in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Her husband is a retired soldier and also a motorcycle taxi driver. Her child is a worker. Her husband and her child can make around $10 per day. 

Sytha would like to request a loan because she is short of finances to buy a motorcycle for her child to use to commute to work. With this loan, she will have enough money to buy a motorcycle and improve her child's traveling conditions. In the future, she wants to build fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a minimum wage earner. She realized how difficult it is to survive when totally dependent on her meager salary. She made an additional income selling dry goods. She can easily bring her stock to her office and make good sales. Now, she wants to expand her business. She applied for a loan to purchase inventories in bulk to increase her income. She will double her effort as her children are growing old and require more financial support for their educations. In the future, she hopes to acquire a motor unit for easy transport of her stocks.

loans.use: to purchase additonal stock of clothes

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Training provided by IMON to women entrepreneurs helps many women in Tajikistan. One of the participants of that training was Munira. She is an active, creative, communicative and responsible person. Munira is 29 years old and lives in the district. She is married and has three children. 

Her gained information at training that helped her to choose what kind of business to open. She decided to open a new business of selling and buying bed linens and towels. Munira wants to realize her idea to open a new business. She requested a loan to buy the first needed goods like towels and bed linens to start up of her new business. She awaits Kiva lenders mercy.

loans.use: to buy towels and bed linens.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en:
Akmal is an active man. He was born in 1973. He has a family and lives in a village. He is a taxi driver and drives passengers from the village to the city and back. He has regular clients every day and is well known among drivers. He has been doing this work for about eight years and knows his duties well. He is a well-mannered, responsible, and honest person.

Akmal has three children who need to be educated. He is not earning enough money to pay their tuition fees and finds it difficult to pay for their university education. He needs to pay tuition fees for two of his children. He hopes that Kiva lenders will help him.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for his children

loans.name: Martir Alfredo

texts.es: Mártir de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su compañera de vida, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en la actividad, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: 53-year-old Mártir lives in his own house with his two children and his partner. He makes a living by growing maize and sorghum. He has more than 10 years of experience doing this work. He sells his produce in the areas surrounding the place where he lives. He manages to settle some of his household expenses with what he obtains from his sales. He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, compost, pesticides, herbicides, etc. He will also improve the land shown in the photograph; in this way, he will be able to continue with his work, which generates a good income for him.

loans.use: to improve his land and buy seeds, fertilisers, compost, pesticides, herbicides, etc

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 46 years old and from Kakamega County. He is married to Mary, who sells vegetables in the same county. They have eight children of ages between 3 and 16 years respectively.

Fredrick sells cereals, a business he has run for the last 11 years earning a monthly income of KES 17,300. He is taking his sixth loan of KES 50,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which he intends to use to buy more sacks of cereal like maize, beans and cassava.

With the anticipated income, he will be able to provide the basic needs for his family, educate his children as well as increase his savings at VisionFund Kenya. 

His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of cereal like maize, beans and cassava.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years  from Kisumu. She is married to Sidiga who is a farmer and supports the family. She supports four people in her family and was blessed with three children who are 20, 16 and 12 years old respectively.

She has a computer services stall which has been operating for the last five years and generates a monthly income of KES 5800. She has applied for the third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase computer appliances.

She will use the anticipated profits to increase her stock.

Her dream is to run a wholesale business and build a nice home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase computer appliances
